Prologue

Progress Report

Edited by: Censored, MoreThanTom

Proofread by: OrangeRazor

「Talk about being mischievous, Granbell-sama. You almost got me killed out there.」

   

「Surely you jest. Didn’t you already flee before getting affected at all?」

 

「Can that really be helped? Have you not received the report from my subordinate?」

 

「I guess I did——」

   

「That demon was a monster beyond my imagination. It won’t matter even if the Empire sends out their regular army. And judging from my knowledge, there wouldn’t be a chance to win without using the Emperor’s Royal Guard. By the way——」

These are exchanges between Damrada and Granbell. Sitting on chairs opposite each other, the two casually try to pry into each other’s minds.

Damrada, noticing that the battle plan has failed, decided to distance himself from the Rosso family until the tide settles. Negotiation could have been more favourable for him had the plan been a success. Yet now that it has failed, the Rosso may deliberately use this as an excuse to pose obstacles for him. That’s why Damrada wanted to bail out and start over.

However, the situation has changed. When Damrada was on his way to Tempest Federation, someone reported to him through 「Magic Communication」.

「Hinata was defeated. And she seemed to have made peace with the Demon Lord.」

Among the many outcomes he had predicted, this was the worst possible scenario.

   

Hinata is still alive and the Western Nations are still under the influence of the Western Saints Church. It will be much more difficult to do business there now. Moreover, since Hinata has made peace with Demon Lord Rimuru, it will be challenging to instigate Rimuru into trying to kill her again. Damrada only initiated the plan because his interests aligned with Granbell’s, yet he could conclude now that the plan has completely failed.

   

——But considering this from another perspective, it may be beneficial.

 

Although the plan has failed, it didn’t cause any grave loss to Damrada. While he may have lost a venue for business in the Western Nations, there are still other channels for making profits. 「Cerberus」 is a huge secret organization and has several trade unions as its cover.

Besides, Damrada has no interest in whether Hinata lives or not. That’s why he isn’t that angry at Granbell’s miscalculation. His goal here in fact, was to exploit the outcome to secure a favourable position for himself in future negotiations.

 

Coming to that conclusion, Damrada changed his plan on the spot and decided to drop by to greet Granbell.

   

「——Granbell-sama’s plan did sound a lot better in theory. While failing to take care of Hinata is one thing, allowing her to build a friendly relationship with Demon Lord Rimuru is another issue altogether ……」

 

Based on these reasons, Damrada avoids taking responsibility and shifts the blame on Granbell’s group.

   

However, Granbell has likely seen this coming.

   

「Right, I can’t deny that. This upset in the balance of power can’t be reversed at this point in time. The great historic kingdom of Falmus will eventually fall, and a new kingdom will be built on its ruins. It will be all according to Demon Lord Rimuru’s wishes, also meaning that your plan is a goner.」

   

Granbell unapologetically agrees with Damrada’s accusation, continuing to point out his perceptions of the situation.

Damrada’s silence is his response that he also agrees with Granbell’s views.

 

「What do you plan to do next then?」

「In regards to what exactly?」

 

「Demon Lord Rimuru’s goal seems to be to turn the Jura Great Forest into an economic hub. It is something that us Rosso will not permit.」

 

「MmmHmm……」

   

Damrada begins to consider Granbell’s words as he finishes.

He isn’t planning on being hostile with the Rosso either. It is in both of their interests to let go of any resentment between them.

Granbell is of the same mind. Moreover, he seems to be looking farther into the future than Damrada.

   

「Do we stand to gain anything with this in-fighting? Right now we simply don’t have the strength to make a blatant move against Demon Lord Rimuru or Hinata the Saint. Don’t you agree?」

Granbell continues, seemingly seeing through Damrada’s thoughts.

 

「Hehehe. I’ve totally been bested, Granbell-sama. Yes indeed, there’s no value in arguing who is to blame. We will continue our friendly relationship with the gentlemen of the Five Elders as always. Here’s where I stand - though it may be true that we didn’t profit from the war, that’s a whole different story. As long as we live, we are left with opportunities.」

「As expected of Damrada-dono; it’s great that you are so reasonable. Then let’s unite to prevent the emergence of a new trade bloc on that land.」

There’s no need for further explanation of Granbell’s intent. He is trying to safeguard the power he wields in the Western Nations. Granbell’s trump card, Mariabell, has foreseen the birth of a new trade bloc centered around the Jura Great Forest. If left undealt, the influence of the Rosso will no doubt be diminished.

How can Granbell allow such a flaw after spending more than a thousand years building up this system of domination? For this reason, Granbell plans to crush this flaw by interfering with Demon Lord Rimuru. Right now he is no longer part of the 「Seven Celestial Sages」 and can no longer act under the name of the God Ruminas. That’s why, no matter what, he will require the aid of the organization Damrada’s party belongs to——「Cerberus」.

Granbell’s kin——The five other elders from his family——also support this proposal.

They each secretly influenced the Western State Council to prolong the aftermath of the civil unrest in Farmus. Even though they can’t stop the enthronement of the new Farmus king, they’ll at least try to stall for as much time as possible.

There are some other 「Aces」that the Rosso have hidden, but it is still too early to show their hand yet. With that being the case, it is only wise to properly make use of 「Cerberus」.

   

This is the ideal plan on Granbell’s mind.

However——

「Well, hold on just one sec.」

Damarada doesn’t intend to follow through with Granbell’s proposal.

The Rosso and the five elders leading them——These people are amazing business partners —— he’d be lying if he claims to not want to maintain a tie with them. But, they are gravely mistaken if they think that Damrada would listen to everything they say.

Damrada is a businessman after all. He gets paid to do things, and his thoughts are ever-changing. There are trade blocs in both the East and the West. 「Cerberus」 was able to accumulate great wealth by getting hold of these trade routes, so it’s more beneficial for 「Cerberus」to have as many different trading partners as they can. Thus, it won’t matter to Damrada even if the influence of the Five Elders drops in the Western Nations.

   

「——I speak from my heart when I say that I hope we remain on good terms in the future. But, I can’t help but disagree with what Granbell-sama just said. After all, we have no reason to antagonize Demon Lord Rimuru.」

 

Damrada says, looking Granbell in the eye.

「Damn brat……」

 

「Hehehe, this is but my respectful response to your proposal. Hinata had already found me to be suspicious, so it won’t be that simple to continue our activities in the Western Nations. I will have to return to my homeland and send a replacement for myself.」

Had you eliminated Hinata as promised, I wouldn’t be tied up like this——While insulting Granbell with this implication, Damarada also refused to comply with his demand.

   

「.......」

「We’ll continue the part of our business in trade as usual. But let us just pretend like all of this never happened.」

Leaving these words, Damrada rises up from his seat.

Granbell, having missed the mark with his proposal, cannot simply argue back at Damrada anymore. The organization known as 「Cerberus」 is way too powerful in the underworld of the Eastern Empire. Angering any one of its leaders, such as Damrada, would lead to a splinter in their relationship. It will be too huge a loss for the Rosso at this point in time.

 

「....... It can’t be helped. Then leave this matter to us. Just don’t hold us back.」

「That’s for certain. Do put your trust in us considering our relation so far.」

Damrada answers with a smile and departs after giving a polite bow.

   

His sincere attitude makes him appear as an honest merchant, but had Hinata been eliminated, he would be long gone to go and garner Demon Lord Rimuru’s support. Then he would simply weigh the benefits between the Rosso and Demon Lord Rimuru and wait to profit.

The fact that he is able to achieve this under everyone’s nose shows that Damrada of 「Wealth」 is not just for show.

Yet Granbell is also a cunning man who has accumulated his fair share of experience. He already understands half of Damarada’s intent. Their party is probably not going to hold the Rosso back just as Granbell proposed, but he can’t know for sure whether Damrada would do business with Demon Lord Rimuru or not.

 

But Damrada is rather upstanding as a merchant, for he does not lie.

Though in the eyes of Granbell, the ruler and head of Rosso, Damrada’s attitude is unacceptable.

「——How unpleasant. You dared to exploit our failure. We will take care of you all by the time this whole ordeal concludes.」

   

Granbell’s mutters echo in the room after Damrada left.

His eyes, dyed with the color of humiliation; A surge of furious flame emerges and gradually consumes his eyes……

    ***

「——And just like that, I made the deal with the Five Elders.」

Damrada reports to the young man casually sitting on the chair.

「Is that so? It’s great that our tie with the Rosso is finally settled as you expected. Now we can ensure a channel of communication with them in the future.」

 

Although Damrada maintained an arrogant composure when negotiating with the Rosso, he appears rather humble in front of the young man.

But that is only natural, for this young man is Damrada’s boss, and commander in chief of the secret organization 「Cerberus」.

The young man nods leisurely after hearing Damrada’s reports.

「I see. Having said that, those bastards are the type to force the quest to take on that type of monster on me without even providing any information…….」

 

「Ahaha, I guess our luck is down. But it is probably the most fortunate in this whole unlucky ordeal that you were able to retreat in time.」

「Hehehe, indeed. How lucky. Was he called Diablo or something? He could rival that Primordial White (Blanc) that rampages in the Empire - such a terrifying demon. It shows that Demon Lord Rimuru is not the only threat.」

   

「I suppose you can put it that way…… The speed at which Demon Lord Rimuru seems to accumulate strength is much faster than our reorganization…….」

   

「Indeed. That Demon Lord has incredibly good luck. Not only did he gather a group of powerful Majins under his reign, he even tamed that 『Storm Dragon』——」

 

「Honestly, it would be the worst option to confront that kind of power head-on.」

   

「No chance of winning——Although I wouldn’t go so far as to call him unbeatable. 『Cerberus』 would definitely collapse if we came into conflict.」

「Regardless, there is no use in rushing. Since there’s still time, we should take our time to think about it.」

   

「That should be pretty appropriate. This chaotic situation may last for quite a while, and we may suffer some losses from striking under such a circumstance.」

 

「You have a point. I tried to intimidate them by using Hinata…… But that strategy has failed as well. It is best that we stay quiet for a while before we dig ourselves into a deeper hole.」

 

The young man comments jokingly and agreed to Damrada’s opinion with some thoughts in mind. Suddenly, Damrada seems to have recalled something and begins to complain.

 

「By the way, the Five Elders sure brag a lot. They promised to eliminate Hinata the Saint, and look how that ended up. Both Demon Lord Rimuru and Hinata survived safe and sound with even their misunderstanding resolved! There probably won’t be any more misunderstandings between the Western Saints Church and Tempest Federation…….」

   

Damrada says in quite the frustrated tone. To that, the young man replied with a wry smile:

「That’s within my expectations as well. I suspected that Demon Lord Rimuru would be too naive and wouldn’t want to kill Hinata. If things had gone smoothly, that naivety would have destroyed him. I was even looking forward to it…… but it appears that he’s not as naive as I thought.」

   

「The Five Elders seemed to plan to suppress the『Storm Dragon』, and it appeared that they intended to collaborate with Demon Lord Rimuru.」

 

「We wouldn’t be in such a bind had things gone that smoothly. I ordered careful surveillance expecting this failure.」

   

「I see, so that’s the case. But speaking of which, I was saved thanks to it. If you didn’t contact me then, I would have run into Hinata the Saint before she went to find Demon Lord Rimuru.」

 

They could have kept their identity a secret if lucky, but it’s simply wishful thinking considering that Hinata is their opponent. That’s why Damrada is very grateful towards the young man who sensed the danger and informed him beforehand. With that being said, there would be no danger of being exposed had the young man not tasked Damrada with lying to her in the first place.

But such matters are trivial to Damrada. As the commander in chief of 「Cerberus」, the young man’s orders take priority over anything else.

After all, the young man who formed the secret organization 「Cerberus」aims to dominate. He wishes to conquer the entire world.

 

Damrada resonates with his ambition and greatly admires him. Even though he would laugh such a notion off in normal circumstances, Damrada has a hunch that the young man can make this a reality. That’s why he does not doubt the young man’s order.

   

The young man responds to Damrada frankly.

「My plans would have been wasted had I lost you as well.」

 

「Well, I’ll at least try to figure out a way to escape if I really run into a life or death situation like that.」

Damrada replies with a proud smile after seeing the young man’s concern for him.

「One can’t just become a leader of 『Cerberus』with money alone. They must also have tenacious strength, enough to at least back themselves up in order to convince the many powerful men in the underworld.」

   

The young man also seems to know that, so he replies with a mocking grin.

   

「Ahaha, but seriously, don’t go all out yet. It should be the last resort anyway. Right now let’s just enjoy observing this wrestling game from afar without brute force.」

 

Going all out——in other words, if 「Cerberus」were to give everything they had, it would require the presence of the other two leaders. When that happens, it will no longer just be gentle manipulations in the background, instead, it will likely lead to the outbreak of a great war involving all of the Western Nations.

As the commander in chief, the young man doesn’t want things to develop like that. Damrada is very aware of it as well, so he answers without hesitation.

「Then it is perhaps best for me to return to my motherland first.」

   

「Right, that would be even better. Even though you weren’t spotted by anyone, it’s  Hinata we’re talking about here. She probably already has her eyes on you. It will be more difficult for you to act in public, so it would be best for you to find yourself a replacement. With that being said——」

 

Damrada already knows what the young man is going to say. The issue is concerning one of the other two leaders of 「Cerberus」 who share a similar status as Damrada.

「Don’t get Vega here.」

That’s why he can understand why the young man would make such an order.

「Understood. Then I shall ask Misha[1] to replace me.」

「Good, go do just that.」

「Wealth」, 「Women」, 「Power」—— Each leader has a title that symbolizes a man’s desire.

Misha of 「Women」 has a personality one cannot be careless with, but at least she can be communicated with. On the other hand, Vega of 「Power」 can be a difficult one to deal with. Just like his title 「Power」 symbolizes, he himself is also violence personified.

 

Vega would completely ignore Damrada’s order for he only obeys those made by the young man in person. He is well aware of this as well, which is why he doesn’t want Damrada to deal with such troubles.

「Then I shall proceed as you wish. By the way, what resolution do you see fit for the slave trade business I’ve been promoting here (the West)?」

「......I almost forgot about it. It’d be too troublesome to deal with it, so just let the 『Slave Trade Union (Orthrus)』 under your management bankrupt on its own. I hate slavery anyway.」

 

「Hmm, I don’t object, but some rare monsters were supposed to be transferred to Misha’s 『House of Whores (Echidna)』[2], should we release them as well? Moreover——」

「No, it’s business as usual for confidential merchandise. It’s only natural for us not to waste such things after all the effort we spent maintaining a window of communication with the Rosso.」

「Understood. Then, please leave the rest to me.」

With that being said, Damrada leaves the location.

The young man closes his eyes and delightfully plays a game of chess in his mind. It is then that sharp footsteps reach his ears.

A smile emerges on his face as he turns his back to speak to a secretary looking woman.

「Did you catch all that, Kazaream?」

「Loud and clear, boss. But why did you want to dismantle the 『Slave Trade Union』?」

 

The person who has arrived is Kazaream. She (He) is the trusted companion and consultant to the young man.

 

「Very simple. I wish to sell 『Him』 a favour this time.」

「Is that the only reason?」

   

「Isn’t it obvious? The whole of the Jura Great Forest is now under that Slime’s rule. He will definitely ruin our business if we continue to hunt monsters there. If that’s the case, wouldn’t it be more beneficial for us to close shop early?」

 

「I see. That does seem to be the case. It’s the same as lizards cutting off their own tails; we only have to focus on protecting the important merchandise.」

「Isn’t that right? Can I entrust this task to you?」

「Selling 『Him』 a favour…… Oh, you are talking about that guy. Boss’ idea is interesting as always. I see how this is. Please leave it to me then.」

 

「Hmm, I’ll be counting on you, Kazaream.」

「No problem. And by the way, I hope you can call me 『Kagali』 from now on.」

The young man’s eyes turn wide open at Kazaream after hearing his words.

「Oh…… have you finally made up your mind?」

「Yep. I only made my resolve after Clayman died. Before I can take my revenge against Leon, the 『Name』 Demon Lord Kazaream needs to be sealed up.」

「I see. Then, Kagali, this is quite the sudden request. But anyhow, I’ll be entrusting you with the matter.」

 

「I’ve got it covered, boss.」

The two look at each other, both cracking a smile.

And soon, a new wave of unrest is about to unfold——

Chapter 1

Reconciliation and Pacts

Editor: Censored

CN Proofreading: OrangeRazor

JP Proofreading: Mimisan Sub

EN Proofreading: Voxel

I am exhausted after the whole incident. Everything is finally settled. It was more tiring than fighting against Hinata——But let’s keep that a secret.

As for what happened during that time——

    ………………

    …………

    ……

The Western Saints Church believes in the God Ruminas, whose real identity is Demon Lord Valentine. Her real name seems to be Ruminas Valentine, and according to her, she has previously granted her subordinate the title for him to proclaim himself as Demon Lord Valentine.

However, Veldora revealed Ruminas’s identity during the Walpurgis Banquet and ended her disguise forever……

The Holy Knight Order under Hinata’s command was able to win the peoples’ support by standing against Demon Lord Valentine. Yet this was all pre-orchestrated, which Hinata seemed to know all along as well. It doesn’t seem wrong logically speaking, but is this really okay?

「It really can’t be helped. I tried to stop it but was defeated by Ruminas-sama. However, Ruminas-sama seems to have no interest in gaining popular support at all——」

Hinata explained rather helplessly seemingly noticing my concern. She doesn’t seem to approve such practices either, yet she has no choice but to follow along after her defeat against Ruminas.

With that being said, Ruminas has agreed to not harm any civilians. Hinata seemed to have made up her mind that as long as Ruminas sticks to that promise, she will obey her every whim.

Regardless, Hinata did not arrange this.

「Indeed. I was the one who drafted the plan. My brother Roy also backed me up. In fact, this whole thing has little to do with Ruminas-sama. Hinata objected to it from the start and even tried to defeat us, so if you have a problem with this, talk to me instead of her.」

Said the man who arrived with Ruminas, following Hinata’s words. I recalled that he had been referring to himself as Pope Louis.

「Should I call you Pope Louis……-dono? -san? Which one?」

   

Louis replied to me with a dry smile and said: 「Or you can just call me by my name, Demon Lord Rimuru.」 He asked me to call him with whatever preference. He didn’t seem to mind at all despite being in front of all the Holy Knights, saying that it was only natural for him to act humble before me for he saw me as an equal to his master, Demon Lord Ruminas.

Louis then explained the whole thing from start to finish at a volume loud enough for the Holy Knights eavesdropping on the side to hear as well.

「So, was the Demon Lord Valentine I ran into during the Walpurgis Banquet your younger brother?」

「He was. My twin brother to be more precise. But unfortunately, he was murdered after that Banquet.」

There wasn’t much regret in Louis’s voice.

   

「Huh, did you say that he was murdered?」

Although Louis didn’t seem to mind, I was a bit surprised. After all, the power that Demon Lord Valentine possessed was no way equal to any average body double.

   

「Oh, about that. Roy was probably overconfident to the point that he lowered his guard. There are many hostile factions to the Western Saints Church, and there are even countries that consider the Holy Empire Ruberios to be an eyesore. I figure that assassins sent by these hostile forces probably got the best of him……」

With that being said, his death was still quite pathetic——Louis added.

He said without a hint of remorse, but it doesn’t necessarily mean Louis is completely apathetic. This Louis guy’s power, which seems to even surpass Roy’s, is not to be underestimated either. Even still, he probably couldn’t view the murder of his brother (who possessed the power to rival Demon Lords) in an optimistic light.

「Lately we’ve been using Roy to train our new recruits in actual fieldwork. He was once careless enough that even Sare defeated him, meaning Roy was indeed slacking. Nonetheless, we still have to keep an eye out for the person that murdered Roy. But that is of course none of your concern.」

Hinata concluded.

Indeed, this Roy didn’t really concern me. But with this, the connection between Pope Louis, Demon Lord Valentine, and the God Ruminas has been clarified for me. Not only me, but the Holy Knights listening to their explanations seem to have figured it out as well. Everyone was stunned speechless, likely all hearing this for the first time.

Seeing that I have understood the situation, Hinata turned to face her comrades.

「Alright, did you catch all that? I really had no intention to deceive you all, but I sort of did as a result——」

「H-Hinata-sama……」

She raised a hand to stop the Holy Knight and continued speaking.

「I couldn’t tell you guys before since the less people who knew about this plan the better. I will have to dispose of any witnesses if the news of this leaks out.」

 

Hinata cruelly declares.

I see. How reckless.

「Hehehe. I, Arno, will not be so easily fooled. You must have been threatened by the God Ruminas——No, by Demon Lord Ruminas! Am I wrong?」

 

The Holy Knight called Arno interjected, yet Hinata immediately shot him down.

   

「Not at all. Didn’t I just mention? Ruminas-sama protects the people; That is definitely true. It’s why I made up my mind that as long as Ruminas-sama remains peaceful with humans, I would obey her orders. In other words, Arno, I won’t allow you to speak ill about Ruminas-sama.」

Hinata glared at Arno while giving him the ultimatum. No wonder she gets misunderstood all the time. It seems that Shizu-san’s concern was not unfounded.

「Ahh, don’t get so worked up now. I mean, Hinata, can’t you be a bit more gentle with your tone? This level of explanation is not sufficient at all, is it?」

   

「Shouldn’t this be none of your business?」

Hinata shot me a glare.

I told you to stop doing that!

「How is it not my business? We would be very troubled if you all split up due to in-fighting here.」

「Keep your hands to yourself. Basically——」

Hinata couldn’t finish her objections before——

「Don’t worry, we will always have faith in Hinata-sama!」

 

「Indeed, Arno has a point. Demon lord Rimuru, we don’t follow the God Ruminas. The Order follows Hinata-sama and Hinata-sama alone, so you don’t have to worry about us splitting up due to in-fights.」

Arno and Reynald seemed to be breathing out of the same nostril as both dismissed my concerns. Even though they might have had some reservations[3], everyone still believes in Hinata. It’s a shared sentiment among the knights. It’s wonderful that they still have trust in each other.

「That’s fine then.」

 

Seeing that I was on the same page, Arno adds:

「Moreover, after seeing such a sight……」

Although he was vague, I was able to guess as to what Arno was referring to.

That sight he mentioned must be referring to the fact that Ruminas and Veldora are engaging in a fierce battle just above our heads.

Honestly, you two are giving me a headache, so please stop immediately. I have established a defensive network with 「Absolute Defense」 from「Covenant King Uriel」 in order to prevent people on the ground from being affected. But the area is simply too wide; there is still a chance for casualties.

It’s not hard to imagine the reason behind Arno’s quivering voice after witnessing Ruminas’s intense and cruel attacks.

   

As in——

 

「It’s no wonder that Hinata-sama was defeated against an opponent as strong as that.」

「She’s indeed worthy of the title of God. If she were to become an enemy of humanity, we probably wouldn’t be able to do anything…….」

 Compared to the conversations we’ve had, this sight alone seems to be far more convincing to the members of the Holy Knight Order. It was then that Louis addressed them:

「Rest assured. Ruminas-sama has a generous heart; her grace doesn’t take joy in abusing people under her protection. As long as humans refrain from antagonizing her, a friendly relationship can surely be built. But she would indeed forbid anyone from revealing her true identity.」

Don’t spread news that says the God Ruminas is a Demon Lord. Louis urged them firmly.

Indeed, it was all because of Veldora that Ruminas’s identity was exposed. I would naturally do them this favour as well. While I am willing to help, the Holy Knights……

 

They seemed to also be willing to keep this information a secret. The reason was probably due to the fact that it is Hinata’s wish as well. It seemed that their admiration of Hinata had far exceeded my expectations.

Now then, I guess there doesn’t seem to be a need to worry. The way I see it, Hinata is really cold and doesn’t like clarifying her words. Her personality makes her very easily misunderstood——

 

「Hey you, are you thinking about something rude again?」

「EHH! N-no, I’m not thinking of anything——」

Could this girl actually have some sort of superpower? She read my mind like a book ……

 

《Negative. No such effect is detected.》

   

I-is that so?

Then, her instinct is truly terrifying. I should really stop thinking about these things in front of Hinata——So I came to this realization.

Suddenly, a flying object hurtled towards the ground, striking a giant crater. That thing got up casually and ran towards me as soon as it saw me. That was of course Veldora.

   

He snuck behind my back, staring up into the sky while using me as his shield. Above me, a silver-haired young beauty slowly descends from the air while casting furious glares in my direction.

   

「R-Rimuru, go convince that stubborn guy for me fast! I’ve already generously apologized, yet she completely ignored me!」

Uhhhhh, okie. But seriously, please leave me out of this.

It was all Veldora’s fault this time after all. But, come to think of it, when did Veldora ever do any good?

I can only recall the many troubles he gave me after his recent revival. Just now I also witnessed how Veldora’s apology methodTM winded up triggering Ruminas even more.

Veldora casually said to Ruminas who was about to finish him off:

「GHAAHAHAHA! I didn't mean it at the time. Everyone makes mistakes during his or her youth, so be the bigger person and just forgive me already!」

Ruminas was livid after hearing it.

「Hand over the lizard.」

The oppressive tone of her voice sent shivers down my spine. Her glare also terrified Veldora who was hiding behind my back. Honestly, I don’t wish to become an enemy of Ruminas over such a thing. Besides, I can relate to her feelings. That was not an apology at all. I think it’s about time for Veldora to get some punishment and reflect for a bit one way or another.

   

That’s why I——

「Here you go.」

I grab onto Veldora’s neck and without hesitation pushed him over to Ruminas.

Amazing. I’m truly moved that we are able to make such foods. Not only is its taste exceptional, but it’s also visually appealing.

As someone who isn’t well versed with the intricacies of cooking, I can’t elaborate on the difference between ebi fry and tempura. To put it in simpler terms, 「(Ebi Fry) dips the shrimps in the coating ingredients first before frying with oil」. The coating would greatly alter the taste and texture. There are also varying ways to fry them, so it was a lot harder than expected to recreate the taste and texture of the food from my vague memory alone.

Shuna endured a lot and worked hard for it. It’s all thanks to her efforts that the cuisine can be recreated to this extent. There aren’t that many coastal nations among the Western Nations, so seafood is a rare commodity. It would also be quite expensive to use magic to maintain the freshness of these products. Even if there were 「Otherworlder」 Chefs from Japan, it’d still be difficult to make food if you don’t have the ingredients.

Speaking of which, Yoshida-san also expressed his frustration about it, saying that there were too few varieties of alcohol (wines), which makes it almost impossible to recreate many different types of cake. He was ecstatic when I told him I’ll prepare them for him.

 

Considering all this, you can understand just how blessed I am. Even with relevant knowledge, it’s still an impossible feat to recreate dishes in such a short period of time. Especially Japanese ones, since gathering ingredients is already a difficult task in and of itself. I had to catch a bunch of fish in order to make things like Katsuobushi (dried tuna)[13].

By using my skill to perform 「Dimensional Transportation」, I was able to create a means to transport and maintain freshness, therefore allowing us to accommodate different types of ingredients. But I still wanted to figure out a way to transport without using skills, so it became a topic of study in the future.

Food is the essence of culture.

If the food of a nation is not sufficiently developed, then such a nation’s culture will be of no significance to me. I believe that among the 3 pillars of life's necessities: food, clothing and shelter, food is the most important. But everyone is entitled to his or her own opinion.

Based on all these reasons, we toiled to develop all sorts of cuisines.

I remember seeing white bread in the capital of Ingracia, which is considered daily fare for the rich. So by studying its production method, I was later able to produce them in my kingdom with relatively easier means.

The research task at hand (for us) was white rice. We haven’t improved it to the point of having acceptable (good) taste. Compared to the Japanese rice that has been researched and improved since time immemorial, the quality of ours is definitely inferior.

But that is only natural. I didn’t expect things to go that smoothly anyways. We were able to quickly harvest by using magic to grow them. But with that being said, growing them in the winter season is no easy feat.

Currently we only have a small amount growing in controlled indoor environments. It will take a long time before we can show any results.

But there may be a solution. When I asked Raphael-sensei if there was a better way, I got an immediate response. The method was to use Shion’s 「Chef」 to overwrite results. Since she can overwrite results, improving the quality of the product should be a piece of cake.

But will it really work?

I don’t think anyone would accept such a method since it’s quite the devious way to do things…… But that’s just me thinking. Although at this point, it’s probably already too late to be saying stuff like this. We’ve used this method quite recklessly during the production of wines, so any intention of self restraint is long gone.

Our appetite takes precedence over ethics. But we can’t rely on Shion’s power during every harvest, so we’ll need to continue our research. However, that is excluding a small portion of——primarily for me—— white rice.

Shion was happy to help, so I handed the rice over to Shuna and told her to only serve it during special occasions[14]. Today is one such special occasion.

Demon Lord Ruminas is here, among other things, hence we will have to splurge lavishly.

In order to ensure good relations from now on, we must demonstrate our country’s value. We have both a carrot and a stick to offer.

Your impression of someone will skyrocket if you get treated well despite having a negative impression in the past. If a delinquent youth were to suddenly commit a virtuous deed, his or her reputation would be greatly improved ——That’s my thought process at least. If we’re lucky it may even make their previous impression of us turn a big one-eighty.

Even though I don’t think the holy knights are this shallow, it’s still an effective and classic approach. With such a devious scheme in mind, I’ve made sure the night feast is served with only the finest delicacies. And regarding the matter concerning white rice, it’s something I insist on having as an ex-Japanese, but it may be unsuited for the appetites of the Holy Knights.

 

With that being said, Hinata would probably be pretty happy about it. After all, I was quite delighted when I got to eat the white rice that I had not seen for such a long time. As for Tempura, I’m pretty sure everyone would think it was delicious after eating it. The merchants and adventurers sang their praises, and it has even won over Benimaru’s approval. I think it would be fine considering the level of satisfaction it has so far.

The dishes have all been served and were waiting on the table while I was buried in my own thoughts. The only thing left is to wait for the Holy Knights to arrive from their bath.

   

    ***

The seats are arranged in a reversed U shape, with three seats at the head of the table. I’m seated at the center, with Veldora and Ruminas to my left and right respectively. From this seat I can have everyone else in my line of sight.

My own executives are sitting face to face with the Holy Knights. We intentionally arranged it this way so everyone may build up a friendly relationship through the feast. The Holy Knights are led to the venue of the feast.

All of them have finished bathing and are wearing either the yukatas or jinbeis (bath robe) that we had prepared for them. Reasonably speaking they should not be used to these clothes. However, they seem to have grown fond of them after having put them on. But that's only natural, since these types of clothes would not lose to any sporty track suit in terms of comfort. Not only are they suitable for daily activities, but they also are able to serve as pajamas.

The Holy Knights nervously follow their guides to their seats. They seem quite confused after noticing that there isn’t any chair or table. Moreover, chairs and tables aside, they seem baffled just by walking barefoot on the tatami. These are simply cultural differences, so their confusion is logical.

The Goblinas (female Hobgoblin) leading the way, on the other hand, are not nervous at all. They smoothly carried out their tasks, performing their duties spectacularly as if it were second nature. This is all thanks to Vesta’s training. The Holy Knights all seem astonished at the fact, and I can tell that they are embarrassed.

The one walking at the front is Ruminas. She moves elegantly while I wait at the head seat. She is then seated next to me.

Next it appears to be Louis’ turn. He looks exactly the same as Roy, who played the part of a Demon Lord, and gives off the regal air of a pope.

The third person arriving is Hinata. As soon as she sits on her seat, she turns to me seemingly with some sort of conviction.

「I sincerely apologize for the great trouble that I’ve caused you. Both for the last time, as well as today’s incident. I acted entirely on my own. I did not act upon Ruminas-sama’s instructions, to say nothing of my subordinates who hold no responsibility for this incident... I don’t think you can forgive this transgression with just me taking responsibility alone——」

 

「Ahhhh, STOP!」

   

I hurriedly stop Hinata just as she was about to bow and apologize to me. I’ll disregard last time, and this time it was a misunderstanding. (This time) the ones responsible were the 「Seven Celestials」, and Ruminas has already executed them.

I personally don’t intend to hold anyone further accountable for the problem regarding the Farmus Kingdom since Diablo has already dealt with it. That’s why I stopped Hinata.

But I’ve also stumbled upon something incredible. Out of the corner of my eye, I happened to notice something...

——Two gently sloping mounds behind her exposed yukata!

 

They are slightly flushed and glistening after the hot bath.

I definitely didn’t intentionally look at them; it can only be said to be terribly good timing. Could this be the godly power of Wisdom King Raphael-san?

《Answer. No.》

Am I thinking too much? Also the tone of its reply sounds so cold, but I don’t really care about that type of stuff at this moment.

Holy shit, my adventurous desires are flooding out non-stop. It’s supposed to be time for my son to pop up, but he is unfortunately no longer with us. But, you can’t blame me for that.

Because men are creatures that will never forget their adventurous spirit!!

Times like these, how wonderful it is that I have a body that won’t get a nosebleed.

And by the way, bathrobe play, it’s truly powerful. The destructive power of it is astounding. Freshly bathed woman in yukatas, now that’s the best combo.

Plus the fact that it’s a beauty like Hinata only adds on to the terrifying effect.

I have been defeated… defeated indeed. Absolute and total defeat… With this, all is forgiven. But wait, I’ve already forgiven her a long time ago!

It is at this instant that Shuna says: 「Rimuru-sama, to where might you be you looking?」

She pauses her serving and looks at me with a sweet smile.

How does she do it? Her voice was gentle indeed, yet it sent shivers down my spine.

「Nothing! I-I’m not looking at anything in particular. By the way, Hinata…… As long as the misunderstanding is resolved, it’s fine. At least, if you could give up your prejudice towards monsters, that would be great.」

I hurriedly try to cover myself. Hinata shows a momentary expression of hesitation before wordlessly nodding.

Well in reality, that will actually be quite difficult. Being a monster is no different from being a dangerous convict holding a gun. It would be counterproductive if the public was to briefly believe that monsters are harmless, only to end up getting harmed by said monsters. We may indeed communicate with humans, but there is no guarantee that we can understand each other.

Yet in this city, such a fantasy is made true. Because the monsters all had faith in my words, they wished to be friendly and coexist with humans.

That said however, Shion and the Yomigaeri were once killed by humans.

「About that, I understand it’s difficult to give out trust so easily since there’s no way to know what your opponents are thinking. That, and the fact that when you consider that some monsters can be extremely cunning, only makes it harder. The guardians of mankind cannot afford to be so easily fooled by monsters.」

「——You are right. Communication is the first step to understanding, but it is also a dangerous transaction. You risk the danger of being mind controlled and having your soul bound[15].」

「Indeed. That’s why it’s enough for us if you believe that not all monsters are bad. If you ever encounter any suspicious monsters that you have reservations for, just leave them in our custody. It’ll be alright for them to come to this town even if they’re not accepted in human societies.」

This is probably where we’ll find common ground. Our town will take in questionable monsters since the residents here won’t get shocked at unexpected situations that easily. But that’s under the condition that those monsters can actually be communicated with.

「I understand. It won’t be easy to change everyone’s mind immediately, but I will ban the rule that allows people to deem monsters as evil and execute them without due process. Is that okay, Ruminas-sama?」

「It’s but a minor matter, so do whatever you want. But, don’t raise anyone’s suspicion towards his or her faith in me.」

「Understood. I’ll have it as the number one priority for everyone to keep in mind.」

Ruminas seems to also have accepted it.

The Holy Empire Ruberios was a kingdom built on the peoples’ faith in the God Ruminas, that’s why doubts from the public would shake the foundation of the nation. It ( The Western Saints Church) is after all a religion with significant influence on the Western Nations, so it would only be natural for Hinata to proceed with caution.

I, on the other hand, believe that Ruminas has underestimated her own influence. Even though she had said that such a thing cannot be tolerated, she didn’t look like she cared at all. Perhaps it’s not Ruminas’ own wish to be worshipped by others as god. Or it could just be me overthinking it. But she did seem to have given all the authority to Pope Louis and left the chores for Hinata. The incident before was the same. It was simply due to the devious scheming of the「Seven Celestials」.

Hmm, but it shouldn’t be like that.

This ancient Demon Lord suddenly returned after leaving the spotlight for centuries just to rule once more with the figure of a majestic overlord, yet she actually dislikes troubling herself——There’s no way someone like that exists. 「I’ll be the king while giving the power to the people.」—— my thoughts naturally gravitated towards this direction since it’s quite similar to the goal I have in mind.

But I can’t ask the question so openly in public, so I should just keep these thoughts to myself.

As I was still mulling this over, Hinata turns towards my subordinates.

「I need to apologize to you all as well. I promise you that we will not be hostile towards others simply for the fact that they are monsters.」

As she finishes, Hinata bows deeply. Seeing that Hinata has made a move, the rest of the Holy Knights quickly do the same. 「We’re sorry!」, all of them bow their heads and apologize.

「Don’t mind it at all. If it weren’t for Rimuru-sama’s orders, we too would continue to treat humans as our enemies after all.」

The one who spoke is Rigurdo. He said that it was because of my orders that they were able to abandon their prejudice. For the goblins who were desperately struggling just to survive, all other races except for themselves would probably have been considered enemies..

「Personally speaking, I’m fine as long as you aren’t hostile towards us. I saw your fight with Rimuru-sama, and even as I am now, I’m unlikely to win.」

 

Benimaru says, smiling.

He’s still his same warmongering self with his head filled with nothing but combat. I’m not sure whether Souei agrees with Benimaru or not; He simply nodded in response. There is a tendency amongst monsters for the strong to prey on the weak, so even if enemies kill them the fault will eventually fall on the weaker creatures. Souei seems to have this view as well, so he holds no grudges against the Holy Knights.

As for Shion, she’s behaving rather suspiciously, as if Hinata’s apology only agitated her.

「Shion, you should forgive them too. I understand your pain and anger, but not all humans are evil. There are bad humans and there are good humans; that’s just how it is. It’s the same for monsters, and just like with monsters, you have to ascertain their nature accordingly. Moreover, humans are creatures that can overcome their mistakes. So aren’t we the same just like them? Isn’t it the character of one’s soul that’s most important?」

Humans and monsters should not be differentiated by their races. The nature of an individual’s soul is the most important factor.

I hope Shion can understand this too. I said that to her with that in mind, yet Shion seems to be more confused. To her, all humans must be evil.

But, I hope she won’t treat everyone the same way. Right now Shion is still obeying my command, but I’m not sure whether the bottled up discontent would burst out one day. That should never happen. I hope she isn’t just mindlessly following orders but able to act based on her own thoughts.

At least that’s what I initially thought, which is apparently just me being paranoid. In an instant, Shion abandons all her reservations. She’s not good at thinking anyway, so it’s quite like her to speak with such an open mind.

「I understand now! I’ll learn from Rimuru-sama to judge good from bad based on their 『Souls』!」

 

Shion beams, a fierce conviction written on her face. This may be an indication that she has overcome a major obstacle. Even though I can’t see people’s 「Souls」, it is good that Shion was able to open up.

The members of the Yomigaeri also seem to resonate with her, determined to think for themselves (in judging the nature of man) while abandoning their grudges against the Holy Knights.

What a bunch. These are all companions that I’m proud of. Being able to accept others’ apologies and let go of past enmities isn’t easy. It’s hard to determine to what extent they have forgiven the Knights, but the two parties have successfully made peace. As long as we’re communicating, we’ll be able to accept each other.

And just like that, we were able to reconcile on the matter.

    ***

Right then, it will be way too boring to continue with this solemn atmosphere. It would be a waste if these fine dishes get cold along with it. Most importantly, if this continues, there won’t be a chance for Veldora to show up again. He’ll throw a tantrum and things will get dicey.

Supposedly, he shouldn’t need to eat food just like me. But for some odd reason, he became quite obsessed with it ever since his revival. It’s a known fact that he loves desserts such as cakes. He’s also quite the picky eater.

No idea if he knows what he’s talking about or not. It seems like he’s looking forward to enjoying this free meal, so I should probably get this feast started as soon as possible.

Since that’s the case, let’s raise our cups.

「Now then, let’s raise our cups for the amazing battles we’ve fought against each other!」

I came up with a random toast and started the feast. It feels the best to drink a cold beverage right after a bath. And of course, I’ve prepared that all beforehand. We’re generously offering the secret wines produced in our nation in mass.

Absolutely flawless.

Wine is the mainstream (drink) even in the Ingracia Kingdom. There’s also yeast wine (beer), but it doesn’t taste as good. Should I describe it as lacking in foam or carbonic acid? It’s quite warm, so perhaps that’s the main reason why the taste is poor.

But when it comes to my nation, none of these is an issue. Don’t underestimate my enthusiasm for food. I’ve researched day and night and have now developed more varieties than during the time I visited Dwargon.

And the minute I mention I want something, people will immediately start researching ways to make it. My current living environment is ideal to the point of being frightening. Could it really be because I’ve become a Demon Lord? No, it seemed to be the same before that too……

Ah, never mind.

So this is basically how things are. My diet has become about the same as the time I lived in Japan thanks to the hard work of my dear monsters (friends). My nation’s food is truly delicious.

The Holy Knights will definitely be satisfied.

And my predictions were accurate.

The female waitresses are all running around to refill wine for everyone. They have become quite adept due to the experience of holding the many feasts in the past. The eyes of the Holy Knights widen in surprise once they take the first sip. And as the food enters their mouth, they become frozen on the spot. They steal glances at their neighbour to see each others’ expressions, seemingly moved by the delicious taste of the food.

I chuckle to myself. I am finally relieved to see that they’re enjoying the meal.

The main dish is tempura, but we’ve also prepared some seafood. We’re even serving the chopped up sashimi[16] on the tables.

   

I got ahold of ingredients akin to soybeans and was successful in recreating soy sauce. This is one of the many fruits of Shuna’s labor. It has some differences from actual soy sauce, but only people who are already familiar with the taste can tell the difference. For a first-time diner, this bootleg soy sauce is just as good as the real deal. Since there are different types of soy sauce as well, there may actually be one with similar taste to ours in Japan. All in all, I’m very pleased with the fine quality of our product.

Sashimi is Hakurou’s speciality. Even though Hakurou is not present at the moment, several other chefs have also inherited his skill. Since that is the case, it seems that the training of chefs has gone smoothly as well. These chefs were able to flaunt their skills in a variety of exquisite dishes and serve them one by one.

Even though we went for a Japanese style cuisine, most people still enjoyed eating it. Especially Hinata, she seems quite moved as she eats her meal in silence. Unlike the knights who were not used to using chopsticks, Hinata was able to deftly maneuver them to eat her meal.

She turns her attention to me, seemingly suspecting that I was looking at her.

 

「I mean, aren’t you going a bit overboard with all this?」

「How is it going overboard?」

And I thought she was going to praise me, but I got teased instead.

 

I retorted as my anger quietly bubbled. And soon after, Hinata begins to shower me with all of her doubts as if she was venting out all of her discontent accumulated over time.

「It’s the same on the road to here! Inns serving ramen and dumplings, drinking areas with free water, grand bathhouses in the middle of nowhere, and now this! Why is there fresh sashimi when you are living in a giant forest!?? I’ve already tried very hard to accept this sansai (mountain vegetables) tempura, but this (sashimi) is suspicious no matter how you look at it!」

Hinata no longer has her calm composure as she finishes her sentence in one breath.

Ahh, okie. I didn’t expect that she would ask about that.

 

「Because I wanted to eat——」

「Whaaaat?」

   

「I mean, that’s……. Because I wanted to eat those foods, so I put in the effort to recreate them. And about the sashimi, we did a bit of fishing because the Beast Kingdom Yuurazania (who we’re on good terms with) happens to face the sea. But right now we haven’t figured out a logistics network for transporting cold-storage products, that’s why we are using skills to resolve the issue for now. I mean, I want to live luxuriously sometimes too!」

「Did you say skill?」

I nod and reply with a「Hmm」.

About that, I utilized the transportation channel of the orcs through Geld’s 「Stomach」 from his Unique Skill 「Gourmet」. Transportation magic usually is unable to move food ingredients. However, Geld’s skills are an exception.

With that being said, we’ve only prepared enough for this one feast. The orcs can’t be distracted from their construction projects simply because of my stubbornness. It was thanks to the people on vacation in the village who were willing to help that we were able to get the food this time. This is the limitation of using personal skills to conduct transportation. I will have to make this a research subject and improve on top of that.

Hinata is baffled as she listens to my explanation, not saying a word.

「——I see, so skills can allow for the transportation of objects without changing their quality. And since there are many people in this nation that can use that skill……. It’s unbelievable how justified you seem utilizing skills of the public for personal exploit.」

Hinata mutters, somewhat exasperated.

How rude! But it’s fine, I don’t plan to argue with her.

Hinata shows an expression of revelation, yet I’m unaware that an issue existed in the first place. Isn’t it only natural to make use of whatever that can be used?

「It doesn’t matter really, Hinata. No matter what the cause was, the fact of the matter is that all of these are delicious. Or at least, I like them quite a lot.」

Ruminas seemed to have overheard the conversation and chimed in, ostensibly drunk with a wine glass in her hand. These dishes are probably all new to Ruminas, and she appears to be greatly enjoying her tempura.She’s even using her fingers to eat them, yet for some reason, Ruminas looks elegant no matter how she behaves.

It is basically the correct way of dining, so it’s fine as long as it doesn’t repulse other people. It is perhaps the hardest question we need to resolve when it comes to how to not force people who haven’t even seen chopsticks before to use them. Benimaru and the rest already knew how to use chopsticks. Furthermore, the monsters in our kingdom have learnt it themselves after they observed how we had eaten. But it is not the same case for merchants or adventurers coming from other nations. Moreover, we wish to make our nation an attraction for foreign noblities, so we don’t want them to feel obligated to use chopsticks.

Coming from that point of view, Ruminas presents a case that is worth considering. She’s using either knives, forks, chopsticks, or her fingers. The hotter dishes must require chopsticks, but the rest can be eaten bare handed just fine. The methods of consumption vary depending on the dish.

It would be meaningless if the guests don’t enjoy eating, so they shouldn’t be restricted to just one way. It would be better to inform them of the different possible ways to dine and wait for them to slowly adapt.

With that in mind, I ask Ruminas:

   

「Is our food suited for your appetite?」

「Hmm, I like it a lot. Delectable dishes, and even better wines.」

I didn’t notice that she’s been ferociously gulping down wine until after she mentioned it. Milim is a voracious eater while Ruminas is an impressive drinker[17]. While using tempura as her appetizer, she has drunk a round of all the wines on the table.

「That’s wonderful. But it will be bad for your body if you don’t restrain yourself!」

「Silly, even poison has no effect on me, so how can I lose to mere alcohol? I had to however, go out of my way to lower the effect of 『Poison Nullification』 just to get drunk!」

My advice to Ruminas seems to have been meaningless. But did she just mention something about lowering the effect of 「Poison Nullification」?

「I-is that even possible?」

「You don’t say? Stop talking silly there——」

I ask Ruminas who is looking down on me to teach me the method.

《.......》

Wisdom King Raphael-san seems to have some issue with that. But I don’t care, so I did as what Ruminas taught and lowered my 「Resistance」.

A sudden sense of drunkenness hits me the moment I did that.

Here it comes, here it comes——!

Here we go! That’s the feeling of getting drunk!

「GAHAHAHA! Rimuru, how come you don’t know how to do such a simple trick? I’ve already mastered that (low) level of trickery!」

Mister Veldora[18] looks quite proud. I have no idea when he practiced it, but right now he has become a complete drunkard.

「Right, then let’s drink some more!」

「Hmm. I’ll drink with you then.」

「You two are helpless. In that case, I shall accompany you as well.」

Ruminas got on board arrogantly, making the feast even more lively.

「Geez, Rimuru-sama.」

Shuna says, somewhat vexed, but she continues to refill my drink with a pasted on smile. And as such we begin to booze up without a hint of courtesy.

There are a rich variety of alcohols, our supply of ice is more than sufficient, and there are also refreshing beverages available[19]. And of course, we have also prepared tea and juice for those who aren’t adept at holding their liquor.

Haruna-san and Louis help to refill for Veldora and Ruminas respectively. As for Benimaru, Shion and Souei, as well as the two Beastketeers and Holy Knight Elites such as Arno, they seem to be competing in some sort of drinking game. The members of the Holy Knight Order started off all serious-looking, but they began to loosen up after their captains chugged down a couple rounds. Some chatted with Rigurd, while others made requests to the serving ladies for more food. There are even some among them who appear to be interested in monsters’ diet and wish to try the food themselves.

Isn’t that guy called Fritz? I remember he is a captain of the Holy Knight Order just like Arno and that he is one of the Ten Great Saints.

Hmm hmm, he seems to be more impressive than I thought.

The first step to understanding others is to take an interest in the food they eat. What a truly wonderful thing to do.

However, I recall that thing (food) there to be——

My drunken mind begins to race.

That over there is black rice. We took samples of graminess plants and used magicule fluid——the highly concentrated liquid magicule formed in the sealed cave——to grow them. I did the experiment out of sudden curiosity and as a result made black rice that looked like it had been blended with squid ink.

In my established view, rice is just white rice, so black rice doesn’t look particularly appetizing. But its actual taste is without a doubt delicious. It even possesses incredibly high nutritional value, and so I added it to the production line with the name 「Magic Black Rice」[20]. It has become the main fare in our nation, though I sort of remember a huge issue about it——

「AHHH, STOP! That thing is poisonous to humans!」

I shouted, suddenly sober. But Fritz’s exclamation drowned me out.

「T-This thing can restore mana!」

   

I couldn’t stop Fritz from taking a bite. Instead of being poisoned, this was how he reacted.

 

「Oi, forget that! Is your body okay? Feeling anything wrong?」

Bodies of weaker individuals would be affected after ingesting large amounts of magicules. The magicule content in this magic black rice is quite high, so it would be the equivalent of poison for people of lesser abilities. But if ingested at an appropriate quantity, it can be used as both medicine and served as a main dish. It shouldn’t be an issue for everyone else, but whether or not it will be safe for humans to consume is anyone’s guess.

We can’t be so hasty with human experiments. However, judging from Fritz’s reaction, the result is different from how I imagined. I thought before that the rice would be poison to humans, but could it actually be converted to medicine for people possessing a certain amount of mana?

《Answer. Mana restoration effect confirmed on individual 「Fritz」. If target possesses 「Resistance」 against magicules, mana will likely be converted to energy.》

 

I see, so that’s how it is.

 

It must be because he has given his all in the battle and rapidly depleted his mana that the effect of the food seems so pronounced.

I snapped back to reality as the other Holy Knights begin to discuss the magic black rice as well. None of them seem at all frightened. Getting drunk sure is terrifying.

It can’t be helped then; we will have to prepare the portion for all of them as well. Hinata probably has the same feeling I had (with the rice). She grimaced upon seeing its black colour……

But she isn’t complaining, instead she chews on the chazuke (tea/soup soaked rice) made of the magic black rice. As for those who still aren’t satisfied with chazuke alone, we have also prepared onigiri (rice ball). It also seems to be getting great reviews as more servings are ordered almost in the blink of an eye. I didn’t expect the magic black rice to be more popular than the white rice we specifically went out of the way to prepare for me. With that being said, it seems like only I have a problem with its aesthetics. In reality it tastes wonderful. It may even be easier for people who have never seen rice to accept it.

And because of it I found an unexpected effect of magic black rice.

I’m also looking forward to the promotion our nation will get as our guests enjoy the food and beverages. Moreover, the important thing is that this feast will be an opportunity to communicate as I see monsters and Holy Knights chatting with each other. Shion even arm wrestled three Holy Knights. Apparently she achieved overwhelming victory, though the Holy Knights seem to react with laughter at the fact.

What a nice outcome, much better than my expectations.

Perhaps it was thanks to the alcohol, but if this can become a natural sight, we can probably get along with each other much sooner.

To good food and good life.

In order to reach that goal, I’ll have to strive to do my job well. It will be my duty in the future to protect these precious moments.

I made up my mind at that instant. Yet as soon as I did——

 

「What are you doing, Rimuru! Come, let me help you refill, let’s get hammered today!」

「Most true indeed! I’ve come just to accompany you two. So let’s drink to our hearts’ content!」

「H-hold on, Veldora… And Ruminas, aren’t you a vampire? Why do you even need to eat and drink and how did you end up so drunk——」

「Hmph, you’re such a tool! Once I became an advanced species (higher vampire), I can replenish energy from normal food. But that’s irrelevant, finish your wine already!」

I told her that they are two separate things, but she’s completely ignoring me. I’m getting crossfire from these two drunkards, and the determination that I finally made flew straight out the window.

「Hey, you two!」

 

I wasn’t quick enough to stop them before my cup was refilled with the distilled wine made from magic black rice and forced to down it in one go.

Hinata slants her cold eyes at us, seemingly muttering 「There should be a limit to all this monkeying around」. However, there is a tiny smile curled along the corners of her lips, but that might just be my drunken delusions.

Hinata’s smile looks pretty cute too——But let’s keep that a secret.

   

    ***

And just like that, it was tomorrow already. My head hurts like hell.

《Answer. Of course. It is the side-effect of forceful reduction of 「Resistance」.》

 

Thank you for your calm sarcasm.

Speaking of Raphael-sensei’s tone, it still sounds quite pissed. No, I must be thinking too much. There’s no way in the world that I would get scolded by my own skill. As such, I shake it off and carry about as normal.

There is an important meeting today. The future relations between the Tempest Federation and the Holy Empire Ruberios will depend on it. Hopefully we will reach a conclusion afterwards. The venue moves to the usual large meeting room. I take my seat while struggling to endure the headache.

In reality, with the circumstances at hand, not only were we about to become enemies of the Western Saints Church, we may even have potentially opened hostilities with the Holy Empire Ruberios. It was also a fact that the Pope’s Ministry gave permission for the Templar Knight Order to mobilize, and it could have caused major damage to our nation. Given that this was the case, we will have to exercise caution when dealing with them.

With that being said however, the real culprits in the Farmus Kingdom have been executed. As for the Templar Knight Order who aided them, there is not even one survivor remaining.

But they (the ministry) should take responsibility as well since they aren’t entirely unrelated…… However, I’ve already accepted Hinata’s apology. Moreover, the culprits responsible for the incident have already been taken care of.  

Unlike the Farmus Kingdom, I don’t intend to fight against the Holy Empire Ruberios. It’s meaningless to ask them for reparations as long as a friendly relationship can be formed. The monetary part is compensated with Clayman’s inheritance and the reparations from Farmus. And if we were to take any land, it will be too far away geographically anyways. It will be difficult to manage, plus having such a distant land to rule would give me another headache.

They have already admitted their faults, so rather than demanding reparations, we should make an effort together to build a friendly relationship in the future. And that is honestly my wish.

I contemplate the matter as I await Ruminas and the rest.

On the side of Tempest Federation, there’s me, Shion, Rigurdo, and Benimaru as well as the officers in charge of the judicial, legislative and executive branches——The three chiefs Rugurdo, Regurdo and Rogurdo. Veldora is here as well, but we can just ignore him. Getting through to him when he’s reading his manga is simply an impossible feat.

On the the Holy Empire Ruberios’s side, the participants are Ruminas, Louis, and Hinata. In addition, there are also the five captains. I invite them to introduce themselves.

We have the vice-commander of the order, Reynald, known as Childe of 「Light」.

There’s also the person that is said to be the strongest knight next to Hinata, Arno of 「Air」.

As well as Bacchus of 「Earth」, Ritase of 「Water」, and Fritz of 「Wind」.

Now that everyone is present, we (the two parties) sit face to face and commence the meeting.

 

First we will need to clear out the misunderstanding. Given this is the case, we will be listing out the circumstances of both parties to have some context. We will be exchanging this information as the meeting starts.

We check on these things while confirming progress with their party. There is no point in voicing our complaints; right now we are only trying to verify the facts. It is best to rectify any information that appears different from our understanding, to which Hinata also agrees.

The testimonies of both of our parties are mostly expected. It seems we won’t have to do too much explaining. Everything began when the fire nation attacked with the invasion of the Farmus Kingdom. We will be maintaining our stance and only change our terms based on the attitude of our negotiating party.

As for how things went down on the Saints Church side, Hinata mentioned that there had already been a problem before Farmus made their request. To put it simply, it would be defying the doctrines of Ruminasism to acknowledge the existence of a monster kingdom. It was an urgent matter that may have generated distrust among the believers. If left unattended, the followers might even renounce their faith. It might even end up causing the downfall of the influence of the Western Saints Church. That was why the monster kingdom must be eliminated. For this reason, they needed a reason to justify invading my kingdom——That’s how Hinata put it.

「It was under those circumstances that Archbishop Rayheim stationed at Farmus made the request. Nicolas thus gave the permission. I didn’t have an objection at the time, and more importantly, I couldn’t forgive you then——」

These are Hinata’s accounts.

Farmus, while trying to protect its national interest, grew greedy for profits and intended to eliminate us for that cause. At the same time, Hinata also wished to seek revenge.

「Was it because of Shizu-san?」

「Yes, that was the case. Now that I think about it, I seem to have been manipulated as well. Although I still have no idea who was behind all this, the eastern merchants must have had something to do with it.」

 

「Merchants…… Is that so? That’s gotta be the reason. There were merchants going in and out on Demon Lord Clayman’s side as well. Moreover, although Geld and his men are currently under my command, in the past they were all fully geared. I suspected that they may have had ties with some other countries, and as it turns out their trading partners were the Eastern Merchants.」

I nod as I come to the realization.

There were a large amount of business transaction records in the ledger I asked Shuna to investigate. The Eastern Empire produces most of the merchandise that Dwargon originally exported. The Empire was undoubtedly doing business with Dwargon, yet the problem is with the identity of its broker. There wasn’t any form of record.

Shuna has done a thorough investigation yet was still unable to find out the real identity of their trade partner. We even interrogated the captives to no avail. Demon Lord Clayman was extremely cautious and ordered his subordinates to be meticulous with their work, not leaving behind any evidence. This was especially true for his associates in the Moderate Clown Troupe as there wasn’t any record on them either.

However, on the matter of who the trade partner is, there are still ways to determine the identity of the person. There were many artworks and rare magic items stored in Clayman’s castle that were collected from all over the world. Yet most of his weapons and gears came from the Empire. Because of teleportation magic, there wouldn’t be an issue with transportation no matter where he purchased them. Yet he specifically imported their goods from the Empire, meaning the two must be somehow connected. Even though this can only count as indirect evidence, it is a decisive piece to victory.

In addition, the same logic applies to the food ingredients. There was an abundance of fruit, bread, and dairy products as well as other consumable goods[21]——A large amount of food ingredients were stored in Clayman’s base. These goods cannot be teleported through magic alone and have to rely on physical transportation.

Clayman’s territory before his death was the Puppet State Jistav. They seem to conduct agricultural work with slavery, yet the agricultural products do not match up with the food items found in their storage. According to Shuna’s investigation, there were several food items that must require exports from other nations. If that were the case, the prime suspect would be the neighbouring Eastern Empire. Since Milim has been self-sufficient in her land, she wouldn’t even have had the thought of trading with others. Furthermore, neither Milim nor ex-Demon Lord Karion have the money to trade such goods with others. That is another reason why I suspected that the people who colluded with Demon Lord Clayman were from the Eastern Empire.

「That’s right. They were the ones that told me that you had murdered Shizue-san. They also mentioned that you happened to be in Ingracia at the time. That was why I had moved out in hopes of eliminating you.」

「Indeed. The timing then was horrible, even now looking back at it just pisses me off——」

My words shook Hinata a bit.

Not only Hinata, but also Arno and the rest of the Holy Knights are cowed.

「Quit intimidating them now. Your 『Demon Lord Haki (Imposing Aura)』 is leaking out because of your anger, you rookie.」

Oops, my bad, my bad.

I only realized after Ruminas pointed out that my Youki (Demonic Aura) seems to be leaking out. I only recently learnt how to perfectly control it, but I still can’t suppress it entirely when I get agitated.

I immediately apologize and continue.

「Anyhow, in reality, it was the eastern merchant or something who was behind this. So, do you know his name?」

   

「That person called himself Darm. But it must have been an alias.」

An alias? I guess it makes sense.

But, the name doesn’t matter here. The important thing is the fact that the eastern merchant is the real culprit.

「Demon Lord Clayman also had ties with the eastern merchant. Moreover, it was probably the same party of people that instigated the ex-King of Farmus, Edmalis.」

「That was indeed the case. We were able to clarify that after interrogating Rayheim.」

I nod with a 「Hmm」 and begin to connect the dots.

「Demon Lord Clayman must have secretly manipulated the Farmus Kingdom. The two factions are not in a partner relationship; it felt more like the temporary collaboration between enemies.」

「And the people doing the matchmaking were those eastern merchants?」

As I was speaking, Benimaru opens up with a sudden realization. And for Hinata, she seems to be muttering to herself 「And I was also used by others for this plan——」 while emitting a dangerous aura.

Next, we need to find out who the mastermind behind all this is, however…...

「All of the incidents are linked to the eastern merchant, so based off of that, it doesn’t seem like things played out this way simply because the factions’ interests just so happened to align. Clayman always wanted to awaken and become a True Demon Lord while the Farmus Kingdom had its sights set on territorial expansion, which is why they intended to take our kingdom. Moreover, there is 『That Lord』[22] who is pulling the strings……」

「『That Lord』, it was the person Clayman mentioned, wasn’t it?」

Ruminas and I nod to each other.

「What does that mean?」

Benimaru and the rest know about this, but it’s new information for Hinata and her party. For that reason, I give a quick explanation.

   

「In truth, Demon Lord Clayman seemed to have been following the orders of someone else.」

 

「It was quite impressive for a nobody like Clayman to have not revealed the person’s true identity even to the very end.」

「Is that so…….」

「Could it be, that the person’s true identity is one of the 『Seven Celestials』?」

I got the sudden inspiration as if god had enlightened me. It was just supposed to be a random guess, yet it surprisingly retained some realism.

「What did you say? You brat, are you suggesting that the 『Seven Celestials』 acted on their own behind my back?」

Ruminas glares at me, clearly displeased.

Even though she personally eliminated the Seven Celestials, it must feel bad to have someone raise doubts about her old subordinates. I understand her feelings, and just as I was going to apologize——

「I see, we can’t really exclude such a possibility.」

——Louis, Ruminas’s trusted servant, said. I didn’t actually think he would acknowledge my point.

「Louis, now even you are jesting like him——」

Ruminas shifts her icy glare to Louis. However, Louis is unshaken and decides to continue.

「Please hear me out, Ruminas-sama. Those Seven Celestials wanted to win your deep affection once more. Surely you were also aware of something as natural as this?」

「What do you mean by that?」

「(Your) Deep affection——In other words, the kiss of love (love energy). The last time Ruminas-sama did the ritual for them was a hundred years ago. Yet in the beginning you would have done the ritual every week. The interval has only gotten longer over time. Have you not noticed that?」

Ruminas scowls after Louis pointed that out.

「I see how this is now. Us immortals do tend to forget that they were once originally humans. Even though they won’t die without my spirit energy, they will definitely age.」

「Indeed they would. That’s why they were striving to stop the aging and hoping that Ruminas-sama wouldn’t lay eyes on other 『Adored Individuals』——」

Louis continues in a rather flat tone.

It seems that the 「Seven Celestials」 were once humans that won Ruminas’ special affection. Human lives however are limited of course, that was why there existed such a ritual to overwrite this fact——The kiss of love from Ruminas.

「——That’s why those people probably came up with the plan to win Ruminas-sama’s heart again. If they had collaborated with the eastern merchant while colluding with Demon Lord Clayman in the dark, it would not be strange at all. Speaking of those bunch, especially 『Master of Sun』 Gran, his ability would not lose to mere Clayman.」

Louis concludes.

I only mentioned it due to a stray thought, yet somehow it managed to connect the dots. Even I am astounded. How terrifying. The pure, boundless wisdom just radiating from my body is truly formidable.

《.......》

Wisdom King Raphael-sensei seems to want to say something, but I’m probably just overthinking it. It may just be jealous of my talent. It probably felt it didn’t have the chance to shine since I never asked it any questions.

「Could the 『Seven Celestials』 really have considered me as an obstacle due to such reasons?」

Hinata asks, bewildered.

「Perhaps. They may have wanted to help Clayman awaken and fight you. It was impossible at least for them alone to emerge victorious against you. Thus it is highly likely they have chosen to resort to any possible means in order to defeat you.」

Uh——But there’s no way you can’t reach a conclusion from there.

First they will have Clayman defeat Hinata. Then they will consider either eliminating Clayman or manipulating him as a puppet. It’s not clear what they were planning, but Clayman’s loyalty was most definitely true. If he could defeat Hinata, it will be up to the 「Seven Celestials」 to attend to whatever they wish to do. They can have the Farmus Kingdom eliminate us in order to consolidate the doctrines of Ruminasism. And of course, they will reap a portion of the profits gained from doing so.

Once a powerful nation (like Farmus) gets on the move (to war), the eastern merchants can sell their goods such as weapons, gears, and food at a high price. And the Seven Celestials would be able to have Ruminas’s affection once more. It definitely isn’t good to draw conclusions like this, but it is certainly one worthy of consideration.

「Did they also send me to provoke Rimuru in order to get rid of me? It seems they tried to kill two birds with one stone considering it would be abiding by the doctrines of Ruminasism by doing that.」

Based on Louis’ theory, Hinata continues.

But during my first encounter with Hinata, she was too strong so I ended up fleeing.

 

While we were on this topic, something suddenly comes to my mind.

 

「About that, are the 『Seven Celestials』 really the culprits behind all this?」

Reynald, who is sitting adjacent to Hinata, answers:

「That’s definitely the case; it was none other than the 『Seven Celestials』 who acquainted us with those merchants.」

So he says.

 

If that’s the case, there’s even more evidence stacked against the 「Seven Celestials」. Since heroes recommended them, nobody suspected a thing, which is why everyone danced along to their tune. Honestly, I didn’t think the 「Seven Celestials」 would have thought that far ahead during my first battle with Hinata. Yet they did intend for me to kill Hinata this time. It’s quite troubling to deal with people that cunning, but there shouldn’t be any worries now that they’ve all been eliminated——
