「Wait, hold on. If they are called 『Seven Celestials』, wouldn’t it mean there are seven people in total? Doesn’t that leave one surviving member?」

This completely flew over my head given how Hinata and the rest seemed so laid back, yet upon careful consideration I realize things are not quite over. The sole survivor must also be related to this whole incident. I couldn’t help but panic, yet Hinata replies to me with a scoff.

「Hehe, you don’t have to worry about that. Nicolas, who remained at the home nation, has informed me that the last person has been taken care of as well. He also mentioned that he had found out that the crystal ball with your message was tampered with. He seemed to have used it as evidence to condemn and execute that remaining person.」

A frigid smile curls on Hinata’s lips. Even though I’m just watching from the side, her expression is quite frightening. It almost seems like a beauty is contemplating something (devious). I suppose that’s one of the reasons why Hinata is often misunderstood.

Let’s put that on hold for now.

「Hold on a second. Who exactly is this last person?」

It may just be my guess, but could he be that 「Master of Sun」Gran who is apparently stronger than Clayman? If that’s true, this man called Nicolas is not to be underestimated either……

「It should be the head of the『Seven Celestials』, 『Master of Sun』 Gran. That man seldom goes on the offense, so he is probably the one remaining.」

「Really? He actually managed to beat that Granbell. By the way, isn’t Nicolas the cardinal who pledged his life-long loyalty to you? What method did he use?」

「It’s nothing to brag about, but he seemed to have prepared 『Disintegration』 beforehand. He caught Gran off guard by casting the shot on him unexpectedly and took care of him.」

 

「I see how it was…… Granbell has gotten old to have fallen for a lowly trick like that……」

Ruminas mutters lightly with a gentle sigh. But this news brings me no joy. My wish has fallen flat now that there’s one more dangerous man out there. With that being said, he seemed to have got the better of his enemy by surprise, so he doesn’t seem to be as dangerous. However, it’s best not to get too careless. I may be an exception, but「Disintegration」 is very dangerous to most other people.

Cardinal Nicolas, I’ll take note of that name.

「About that, Ruminas-sama, the Granbell you just mentioned, is it referring to the 『Master of Sun』 Gran?」

Hinata asks Ruminas.

She doesn’t seem to recognize the name Granbell.

「Right. That guy was originally called Granbell. He was once the Chosen Hero of 『Light』 and had even fought against me.」

Said Ruminas to Hinata, reminiscing in a slightly childish manner. It almost felt as though she was pretending to forcefully sound arrogant, or am I just overthinking it? Even though I’ve been surrounded by ambiguous famous figures who come out of nowhere all the time, could she be……

Just as my thoughts drifted towards this direction, I received a furious glare. I must be overthinking it!That’s why I should just keep these doubts to myself.

「I see…… I couldn’t have guessed, but——」

Hinata seems to have something on her mind that she’s concerned about, yet she couldn’t manage to voice it.

「He used to be very strong, strong enough to stand against me.」(Hinata)

「That’s true. Since 『People who become Chosen Heroes will be bound by causality[23]』, he may have resented me deep down in his heart.」

It’s all clear to me now. Just as Milim mentioned, Chosen Heroes and Demon Lords both cannot escape the effect of causality.

Granbell only pledged allegiance to her because Demon Lord Ruminas defeated him. But perhaps he had a lot of other emotions bottled away. Even though he was able to mentor many heroic and legendary figures, he couldn’t escape the cycle of causality. Have you heard the tragedy of Darth Granbell the wise? It’s not a story the Seven Celestials would tell you. It’s a Ruberios Legend. So powerful and so wise he was able to mentor many heroic and legendary figures. He became so powerful… the only thing he was afraid of was losing his power, which eventually of course, he did. It’s ironic he could save others, but not himself. 

These however are just my guesses.

「But, we can finally be reassured now. Demon Lord Clayman, Farmus Kingdom, the Seven Celestials, all of the trouble-makers have been taken care of.」

Hearing my conclusion, my subordinates with Benimaru in the lead, all nod in unison.

   

「That’s one thing resolved now.」

Rigurdo laughs mirthfully. Noticing that the previously tense atmosphere is gone, I speak cheerfully as well:

   

「Hehe, that’s true. Even though there were some tricky opponents, most of the problems seem to have been taken care of now. However, it would spell trouble for us if there’s still someone out there furtively plotting against us. Had we not discovered the existence of those scheming merchants, I would have suspected the person responsible for all this to be Yuuki.」

Honestly, Yuuki is highly suspicious. He knew that I headed to Ingracia Kingdom and had connections with Hinata as well, so he was a prime suspect. That’s why I still hold mistrust towards Yuuki despite my heart telling me not to.

「Yuuki? Are you referring to the head of Freedom Association, Yuuki Kagurazaka?」

I reply with a 「Yeah」 since Reynald asked. You can figure it out if you think about it calmly. He may be the most suspicious based on the circumstances, but Yuuki has nothing to gain from me and Hinata fighting. Since there was no motive, it doesn’t make sense to consider Yuuki as the mastermind pulling the strings.

《......》

In other words, I can interpret it as someone intentionally framing Yuuki. Perhaps it was an elaborate trap set to make me suspect him. This is something that those eastern merchants are capable of. They even had a hand in arranging conflicts at different locations. If the 「Seven Celestials」 are the masterminds, it would make sense why the merchants did it.

However——

「Yuuki being the mastermind… It’s definitely not him——actually, I can’t really say that.」

Hinata claimed so right after I had finally became reassured.

   

「Hold on hold on, are you suspecting your fellow countryman?」

「Huh? I’m just considering all the possibilities. Moreover, it may be too soon to conclude that the masterminds have all been eliminated. After all, we still don’t have a clue about the people who defeated Roy, not even their motive. And the most central faction of the eastern merchants is still rooted in the Western Nations.」

I feel as if a bucket of cold water was dumped on me as these blind spots are pointed out.

She’s right, it is too early to conclude with confidence.

「You are right in considering that. We can’t be too optimistic before everything is resolved.」

I reigned in the casual attitude and said.

「It makes sense, so let’s inform everyone else as well.」

Benimaru nods along while the Holy Knights also seem to be on the same page.

「Just as Hinata has said, there is a high probability that the mastermind remains alive. It was me who suggested that the 『Seven Celestials』 are the culprits, but those are just merely conjectures. We can’t conclude anything without decisive evidence. We will have to keep our minds on the matter in the future as well.」

Everyone nods in agreement to my line of thinking.

Indeed, it’s not good to draw conclusions so preemptively. Even though I was quite confident with my deduction this time, Wisdom King Raphael-san didn’t agree. But nor did it deny, so perhaps it means that the possibility exists. However, evidence based on my thoughts alone is as good as nothing. That’s why I should trust Raphael-sensei.

The Holy Knights agree as well, so this will do.

    ***

Alright, now both of our parties have caught up with our understanding of the situation. Whether there’s a true mastermind lurking in the shadows or not——We certainly need to figure that out, but that is for later. Right now we should focus on the immediate problem, that is, our future relations, as well as clearing out any subsequent enmities between our parties.

It just so happens that Shuna then came serving coffee and snacks. The meal of the day is scones with chips[24].

As expected of Shuna; her timing is just perfect. We naturally go on to grab servings of the food while the Holy Knights sat there, looking somewhat bewildered.

「Oh, is that dessert? I want the ones on the large plate.」

Veldora is quick to join at times like this even though he didn’t participate in the discussion at all.

「Yes, I know that.」

Shuna responds as if she’s used to it too.

「Wow, this also tastes delicious.」

Seeing that Hinata has taken a bite, the Holy Knights jump in as well.. The environment of the venue became somewhat of a period of break and leisure.

I take a breath of relief as I finish my desserts. Switching gears, I say slowly:

「Next, we will discuss our future relations——」

「Before that, we have to be clear on something.」

Hinata cut me off.

「Regarding the incident, have you already accepted our apologies?」

「Yes. I don’t intend to hold anyone further accountable. That way, we can build a friendly relationship in the future.」

 

I answer.

This is not only my will, but the decision reached by executives such as Benimaru and the others as well.

There is no need for further conflicts. Since the misunderstanding has been clarified, we should just make peace.

 

That’s the answer we gave based on those considerations. But someone couldn’t accept it, that being Ruminas.

「That can’t do. Being indebted to someone does not sit well with me. It is obviously our fault this time, so that’s why we will have to compensate in some way or another. We will discuss peace-making later.」

Ruminas glowers at Veldora while speaking.

To put it in simpler terms, she just doesn’t wish to owe any form of favour to Veldora.

「Since Ruminas-sama has voiced her thoughts, I would like to inform you that I also still feel guilty giving you all the trouble. This is also our chance to show the highest extent of our sincerity.」

Hinata chimes in following Ruminas. With that being said however, regarding compensation……

As I mentioned just now, we don’t wish to resolve things with money. Ruminas’s party——Or rather the Holy Empire Ruberios—— if they are willing to recognise us……

With an additional public announcement of a permanent ceasefire and we’re all good.

「Hmm——If that’s the case, could you formally acknowledge our nation and form diplomatic ties with us?」

As I bring the matter up, Ruminas immediately agrees.

「No matter. But I don’t intend to be too close with you guys since I’ll punish that lizard one of these days regardless.」

Most of Ruminas’s animosity seems to be directed at Veldora, so worst case scenario we will just have to throw him under the bus as a sacrifice. If that is the price of eternal peace, I will make the choice without hesitation.

 

「Hold on, Rimuru. Were you thinking about something super mean just now?」

「You’re overthinking it, Veldora-kun. If you behave yourself and act intelligently, there is nothing to be worried about.」

「Wait a sec, aren’t you always thinking about something cruel whenever you add 『-Kun』 to whomever you address!?」

Tsk, Veldora has grown sharp as well. But, he’s still too naive.

「Ahh, don’t be so uptight. I’ll give you my scones, so just behave yourself around Ruminas.」

「What? I should handle it well if that’s the case. By the way, once I get serious, getting Ruminas’s recognition would be a piece of cake! GA——HAHAHA!」

See? Veldora is very simple-minded. Even Ruminas looks dumbfounded by it. But, she doesn’t seem to be retracting her promise.

「Don’t get ahead of yourself, B-BAKA! Well then, I shall make this the exception and cease hostilities from this day onward for the next hundred years. We may even form diplomatic ties with you in the process. This will be the sign that I indeed have compensated you.」

Ruminas immediately declared a truce like it was nothing. The level of her frankness is astounding.

Umm, is this really okay? I’m surprised. The same goes for Benimaru. Even the chiefs such as Rigurdo are shocked at Ruminas’ decision. The same goes for Hinata and the rest, though none of them seem to have anticipated this turn of events.

「It’s ok if it’s just a pact of non-interference, but are you really going to form diplomatic ties with them?」

Hinata asks. However, Ruminas doesn’t seem to want to answer.

「Annoying. I’ve already made the decision!」

She throws out her response almost as if saying 「I’ll leave whatever comes next to other people」 while taking another scone. Hinata really seems to want to express her concerns, but she also doesn’t plan on defying Ruminas.

「If that’s the case, we can only obey.」

She nods in agreement with Louis’s statement and begins to contemplate how to conclude the whole ordeal. However, someone just doesn’t seem able to accept it.

「Diplomatic tie? If we do that——」

Reynald says.

He peeks at Hinata, as if uncertain if he should bring up his issues with the proposal.

「It’s actually not bad. If Rimuru-dono’s party were truly evil, we wouldn’t be alive at this point.」

「Indeed. Rimuru-dono and his party are worthy of trust. We should rid ourselves of the bias against monsters.」

「I concur. For instance, Souei-sama has much the style and elegance of a gentleman.」

Fritz responds somewhat frivolously while Arno and Ritase add on. Even the man of few words, Bacchus, seems to have given the green light.

However, Reynald is still very cautious despite what his companions have said. As expected from the vice-commander of the Holy Knight Order; he is not willing to compromise that easily. But the circumstances seem to have given him some ideas, so Reynald speaks with determination.

「However, there are still problems remaining. What should we do about our doctrines? Due to its influence, the whole world will point fingers at the Western Saints Church. We can’t allow such a thing to happen no matter what.」

   

The doctrines——The prohibition of co-existence with monsters—— is that it? Indeed, once they acknowledge us, what would become of those doctrines? Things seem to have become more complicated just when we thought it would all be over.

Yet just as my thoughts went in that direction, Ruminas, the individual responsible, drops a bombshell.

「How boring. I didn’t make those doctrines anyway, so I won’t consider it to be a betrayal if we stop following them. Those are basically just some signs of direction for the lost lambs of the civilian masses, which the people in charge at the time drained their brain in coming up with.」

Ruminas’s statement had quite the impact. Not only the Holy Knights, but even Hinata is astonished as she mutters 「What!? That’s the first time I’ve heard of it……」

「Is that so? It’s nothing strange really even if you didn’t know about it. Even though the base scriptures of the doctrines are still available for browsing, the original manuscripts about its origin have long since been lost. You should have an idea of how our religion came about after reading those manuscripts.」

Louis replies to her flatly.

Here are Louis’s explanations:

It is said that the origin of the doctrines is for the protection of the people believing in Ruminas. It may be a different case for advanced species such as Ruminas and Louis, however lower vampires require raw human blood to maintain their livelihood. Moreover, it is rumored that the blood of humans overflowing with joy is particularly appetizing.

At the time when monsters in the world reigned supreme, people had to strive just to survive. And in terms of the vampires, they could only receive inferior human blood, which posed a life or death problem for the vamperic race. It was because of that that Ruminas took the opportunity to draft a plan to protect humans.

The reason why she moved her kingdom seemed to have been due to Veldora-san…… But I suppress my urge to inquire about it. After all, trying to pry into the matter would simply be asking for more trouble.

「Because I need to protect my innocent people, I allowed them (humans) to live with joy. Moreover, if there is ever any threat posed by Demon Lords, the humans would feel reassured that someone is protecting them. In this way they can peacefully enjoy their life. The people of Ruberios were thus protected in the name of god.」

Although this may be a bad metaphor, they seem to be 「Livestock」. *Demiurges approves greatly*

Even though it is said that they need to suck out raw blood, they really only need a tiny amount, mostly unnoticeable by the donor. And after all, there is an overwhelming amount of human citizens compared to the population of vampires there, so it is understandable.

The price of living a safe and secured life is by donating one’s blood. It’s almost a win-win situation.

「In other words, in the holy scripture——in the doctrines of Ruminasism, many entries were added in to prevent unnecessary casualties because of monsters?」

「Indeed that is the case.」

「To me, the important thing is having a heart of belief. Aren’t you all capable of using 『Holy Magic』 due to your faith in me? It is a form of contract and an iron law. The task of protecting my people is a duty for my vassals, something I don’t really value at all.」

   

In other words, her conclusion is as follows:

No tolerance for coexistence with monsters——This doctrine is nothing but a cheap product in an attempt to control the people’s faith. If that’s the case, there is no need to follow such a doctrine strictly. They can’t afford to go to the extent of forcefully altering the doctrines, which would plunge the Western Saints Church into chaos. To put it simply, they only need to find a reason to persuade the people to accept us.

This is the solution I guess, but Reynald still doesn’t seem to be able to approve, wearing a grimace on his face.

 

「I can sort of understand that our doctrines didn’t come from the divine will of Ruminas-sama. But there is a very real question at hand, that we have always been leading our lives following the doctrines. There will be problems if we simply discard them……」

Indeed, if they are to completely ignore the previous directions, the followers and the current establishment of the Church would no doubt experience extreme backlash. Even if Ruminas showed herself before the public, there is no saying whether or not they will believe she is the real god itself. More importantly, there is no way Ruminas would ever do such a thing…… If that is the case, it will go against the long established beliefs of people who still stand with the doctrines and cause internal division.

Reynald seems quite troubled by this matter.

「Even if that’s the case, we still have to do it. I was trying to keep the situation down a notch until the issue gets resolved, yet you had already mobilized hundreds of troops. The news has probably already spread to the other nations. Moreover, didn’t all the reporters from the Western Nations witness the defeat of the 『Three Martial Sages』?」

Hinata responds in a serious tone as she shifts her gaze, glancing over at me.

 

Hinata has a point. Diablo mentioned that he defeated a man called 「Three Martial Sage」 Sare, There was apparently someone else at the scene, but then he turned tail and ran. After the reporters’ eyewitness testimony of this chain of events, the status of Hinata and the rest of the guardians of mankind is surely going to suffer a disastrous decline.

In addition to the news of the defeat of the Holy Knights, there will likely be unnecessary chaos. Although according to how Diablo put it, he may be able to pressure the reporters……

Ayy, how troublesome.

 

「If that’s the case, we can just resolve it by claiming that Hinata and I ended in a draw. Since we discovered the evil plan of the 『Seven Celestials』, we were able to declare a truce. My true identity as a slime is already public knowledge, and if the broadcast adds on the information that I am a reincarnated 『Otherworlder』, shouldn’t that, to some extent, be acceptable to the public?」

「That indeed sounds like quite the great proposal for us. But, are you really okay with that? Wouldn’t the news that a Demon Lord ended up in a tie with me tarnish your prestige (as a Demon Lord)?」

Prestige?——I’ve got none of that.

I feel like Shuna’s been lecturing me a lot lately. Whenever I encountered anything troublesome, I just tossed it to Rigurdo to deal with it. All I did was travel and chill with Gobta…… That’s why a tie or two won’t really have an impact on my name.

「There shouldn’t be an issue. You can even say that I was defeated.」

Anything goes with things like victory or defeat. I answered the way I did because it was simply what I thought, yet it seemed to have a profound impact on Hinata and the rest.

「I mean, if you consider carefully, there are very few real examples of humans defeating a Demon Lord. There will be severe consequences if you just go and simply claim something like that. It may even cause the balance of power to collapse.」

 

「T-That’s exactly the case! You’ve just become a Demon Lord. If you allow other factions to look down on you under such circumstances, you’d be asking others to intrude on you and your domain!」

Hinata and Reynald both try to persuade me out of it. Most likely because they are worried about me, however……

「Benimaru, do you know of any possible forces that may invade this land?」

「Not at the moment. Even if there is anyone foolish enough to invade, I shall destroy them for you.」

Hmmhmm, how reliable.

As for the Western Nations, Diablo is making proper arrangements. The rescued reporters seem to have become his tools to exploit, so right now he seems to be pushing his plan forward with an iron fist. As reports have pointed out, sooner or later Youmu would be crowned as the new king. Even the small neighboring nations near Farmus are helping to accelerate the process. If that’s the case, the only country left that possesses sufficient force to battle against us would be the Ingracia Kingdom. Right now with Ruminas’s promised hundred-year buffer period, we’ve effectively conquered the Western Nations.

It’s the same with the Demon Lords. I defeated Clayman in front of their eyes, which had quite the effect in setting an example. As long as I remain alive, even if the news of my defeat comes out, they probably wouldn’t believe it. They may suspect it is a trap and instead proceed with caution.

「How confident. I have no objection if that’s the case. Then we shall take your proposal graciously and use it effectively.」

「While we’re at it, why don’t you make an announcement about how the residents of our nation 『Are not bad people』!」

 

「You are right. Honestly, the citizens of this town are all very kind. It is hard to believe that they are goblins and orcs.」

「It is still debatable whether demi-humans are monsters or not. But I think those are just discriminations caused by bias.」

「Right. It would certainly be challenging if the humans become hostile against demi-humans while races such as dwarves are considered as an actual part of humanity. If they are categorised as monsters, even the elves would fall under the same category.」

Races such as ogres and lizardmen were originally considered as demi-humans, yet due to their hostility against humans, they were categorized as monsters. As for their evolved forms (Youki and Dragonewts respectively), they are not categorised as monsters but instead as Earth Deities.

In short, the only point of distinction is whether they are hostile to humans or not. For this reason, it would be impossible to lump all monsters together as enemies.

「We have had diplomatic ties with the Dwarven Kingdom as well, so it would be fine if we talk King Gazel into making a hundred-year friendship. Wouldn’t it add some credibility to our promise to not attack humans?」

 

Hinata nods, seemingly making her mind up as well.

   

「I suppose that’s fine. It would be much easier to persuade them and earn their trust. Moreover, since we have the opportunity, we may also eliminate the people with deep connections with the 『Seven Celestials』 in the process.」

It seems that the Western Saints Church is not so unified either. But it isn’t anything strange. I guess that’s just what it means to be an organization.

   

Hinata’s voice was ruthless and cold, so no one dared to object. She plans to take the opportunity and push all the charges onto the 「Seven Celestials」. Even though this method seems dirty, that’s Ruberios’s business. It’s not an issue we can have a say in, so we’ll just let them have their fun.

Then we begin to discuss the details.

For future communication, Arno and Bacchus decide to temporarily stay here, though they will first need to return to their home nation for preparations. They apparently plan to bring some civil servants along as well. As for us, we plan to take the time to construct a Ruminasism church for their accommodation. I don’t think it’ll take more than two weeks’ time. We should be seeing believers of Ruminasism coming in and out of our nation in the future as well. Although it is disconcerting to acknowledge religious freedom, it’ll all work out in the end. If there’s a will there’s a way.

Honestly, the monsters don’t believe in any god. There isn’t a single almighty deity that is widely recognized in this world, which is quite different compared to my previous world. There are indeed religions, but they are more like, for example, tributes to the earth deities. In a practical sense, they believe in deities who would actually respond to their prayers with actual aid. A good example would be the Worshippers of Dragons who revere Milim. Among the many religions of this nature, Ruminasism holds the greatest power. The hands and feet of Ruminas that are the Holy Knights would aid the weak, thus earning the trust of the public. If we change our perspective, we can just consider this as our nation receiving a branch of the Western Saints Church that will help the weak.

I figure that even though there may not be such a chance, we may still help each other out if there is ever any trouble. When any threats appear, we may fight alongside the Holy Knights. Then, we will have no reason to say no. Naturally they will be under surveillance, but they can receive some freedoms.

And just like that, we were able to come to a compromise on the whole thing.

    ***

This concludes the difficult topic.

We’ve made a deal with Ruminas and the plan for the Holy empire Ruberios to acknowledge us has also been properly laid out. Those would be sufficient as compensation. We will only have to build a good relationship through communication on top of that. The duration is one hundred years, so we will utilize this period of time wisely so both parties can better acquaint themselves.

Given this is the case, we will be doing exchanges with the Holy Knights on a regular basis, starting with the sharing of our technology. This battle has greatly damaged their weapons as well, so I suggest that we will help repair them. On the surface, we’re just demonstrating how high the technological standards of our nation are, but our real intention is to examine the properties of their weapons.

We first got our hands on a set of those rare armaments of light[25]. Wisdom King Raphael-sensei said it would offer the user’s mana——which is their spirit aura——to the spirits so that they can be materialized. Because it (the sample) has been destroyed due to overcharging, I exchanged it with a set of armor that Garm crafted. The Holy Knights seem to think it was a bad deal, but they still gave it to us without reservations since they felt sorry for the incident this time.

I initially thought that Hinata would have objected, but it turned out she didn’t. That’s why I decided to gift her a sword that I personally handcrafted. And speaking of the sword Hinata uses, its name seems to be 「Moonlight Rapier (Moonlight)」. I heard that Ruminas gifted it to her and that it possesses great power. Or I should say, it’s a little overpowered. I figured that it was just a special-grade weapon of the highest level, yet it turned out to be a legendary weapon.

According to Kaijin and Kurobee, (the quality of) 「Magisteel」 will evolve over time. That’s why after a period of time, first-class gears would apparently evolve as well, their quality increasing exponentially. The evidence is the items retrieved from ancient ruins. It is said that they’ve discovered ultra-quality gears that modern technologies cannot replicate. These things are crowned the titles of legendary and were even sealed (hidden), so normally there wouldn’t even be a chance to lay eyes on them.

Both Kurobee and Gard seem to be aiming to craft such a weapon. The two were mesmerized after laying eyes on Hinata’s Moonlight Rapier. I hope they reach that goal someday.

Moreover, due to how incredible the sword is, it is only used in crucial moments. If she tries to unsheathe the sword in the town, it will cause enormous hazards to the surroundings considering its level. It would be like carrying a rocket launcher instead of a pistol for self-defence. There’s no way you can just casually swing something like that around on a daily basis. I gifted her a sword based on these thoughts, and she seemed to like it a lot more than I expected.

Hinata’s rapier was destroyed after I devoured and recycled it, so I created a new sword after analyzing and improving upon her previous weapon.[26] Its quality has reached special-grade[27], so it shouldn’t be much different in practice. After all, even its special ability of 「Dead End Rainbow」 was also recreated.

I also took in the broken greatsword called Dragon Buster or something. Its quality is surprisingly garbage. Seriously, how in the world could that thing possibly defeat Veldora?

There’s also things like the「Gears of Holy Spirit」——But they wouldn’t allow us to see that. It is unique to Hinata and the original gears for the Spirit Armament. Aww, I really wanted to analyze it——

《Notice. Said information has been collected during combat and completed with 「Analysis」.》

…….Umm...what?

C-completely flawless in action, Raphael-sensei. Or should I perhaps address you as grandmaster from now on?

   

《......》

Ah, you don’t seem to be in the mood for that I guess. I should just thank you nicely in advance.

 

Ok, this is epic. And speaking of which, Raphael sure is a ruthless character. With the result of the「Analysis」 of the inferior version of the Spirit Armament combined with information from my fight with Hinata, we seem to be able to recreate the「Gears of Holy Spirit」. It seems to originally be a piece of equipment with Holy-element, but based on its principle of function, it may be modified to possess monster-element.

Sorry~ Hinata.

「Gears of Holy Spirit」 appear to be some confidential equipment on a national level, and now we have made it ours using 「Analysis」. It doesn’t seem easy to use, so I have to figure who to give it to.

And just like that, we’ve added another powerful item to our nation’s arsenal.

    ***

It was evening by the time we finished reaching an understanding on the exchanges. Since we are done with everything, I suspect the Holy Knights will want to return early, but I still invite them to dine with us out of courtesy.

「Right, Hinata and Ruminas. It’s quite late already, so why don’t you set off tomorrow?」

I was just saying, really.

 

After all, Ruminas can use 「Dimensional Transportation」 to return anyway. Hinata no doubt has already logged a location in Ruberios using the elemental-magic 「Waypoint Transportation」as well. And of course, it would be the same for the (other) Holy Knights. They are all powerful individuals above Rank A, so they don’t need to worry about how to return.

They would probably answer with 「We are truly sorry, but we should leave since our business here is done」 or something along those lines to quickly bail.

   

However——

「We are truly sorry——」

Hmm hmm, that’s right——Or so I thought, but what Hinata said next was completely unexpected.

「——to bother you, but since you’ve asked, do bear to accommodate us tonight as well.」

 

「Yeah. I liked that hot spring very much, and the food was delicious too. I’m looking forward to tonight as well!」

Hmm? How strange? Not only Hinata, also even Ruminas doesn’t seem to be planning on returning. Seeing that the two have made the decision, even the Holy Knights who planned to return have changed their minds. With smiles on their faces, they start to chat happily with their fellow colleagues.

Are the Holy Knights really okay behaving like this?

   

But those are just my thoughts. I can’t take my words back at this point in time. Since they are already looking forward to it this much, let’s give them a good treat tonight as well.

    ………………

    …………

    ……

「So, since this is the case, we are having sukiyaki[28] today!」

「「「WOAHHHHH!」」」

「.......」

How should I put it, up until yesterday we were still enemies, yet now my subordinates are having a jolly fun time with the Holy Knights. Ahh, that does put a smile on my face…… but there is just a small part of me that feels 「Is this really okay」?

In this world, clergymen who can’t eat meat seems to be a non-existing taboo. It must have been due to the lack of food that they are not picky about what they eat. For this reason, I decided to treat them with chicken-duck and cow-deer[29] we recently started to develop. There are also freshly picked vegetables. Shuna has made this effort since they will be more suitable in a hot pot.

The bones of the chicken-ducks would be brewed into broth soups while their meat would be served raw like sashimi. The main course would be the the jowl meat of the cow-deer, which will be served with the sukiyaki for everyone to enjoy. In addition, everyone will get one sanitized chicken-duck egg as well. That should do.

They will definitely be delicious.

「Well then, to the prospect of a lasting friendship, cheers!」

   

「「「Cheers——!」」」

The feast today begins after my toast.

First we have the cooked rice that was well received yesterday. Don’t be so picky with its black colour. It would be a waste to share the white rice reserved only for me with these people who don’t know its value. Only Hinata is looking at my bowl enviously, so I ordered to prepare some for her since we both came from the same place.

Plain white rice[30] is the most delicious rice after all, although fried rice tastes very good too. We requested Brumund Kingdom to provide us with rice to cook, but there was still room for improvement. Those couldn’t compare at all with our white rice.

「 There’s even white rice……. Aren’t you living too much of a perfect life[31]?」

Hinata says to me, seemingly displeased. Her voice was shaking a little too. Could it be that she isn’t contented still?

「If you have a problem, you can return the white rice——」

「I never said that!」

 

Hinata interrupts me while shielding her bowl.

Are you really getting worked up over something like that? How childish——But those are just my thoughts; I’d better not say it out loud.

 

「But, it’s truly astounding, baffling even how you were able to recreate the food from that world so perfectly. You managed to build such a comfortable environment in a mere span of two years……. The things we desire, yet are incapable of accomplishing, you have done so easily……」

 

「It’s nothing really. But you can praise me more.」

   

「Jokes aside, when I heard the rumors from Yuuki, I thought he was exaggerating. But that was because even Yuuki had only heard of these rumors through his espionage agents. It’s truly hard to believe without seeing it for yourself…....」

   

Hinata says frustratedly.

It’s no use telling me these things, not to mention the fact that I still haven’t been able to reach my end goals anyway.

「No, this is still not enough. The transportation of goods is way too slow while the speed of information transmission is subpar as well. Even though there is magic, the issues concerning our living environment and food have only been improved to some extent.」

「To some extent……. Geez… it’s like you are mocking all of our progress so far. How dare you even say such a thing after recreating all these delicious dishes!」

My statement seemed to have ticked off Hinata.

 

With that being said however, progress will stagnate once you start getting complacent. I am the king of a nation after all, so my ambitions should be grander. King in name while also being a Demon Lord……

「That’s precisely why, even though the food aspect has been satisfying, we are still lacking in culture. Our entertainment industry is also lacking. Like the manga Veldora reads, that’s the type of recreation I hope to make.」

   

「Recreation? Seriously?…… when people already have to give everything they have just to survive in this harsh world!」

「Yeah, that’s true. That’s why we are working on eliminating threats like monsters. There’s no point in hiding anymore, so I’ll make this clear now. I plan to make Youmu the king and build a new nation. Moreover, we plan to establish an influence on the Western Nations.」

   

「What are you on about? I want an explanation.」

Since you want an explanation, an explanation you will get.

   

「I have a lot of ideas, first of all——」

I begin to discuss ideas for the future while eating the sukiyaki.

The current plan is to have the human society accept us. Given that all the leaders of the world have come to know us, this plan is halfway to success. There have even been reports of suspected spies being sighted in our nation. We have thus showcased our harmless side to them without even noticing. The news should also be spreading among merchants and adventurers so that the civilians of different kingdoms will learn about the prospect of our coexistence. However, it will probably take some time before such an idea takes root. But we’ll get there one day, so there’s no need to rush.

Next in line is the preparation of roads. We are working on that aspect as well at the moment. We are constructing trade routes that can be travelled with the guarantee of safety. The roads to Dwargon and Brumund have been opened and now we are planning to commence new construction projects to the Sorcerer’s Dynasty Sarion. I also plan to work on the construction of the road to the Beast Kingdom Yuuazarina in the future.

Going hand in hand with this is the matter concerning communication. Since I had no concept for wireless transmission, I had to give up the idea. Now, even though it may be easy to seek answers from Wisdom King Raphael-san, it would be difficult to get everyone else to understand. The three dwarven brothers and Kaijin could probably understand, but I can’t rely on them for everything.

This will be a problem to study in the future. I wish to place my hope in the children and build up schools for their education. Right now we are only at private school (Terakoya)[32] level where we teach kids about writing and basic arithmetic. But I hope I can use my network formed during my time as a teacher to hire some human tutors.

But going back to the original topic, let’s talk about communication.

Right now the available communication network seems to be formed by communicative crystal balls that only mages can operate. Moreover, they stand the risk of being stolen given that they are magic items after all. In fact, there have been several cases of theft involving them. More importantly, we have to assume that there may be no available mage when an emergency call needs to be made. We have to find a medium which has no risk of being stolen and is also accessible to anyone. These are quite demanding terms, yet there turned out to be a solution.

I had my eyes on 「Sticky Steel Web」 and 「Magisteel」. I’ve already tried it with Souei. The conductivity of telepathic thoughts through my 「Sticky Steel Web」 is extremely high. There is also magicules within it so the clarity of communication is of very high quality. There’s also 「Magisteel」 which also possesses large amount of magicule. That’s why I suspect it has similar properties as 「Sticky Steel Web」. It turns out to be exactly the case after I ran an experiment. That’s why I decided to use them effectively.

I will process 「Magisteel」 into strings that have a diameter of around one centimeter and connect them to all the major cities using 「Shadow Step」. That alone won’t do any trick, but in addition with the device that Vesta and the rest developed, it is going to convert one’s thoughts into voice and image. The device can be run even without mana, which is why the devices can be installed as soon as it's developed. Therefore all we can do is to start preparing the necessary 「Magisteel」.

Due to our nation having a huge population of monsters, the iron ores stored in our warehouses would become magic ores overtime. We will be processing them into 「Magic Steel String」 and have individuals capable of 「Shadow Step」 to connect the wires. Since there isn’t any obstacle, setting them up would likely be effortless. Depending on how much we can make, we will not be connecting wires exclusively to major cities, but also the villages along the main lines of the network as well. We have that part planned out too.

We just have to wait for the development of a transmitter.

Coming from a world thoroughly defined by the Information Age, I can’t overlook the importance of transmission speed.

「What do you think, won’t it be convenient after it is completed?」

I brag to Hinata.

Once the communication network is complete, we will focus on creating recreation opportunities and developing our culture. My dreams are getting grander day by day, and so there are tons more things left to do. I hope that with the fulfillment of these dreams, we can finally live a safe and comfortable life.

Without noticing, the venue of the feast has turned dead silent. It seems that I was too mesmerized in my speech that all the Holy Knights had been frozen out of shock. In contrast, the eyes of all my subordinates are lit up with enthusiasm. My ramblings seem to have motivated them.

Seeing how we are acting, Hinata mutters, baffled:

 

「I mean…… Normally shouldn’t this kind of information be considered a state secret? Especially the part about communication, you can’t just tell people from other countries. Never mind, this is fine I guess……」

Hinata’s statement was like a bucket of cold water pouring over my head. I may have talked too much after getting a little too cocky. It’s all because of the alcohol.

——Such an idea (getting drunk) was another big misstep of mine.

I was too busy thinking about how I screwed up when Wisdom King Raphael-san takes things into its own hands.

《Notice. 「Status Ailment Nullification」 reactivated. In addition, (I am) afraid that the re-interference of said 「Resistance」 is impossible to engage at the moment》

W-what did you say! There is no use making up for the matter by complaining now. Moreover, this setting doesn’t seem to be switched on and off based on my thoughts. While ignoring my personal will, the effect of wines (poison) is forcefully nullified.

Didn’t I tell you that alcohol is not poison!? My complaints can’t move the stone heart of that cruel skill.

Riiiiight, I was drunk yesterday and had a headache this morning due to a hangover, all because I let myself loose and got hammered a bit too hard. Perhaps I wouldn’t have spilled that much to Hinata had I not been drunk. I’ll just give up my struggle and consider the incident my own doing.

But, it seems that I’m not the only one getting in trouble because of alcohol.

I peek at Hinata.

「Ayy ayy, isn’t this great, Hinata-sama?! That means he really trusts us! Anyway, let’s forget about that for now. I’ll happily take this meat if you don’t want it!」

The person in front of my eyes seems to be someone named Fritz. The jubilant looking man is combing through Hinata’s plate for good quality meat. I recall him being one of the captains. His actions (of picking up the meat) is precise and on-point. This type of absolutely fearless[33] behaviour must be the result of someone getting far too drunk for his own good.

 

As the meat reaches Fritz’s mouth, veins pop out of Hinata’s temple. It’s only noticeable because her skin is so white and tender——Of course that’s not the only reason.

「Fritz…… You have a death wish?」

「H-how strange? Hinata-sama, what’s with the serious look……」

He seems to have suddenly sobered up. Fritz jumps up from his seat ready to flee, but there’s no escape from Hinata. His chin was hit by a knife-hand chop, causing him to collapse like a puppet whose strings had been cut after suffering a concussion.

I plan to use this fool as an example in the future for what happens when you drink too recklessly.

Fast forward to the next day...

「About the things you said yesterday, if your city is that extravagant, beware of getting attacked by the angels.」

Hinata gives me this last piece of advice that she suddenly remembered right before departing.

The feast last night was not suitable for discussing such matters, but she seemed to have decided to inform us after considering our future interactions. It must be the angel army Elalude mentioned to Gazel.

According to Hinata, those angels with individual ranking of B+ would attack in an army of millions. The magnitude of which is unimaginable. They even have established a commanding system with positions ranging from captains to commanders. It’s rumoured that they even have generals. It is said that if one traces long enough back in history, they will discover that the angels have even once fought against the Demon Lords. Their abilities are unknown, but even when compared to the Demon Lords, they are still undoubtedly strong.

The angels would choose monsters and civilizations with highly developed cities as their attack targets. Even the Western Saints Church doesn’t consider angels as a friend of humanity. It becomes only natural if you look at it in from a different perspective, considering that after all, the true identity of the God Ruminas is actually Demon Lord Ruminas.

「I find those flying bugs annoying as well. I’d love to take care of them myself, but it would also reveal my true identity…… But since that lizard fucked me over, the Holy Knights already know who I am.」

   

Even Ruminas doesn’t seem to like the angels.

As for the Holy Knights, they seem to have sworn to keep Ruminas’s real identity a secret. Given that’s the case, we would likely have more room to negotiate the matter in the future.

「I’ve also heard about the angels from others, so I’m aware of it. If they plan to take on my country, I’ll have to fight against them.」

I have no intention of being courteous with them. Whatever this army in heaven thinks is their own business, but if they want to force those views on us, we’ll have bones to pick.

「Hehe, I knew you would say that. If that time comes, perhaps we will join hands in battle.」

「The same goes for me. I don’t intend to have my 『Capital』 destroyed again, whether it be from those flying bugs or that lizard. Rimuru, if you don’t wish to become my enemy, make sure you educate that lizard well.」

Leaving these words, they then depart.

This has been quite the meaningful experience considering the insights we gained from them. We hope to build a friendly relationship not only with Hinata but Ruminas as well. And so, the series of conflicts with the Western Saints Church and Holy Empire Ruberios is concluded with a satisfying ending.

Soon after, some time later——

The Holy Empire Ruberios, which has been holding an attitude of silent acknowledgement towards the Dwarven Kingdom, suddenly made a public announcement that acknowledges the dwarves as friends of humanity. They followed the statement up with the declaration of establishing diplomatic ties with the monster kingdom of Jura Tempest Federation. Even though there was a time limit, they also expressed the signing of a non-aggression pact with us. Not only demi-humans, but monsters as well were acknowledged to be a part of humanity.

——With this incident as the trigger, people begin to explore the new relationship between man and monster.

Chapter 2

Nations and Invitations

CN Proofreading: Orangerazor

Editor: Squishy, Voxel

The news can’t be kept a secret even if we wanted to. The rumor spread to the leaders of the nations surrounding the Jura Great Forest too quickly to be controlled.

——Hinata the Saint was defeated by Demon Lord Rimuru.

The information was released from multiple sources with great caution in order to prevent exposing the actual origin. The news was spread with much vivid description. It of course has to do with someone’s conspiracy. Yet without anyone’s notice, the rumors started to spread like wildfire.

No matter how secretive the attack was, it couldn’t have hidden from everyone. Tempest Federation is currently right in the middle of the public eye, and so the neighboring kingdoms have been vigilant in their intelligence gathering. Given the fact that the march of the Holy Knights Order has become an open secret, it only served to increase credibility of the rumor. As for the people who had received this news, there were all kinds of different reactions.

Some were fearful of Demon Lord Rimuru.

Some were angered by Hinata the Saint’s supposed incompetence.

Some found it to be rather unimportant and instead focused on what they could do to keep their own country safe——Some were taking cautious considerations to go about this.

Not only were there rumors flowing around; information has also been released through official channels. Hinata the Saint and Demon Lord Rimuru battled and ended up in a tie. The result of which was——

Holy Empire Ruberios and Jura Tempest Federation signed a ceasefire and formed a non-aggression pact.

This information being as loaded as it was, there were still more pressing issues that needed to be addressed. That is, the invitations sent out by said target of the rumors, Demon Lord Rimuru. The nations didn’t really trust the information put out by the Western Saints Church at face value. This event is already beyond comprehension, the entire world has and would be shaken by its occurence.

That is a common understanding among the leaders of the world. Although no one knows the details, the Holy Knight Order doesn’t appear to have sustained any casualties. This has become a decisive factor to the decision making of the leaders of the nations.

Troubled by a multitude of thoughts, the Western nations become ensnared in the upcoming turmoil.

    ***

The location is the Dwarven Kingdom, Armored Nation Dwargon. The top officials of the nation——The ministers of every department have gathered for meeting.

「That guy is up to no good again——」

A rather imposing voice rings in the meeting room, one that belongs to Gazel Dwargon——Hero King of the Dwarven Kingdom.

For the past few days, his covert agents have been busy. One by one they’ve reported in and the intelligence department has been working overnight to analyze all of the information they received. They have produced detailed documents and reports after analyzing video footage, making several copies before presenting them to the ministers.

The amount of information is enormous. As a result, the number of pages in the document is staggering. It’s no wonder they’ve been working overtime.

Nevertheless, the current state of affairs is already much more favorable in light of what has transpired over the past few months.. When compared to that time the slime Rimuru became a Demon Lord……

They hadn’t been able to catch a breath when, right after ascending, Rimuru dueled Demon Lord Clayman in a political nightmare. It was the same for the agents, intelligence department, King Gazel and the ministers of the kingdom. All of them suffered from a lack of sleep on account of that dire situation. Thinking back to that time, the current predicament is a piece of cake in comparison.

「He……hehehe. We’ll have to consider this as truth even if it’s unbelievable. Your junior has defeated that Saint……」

Pann remarks, though in response, the Commander of the Pegasus Knight Order, Dorf, a far more serious person, disciplines him.

「That’s extremely disrespectful of you, Pann. This is a public meeting room, not your own private quarters. Be mindful of where you are!」

Dorf gives Pann a stern warning.

Pann on the other hand shrugs and nods carelessly. But looking across the room and receiving nothing but critical glances from other ministers, he lets out a dry cough (in response).

 

「Don’t blame him, Dorf. Even I was surprised, so Pann naturally couldn’t have made it through the news without taking a jab at it.」

King Gazel intervenes to break up the tension and approves Pann's indiscreet remark. Perhaps everyone is really just so baffled by the reports that they now lack the fortitude to offer any criticism of Pann's comment themselves.

Speaking of the information in their hands, it contains the entire record of the incident from start to finish.

The content is shocking. The so-called strongest human warriors, the hundred members of the Holy Knight Order launched an assault on the monster kingdom in secret. Even the covert agents led by Anrietta, whom Gazel takes pride in, only got hold of their movement in recent days. Or rather, they only started to notice after the conflict between the two parties broke out.

However, since his agents have discovered it, the intelligence agencies of other nations must have found out as well, knowing that Tempest Federation has been infiltrated by many spies. Demon Lord Rimuru seemed to be aware of them already, but he simply let them be, likely for (commercial) self promotional purposes.

With such a large scale skirmish going on, no matter how stupid the covert agents may be, they had to be aware of the condition——and its result:

The defeat of the Holy Knight Order.

Demon Lord Rimuru’s subordinates were victorious without any casualties.

 

Thanks to the expansive report the spies assembled, Gazel and the rest had a firm grasp upon what happened, despite not having been at the battlefield.

「Your Highness, my subordinate witnessed the battle in person——」

As she finishes, Anrietta begins to give the detailed report.

According to her, Hinata the Saint and Demon Lord Rimuru seemed to have engaged in a one-on-one duel at the end. However, the magicule content of the battlefield was distorted suddenly and it interfered with all magic surveillance.

「——We also detected extremely powerful Youki (demonic aura) at the scene. I suspect our surveillance was influenced by it.」

「Couldn’t it just be a magicule storm that was powerful enough to interfere with the magic surveillance?」

「Jane-sama, I don’t think it was a magicule storm; instead I think it was vast amounts of energy of opposing nature suddenly colliding that caused the interference on our signal transmission.」

「Hmm, regardless, you were not able to see the result of the duel, were you? If that’s the case, how did you conclude that Hinata was the one who lost?」

The Court Mage old lady——Jane asks.

As Commander of Holy Knight Order, Hinata is well known for her ferocity. Moreover, Jane herself is one of many to have experienced that fierceness in person, so it is hard for her to believe Hinata’s defeat to be the truth.

「This may just be some form of indirect evidence, however, for the Western Saints Church, distinguished for their hostility towards all monsters, to suddenly revoke its long-standing doctrine as well as wanting to establish formal ties with us dwarves, possibly to gauge our intent……. There is no way a victorious Hinata would have allowed that. In addition, their home nation Ruberios is also changing its stance, forming diplomatic ties with Tempest Federation. They even went to inform every nation, which is basically the equivalent of an official declaration. Therefore, isn’t this sudden one-eighty evidence for the defeat of Hinata the Saint?」

「Uhh……. You have a point, if those stubborn-minded human-supremacists suddenly decide to change their minds on this……. It means that some factor is forcing them to do so, so I suppose we can consider this. If that is indeed true, King Gazel——The likelihood of Demon Lord Rimuru having grown stronger than you has become a lot higher.」

Jane says bitterly.

Although she doesn’t want to admit it, Hinata the Saint and Sword Saint[34] Gazel are similar in strength. If Hinata was defeated, it would imply that Demon Lord Rimuru has grown stronger than Hero King Gazel.

 

「That’s just nonsense!」

「Jane-dono, are you insulting King Gazel!?」

Even as the ministers begin to shout in response, Jane is not moved by it.

That’s an undeniable fact after all——Jane thinks to herself. Besides, Gazel agrees with her view.

 

「In the span of a mere few months, is it possible to achieve that much growth?」

Gazel sneers at the lack of crisis awareness in Jane’s question.

That can’t just be called growth anymore!

This situation has started to genuinely worry Gazel down to his core.

During their last encounter, he’d noticed that the newly ascended Demon Lord Rimuru was emitting a bizarre aura. He did not sense any sort of immense power, instead it was calm and peaceful, without much intent at all. While Gazel possesses the power to see people’s thoughts, even with his Unique Skill 「Dictator」[35], he couldn’t see through everything (about him). It meant that Rimuru has gotten complete control over his power.

   

「Indeed. He has evolved to a Demon Lord and possesses enough strength to rival me. It wouldn’t be strange if he could defeat Hinata.」

Gazel says with much consideration. Even though the actual situation is still unclear, his survival alone is already commendable.

Yet this still seems hard for many of the ministers to accept, as they respond to Gazel rather emphatically:

「But, but! How could a monster born only a few years ago even compare to your Highness, a hero?」

「Indeed. Could there be a mistake?」

「Moreover, if that is truly the case, won’t Demon Lord Rimuru be way too dangerous?」

They express their views one after another.

Gazel lets out an internal sigh.

If they are really considering that, then Demon Lord Rimuru would not be the only person posing threats.

His eyes fall on the document.

According to their spies’ investigation, Rimuru’s lieutenants also fought against the 「Ten Great Saints」. And the report shows that the monsters under his rule did not suffer a single defeat. They fought against the humans on their own and achieved complete victory.

There was even a distressing report that one of them had suppressed several Holy Knights all by themselves. If they decide to trust this report, it would mean that the total military force of Tempest Federation has surpassed that of Armored Nation Dwargon. The magic item used to record video footage was not precise enough to make sense of the situation, which is frustrating.

The video recording device is one of their proudest inventions, achieved only through the finest dwarven technology, yet it was unable to operate in locations where magicule content is distorted[36]. Not only that, but the video was unable to record any audio either. This information alone would not be enough to analyze the power levels of the people being recorded; trying to sort out the situation itself is already challenging enough. With that being said however, these documents are indeed important……

The footage did manage to capture some monsters that Gazel is familiar with. They are the Majins under Rimuru that Gazel conversed with once or twice in the past.

Have those guys grown stronger as well? At this point, they must be hard to defeat even with all of our nation’s might……

The ministers continue to argue about the issue, taking sides against each other about the severity of the danger. Gazel is troubled that both sides make valid points.

Ignoring the arguing ministers, he begins to ponder. He’s considering whether to eliminate the opposition before they become too much of a threat.

 

No——Gazel rejects such an idea outright.

Demon Lord Rimuru is a reasonable monster.

More importantly, he wishes for friendly co-existence with human nations.

The proof of this desire is the fact that he has built a civilised town and helped humans, all while trying to cooperate with other kingdoms. Had Demon Lord Rimuru not been a monster that understands and respects humankind, humanity would have faced an unprecedented threat.

Such worries are probably unnecessary. Kukuku, Rimuru would surely never consider destroying humanity!

Gazel firmly believes so.

Demon Lord Clayman was eliminated yet Hinata remains unharmed, this is a fact. For that alone, Gazel believes Rimuru will not be an enemy to mankind.

That’s why Gazel decides to laugh off the ministers’ concerns.

 

「Hehehe, don’t worry! That Rimuru is my junior. Moreover, unlike other nations we were the first to support him, thus winning his trust. Are you all wishing for me to abandon this trust and the benefits that come with it just to doubt Rimuru?」

His words are infused with Ruler Haki (imposing aura) so as to intimidate the ministers. Thanks to its power, most ministers manage to regain their composure.

「I-Indeed. Now that I think about it, it is quite stupid to abandon the trading opportunities with this nation——」

「Hmm, the imports from that nation are all quite charming. Even the production of healing potions is now dependent on that nation.」

   

「It is the same for their technology exchange, which can’t be established if we don’t have faith in them. So why are we getting panicked now……?」

「That’s true. We shouldn’t be worrying so much at this point in time.」

   

The ministers look at each other awkwardly and give an embarrassed smile. Seeing their expressions, a smile emerges on Gazel’s face as well.

 

Being frank and honest is the motto of the Dwarven Kingdom, even if the other party is indeed a Demon Lord, that doesn’t warrant discriminating against them. Seeing that everyone is reminded of this, Gazel feels satisfied as well.

Rimuru has indeed acquired astoundingly immense power, yet anyone who has witnessed how he treats others in life, would undoubtedly know that he is someone worthy of trust. Right now they are on quite friendly terms with this Rimuru. Given this is the case, their relationship must be maintained in the future.

Rimuru mentioning that he was originally 「From another world」is of great importance. He also has the ability to recreate the knowledge from the other world through his overpowered skills. His stubborn desire to be a bit more sumptuous became his motivation for which he has come up with all sorts of inventions. Even thinking about it makes him intrigued.

 

Moreover, his subordinates all greatly admire this trait of his and would carry out any task no matter how (purposefully) challenging they may be. The proof is the construction of a road between Tempest Federation and the Dwarven Kingdom. It is a road that crosses through mountains and valleys, yet one that anyone can travel safely. It was monsters under Rimuru’s rule who were responsible for paving this road.

His idea needs only a single command to be realized. Even things that the other 「Otherworlders」 previously gave up trying due to a lack of funds or labour pose no problem to Demon Lord Rimuru. He has the capabilities to push his plans through forcefully and is strong enough to have many monster followers.

It truly makes people envious——Gazel thinks.

No matter how hard the problem is, 「Everyone, let’s all work hard and find a solution!」——As soon as Rimuru gives off such senseless speeches, the monsters under his rule would strive with all they have.

Everyone would deem such order to be natural and justified without question. That is the real terrifying side of that slime, his almost genius ability to win people’s hearts. For better or worse, that Demon Lord is truly intriguing.

Perhaps I’m in that guy’s pocket too.

But, that would be fine regardless——Gazel secretly thinks to himself.

What will happen if Rimuru tries to build a world according to his ideals? To Gazel, it is a fascinating thought. He wants to see that one day. It will undoubtedly trigger the 「Tenma Great War」(Great war between Heaven and Monster). Rimuru is aware of that too, so he probably has plans to engage it.

Tempest Federation is indeed strong enough to become a fearsome military power, they may stand a chance to win against the army of heaven. If that’s the case, Gazel thinks he must give them his support.

「That Demon Lord Rimuru may not be related to me by blood, yet we are close like brothers. As long as that guy doesn’t lose his humanity, I intend to support him with all we have. We will welcome the arrival of a new age; a cultural enlightenment. Speak now if anyone has an objection.」

The imposing voice of Dwarven King Gazel Dwargo resounds throughout the meeting room.

This is the Hero King’s decision and his right.

「I support you, King Gazel. You are our big boss after all!」

The military Commander in Chief Pann replies laughing.

「My liege, I am your shadow. Naturally, I will obey your decision.」

Head of Covert Operatives Anrietta responds without hesitation.

「Go wild with your ideas. I don’t have many days left at this age, so I would like to live my life to the fullest during the last period of my life, to follow King Gazel to the end of the world and until my death.」

Old granny Jane who has lived since the time of the first king says morbidly, however lively. Jane’s declarations indicates her absolute support of King Gazel, no matter what.

There’s also Commander of the Pegasus Knight Order Dorf. He sighs rather helplessly and says:

「Since everyone has spoken, I can only clean up after them. There’s gotta be someone to come out and intervene in case he[37] gets out of control, right?」

This type of responsibility always falls on Dorf’s shoulders, but he doesn’t begrudge them for that.

And so——

With these heroes and highest of officials deciding on this new policy, no one can object——But that is just on the surface, the ministers still hold on to some of their own doubts. Nevertheless they would go on to publicly support the decision wholeheartedly, with the heroes’ decision as cover.

There is only one reason for that. As citizens of a powerful tech-nation, the cultural enlightenment the king mentioned earlier has excited them greatly. As a nation, there hasn’t been much progress despite their continuous efforts in technological research. Yet that Demon Lord has uncaringly and fearlessly pushed forward research at an unprecedented rate. The report sent by their ex-colleague Marquis Vesta supported this as well. Some even envy the freedom he has in that regard.

「How can Vesta-dono get to do whatever he wants like that?! Unforgivable!」

「I know, right!? Have you heard? It is rumored that the roads there have even had new anti-monster barriers installed.」

 

「And street lamps. I heard they are also developing some sort of communication device.」

 

「Developing potions alone must not be satisfying enough, it makes me jealo—I mean outraged at what they are doing!」

Along such lines, the ministers reveal their actual feelings towards the topic. Gazel smiles wryly as he overhears their complaints.

He coughs expectantly. Almost like a signal, the meeting room goes silent instantly. The ministers turn their eyes to focus on Gazel.

「I’ve come to a decision. Our nation will trust the Demon Lord Rimuru and move forward alongside him! We will be the ones to accept and carry out the duties of preserving their technology. Even if they get defeated by the army of heaven, their technology must not be lost! This is the policy of mine, the policy of Armored Nation Dwargon!」

No one planned to complain about it from the start since King Gazel always puts his nation first, concerning himself with its future.

The ministers all bow their heads in expressing their agreement to his speech.

「Kukuku, trying to capitalize fully on the benefits, I see? It sounds a lot better to just say it rather than wrapping it in lofty rhetoric.」

Pann’s comment resonates with everyone present.

They’ve also decided to accept the proposal from Holy Empire Ruberios, thus concluding the meeting. Some other civil officials can handle the procedures next, to form pacts with not only Tempest Federation, but also the Holy Empire Ruberios. Although it would probably be a future matter, but these two nations will probably collaborate with Dwargon to prepare for the 「Tenma Great War」. It is still unknown whether this judgement is correct or not.

But, this is good enough——Gazel thinks to himself.

As everything appears to be settled and King Gazel makes his leave, one of the ministers raises his hand.

   

「Sire, may I borrow a moment of your time?」

He hurries the individual with his eyes to report.

「The thing is this, my liege, Rigurdo-dono has sent an invitation. It states that Rimuru-dono will be holding a public presentation announcing his inauguration as a Demon Lord to the world…… he wishes for you to attend the ceremony——」

「A presentation announcing his inauguration as Demon Lord? What in the world is that guy thinking?」

Gazel in unable to guess Rimuru’s reason for this and can’t help but ask out loud. The minister being questioned, naturally, cannot answer either. He simply remains silent with his eyes wide open with fear.

 

And instead, the other ministers begin to argue.

 

「It must be an excuse. He probably just wants to show everyone how close our nation is by inviting sire there.」

「Hmm——hasn’t that ceremony (of his) been hosted in our nation already?」

「Oh oh, so it’s about that event! Marquis Vesta told me about it before. They are trying to hold a festival in order to change how people view the monster kingdom. I heard that Marquis Vesta acted as consultant in giving advice and even directing meticulously planned recreational programs.」

   

Pann’s eyes start to glow after hearing the ministers’ words as well, seemingly intrigued.

「Woah, that does sound quite interesting. The hotel in that country was also rather amazing. You get to enjoy taking a pleasant hot spring bath. The food was delicious and even the receptionists had great manners as well. I believe they were mentored by Vesta and thus were truly impressive. So the entertainment programs you mentioned will probably be quite interesting as well.」

Pann turns his eyes to Gazel upon saying so, implying that he should accept the invitation.

Judging from Pann’s looks, even if Gazel does not participate, he will probably volunteer himself in the king’s place.

 

Gazel contemplates for a bit.

Hehehe, that brat (Rimuru). I’ve got no idea what’s going on in his head, but he ain’t the type to play nice……

Gazel knows he is probably making an effort to have the Western Nations accept their kingdom, but he can’t see through Rimuru’s thoughts to be sure. But that’s what makes it fun.

Gazel is trying very hard to suppress the urge to laugh. It is after all, a difficult task trying to maintain prestige in front of the many ministers.

That guy……. He dares to set up this type of trap to give me a hard time……. How bold!

Gazel uses his newfound anger to mask his desire to laugh.

「So what does your highness think? Rigurdo-dono did say『It won’t be easy to get his grace[38] Gazel to be present, but if he is willing to attend the festival, we will be preparing the finest seat in hope of his arrival.』 They also seem to have informed the leaders of the other nations, so the available seats seem to be limited. He also mentioned that 『Since there will be many people attending, the venue will likely be in chaos on that day, so please respond as soon as possible.』 as a special reminder for us.」

The minister, trembling, reports Rigurdo’s messages to the silent Gazel.

Such a message is still considered quite inappropriate even while using a polite tone, which the minister worries may have angered Gazel. Yet Gazel doesn’t express anger towards such a thing. In fact, he’s actually somewhat confused by how the minister could have such a misunderstanding.

Gazel’s Unique Skill 「Dictator」 reads the minister’s thoughts with ease. And so Gazel speaks up to correct his subordinate’s misunderstanding.

「I shall attend the presentation and take the opportunity to tour the city.」

At his decisive answer, the other ministers begin to complain.

「Sire! No matter how close you are to this Rimuru-dono, you shouldn’t say this. I have no idea what extent are they planning to make these entertainment programs, but it should be easy for them to at least manage one seat.」

 

「Indeed. Moreover, it may not be clear as to how many people they are trying to invite, but the royalty and nobility from other nations shouldn’t have the free time to attend just like us. I don’t think they would accept their invitations so easily.」

「On top of that, your highness, attending in person will also lead to all sorts of problems!」

 

The ministers do make some good points. But Gazel ignores their views completely.

「There’s no such thing, rather I should say that he just has great confidence. You all only know what that guy was like from when he visited our nation before. He has changed completely since becoming a Demon Lord. Rimuru is being very direct with this festival, so we can expect much. Moreover, Tempest Federation has considerable military power now, so many must want to get some inside information on them. It wouldn’t be strange if some people feel compelled to go check them out after receiving the invitations. As Pann has mentioned, the accommodation (inns) in that kingdom is amazing, so the reason why they want to get ahold of the number of visitors is likely to provide specific kinds of services according to their needs. That’s how I see it.」

As Gazel finishes, Pann adds on in agreement.

「That’s indeed true. After becoming a Demon Lord, he gave off a powerful aura. Besides, I’m also highly interested in what type of festival those monsters would host. Even without representing the nation, I would still like to attend personally.」

   

Pann has already planned to attend the festival and he has already requested Vesta to get him an invitation, even if it’s just for himself.

 

Can’t let others get the better of me——Gazel doesn’t intend to back down either.

He already knew that most ministers would oppose the idea of him attending the festival in person. That’s why Gazel hopes to convince these ministers so he can participate without having to resort to drastic measures.

「I will not be attending as the king either, but as his senior to instruct him in person in case he gets looked down upon by people from the other nations. We must inform the neighbouring nations that the most friendly nation to Tempest Federation is us, Dwargon.」

As Gazel says so, some ministers begin to realize Gazel’s actual motive.

 

「I-indeed! We must be the faction with the best relationship with Rimuru, and we have to show off this point to the other nations.」

「Hmm. I heard that the people from Sarion also started ingratiating themselves to Rimuru-dono after he became Demon Lord?」

 

「Then we shall let everyone see how close he is with Lord Gazel, it will also serve as a way to keep the other nations in check.」

Gazel hides his delight.

But as he is going to add on something to make things work out more perfectly——

   

「These are all minor issues. I really can’t take it anymore. If we oppose his attendance, Sire will just sneak off on his own again. It’s safer for us to just attend the festival as a nation[39].」

The elders from the senate seldom raise their opinion on these matters, yet now they’ve given the ultimatum to the arguing ministers. This elder was probably traumatised from when the King snuck off after replacing himself with a body-double[40]. And as a result, with the words of the elder, the attendance of Gazel and the rest is settled.

I have a problem with that statement. But this way, I still get to attend the festival.

The conclusion is somewhat different from what he expected, but at least he got what he wanted. Although Gazel feels somewhat dismayed, he still decides to accept the result. To the invitation of Tempest Federation, they’ve decided to attend as a nation. As for the ministers, this result is completely different from their expectations, yet remains to be the official and final decision.

Then I will also have to attend in that case——is what more and more are starting to think. The venue becomes more noisy as well.

Soon after——

A bunch of people come forth to request their wish to accompany the king to the festival, which troubles Gazel in selecting his companions.

    ***

The location is Sorcerer’s Dynasty Sarion.

In the Emperor’s castle, there is a large beautiful and majestic garden containing a large number of rare, wild animals. The garden is maintained using a private fund from the emperor——in other words, the emperor’s personal stash. The emperor enjoys many privileges, and so he receives enormous profits from them. The maintenance cost only accounts for a small portion of the funds, and so this beautiful garden is of no financial consequence.

Moreover——

The maintenance of the entirety of this majestic palace does not use a single dime of tax money. It is evidence of the unimaginable wealth possessed by the Emperor who stands at the peak of Sorcerer’s Dynasty Sarion.

Two persons are currently resting in this garden. One of them is Duke Elalude. He is the father of the adventurer Elen and a key figure of the nation, whose authority and power is among the top three[41].

Sitting opposite to him is another person. This individual is far more important to this nation and possesses authority well above Duke Elalude.

This person being the Emperor——Elmesia Elaure Sarion[42].

According to official statements, this gender of the individual is unclear. The Emperor was born with the beauty to rival that of a female. It is declared to the outside world as such, but in reality she is indeed a woman.

The only thing, however, is that her age is unknown. Her Elven blood is extremely pure, which, in turn, prevents her from aging. She is also a living witness to history, so it is a major taboo to inquire about the Emperor’s age.

Her noble appearance is also not lacking in tenderness. Often, due to her petite figure, she is mistaken for a young girl.

She has a pair of almond eyes. Her jade-green pupils look as if they are capable of seeing through anything. Her skin is smooth like water with its white colour akin to fallen snow. Her silver hair runs down onto her pink and soft cheeks. The distinctive pair of long ears with sharp tips peek out of her silver hair. It blends with the rest of her body perfectly.

She is the most authentic of Elven race——so called 「Wind Elf (High Elf)」[43], the supreme existence.

For an instant, Duke Elalude is also mesmerized by her beauty, but (considering that) the fury of his wife and daughter is far more terrifying, he quickly comes back to his senses. He coughs and faces the Emperor once more.

Emperor Elmesia holds herself with decorum, seated on an elegant-looking wooden chair.

Duke Elalude says:

 「Sire, as previously reported to you about the Monster Kingdom, they delivered an invitation to me this time.」

The Duke takes out the envelope from his pocket and hands it over carefully.
