I sigh with relief after leaving Myourmiles’s estate.

Wonderful, now he has finally taken the task. There should be a lot to look forward to now that he has made a direct response to my invitation.

Our nation doesn’t have any monster who is good at managing money. Right now Shuna has been in charge of accounting, but this probably can’t continue. Right now she can still handle it at village-level, but if it rises to national-level, even Shuna will have to surrender. Lilina from the management department and Vesta who was a minister in the Dwarven Kingdom were there to assist her, but it’s undeniable that there is still an inadequacy of talent. It would also be impossible for me to do it, since it’s too troublesome.

It was then that I recalled Myourmiles-kun. This man is a master of finance even in the human society. He has traded with a bunch of nobles in addition to a few different kingdoms. It is quite the waste to have someone like him be a mere merchant, that’s why I think he will definitely be of use in my nation. And most importantly, Myourmiles-kun knows how to be flexible. If I have him in charge of finance, I can ask him to spare more pocket money for me. I’ve collaborated with Myourmiles in the past as well making money in secret, so I look forward to grabbing tons of cash in bigger actions.

Just kidding, there’s plenty of that in our nation’s treasury! But, all the money has been taken by me and not distributed as salary to my subordinates. This makes me feel… sort of guilty and stuff…

All of this belongs to Rimuru-sama——Everyone says, so I’m even more afraid to take anything.

I would definitely feel bad afterwards. All in all, I think that money should be spent on national development. However, we still need money. Not that I am personally interested, but because I have to bring that brat Gobta to the night shop again. Veldora was also arguing that he wants to come along, which is super annoying. Visiting that type of store would cost some money one way or another.

I’m (definitely) not personally interested, but Gobta and Veldora are really giving me headaches. This amount is nothing compared to the national treasury, but if it’s just my pocket money, the expense would be so ridiculous that I’d be spending it all in one place. Moreover, Shuna always gets my pocket money for me, but as soon as she heard the location I had visited she would confiscate my wallet immediately… Under those circumstances, how do I even dare to ask 「Isn’t the money from the treasury my money anyway?」

That’s why I'm working on side-projects to earn pocket money so that there will be no such concern in the future. I’ve even ended up with the intriguing plan to host a martial tournament. Myourmiles-kun truly has an outstanding talent. I have no idea how he has interpreted my words, but his enthusiasm for planning has exceeded my imagination.

Attracting crowds by hosting a martial tournament was his idea, and he also quickly came up with the plan to introduce merchandise as well as selling healing potions and equipment. He is indeed a visionary. These are amazing pitches.

After I return, I need to tell everyone to construct a colosseum fast. While Geld is helping the Beast Kingdom rebuild their city, Myrd will need to assist him as well. With the two persons in charge of the construction department abroad, I have practically become the one in charge.

 

But, that is totally fine. It’s probably due to the continuous construction projects that our nation has gradually given birth to new engineering talents. That’s why nowadays all I need to do is ask, without any need to do heavy work. There is a craftsman[62] called of Gobkyu, who is Myrd’s disciple. Now he has become a pillar of the town’s construction industry. If it is him, surely he will be able to build a gorgeous-looking colosseum.

Under normal circumstances, such a project would take up to a dozen years, but with the strength of monsters, the time can be reduced tremendously. With that being said, the time left before the festival is just barely more than two months. The remaining time available is insufficient, it would be impossible to complete all of the buildings. So we should just lay out the stages this time.

As for the design——

《Answer. Have extracted master’s memory of Colosseum ruins from ancient Roman period. Construction of blueprint based on this information…… Successful.》

——Just like that, easy peasy.

There’s still some paper left, so I start to sketch and add up my ideas on it.

Normally speaking, it will take at least a couple of months to reach this level of design. Field measurement, calculation of construction intensity etc. What makes it worse is that the time taken for these operations alone would be using the base unit of year, which would be more than common. In addition, the design graph of it is supposed to be sketched on computer for a few days, but now all I need to do is draw it out by hand…… The supports of Wisdom King Raphael-sensei on such details have also been boosted efficiency. Although I still feel that this is somewhat beyond common sense, that is but my belated comment, I should have more of an open mind.

Next, the design graph is done alright, but I still need to discuss with Gobkyu. Before that, now that I’m in Brumund Kingdom, I want to drop by the Freedom Association.

I should first hand the design graph to Gobkyu. When he has spare time, he can gather and lead the workers to the construction site.

Then, let’s deliver the message.

「Ranga, are you there?」

「Yes, my master!」

I summon Ranga. He sticks his head out from my shadow and responds.

Since the plan to conquer Farmus Kingdom has been settled for a while, everyone except Diablo has returned. But Ranga seems to have taken my shadow as his designated personal seat and immediately went into it.

   

I hand the sketched design graph of the colosseum to Ranga.

「Hand this to a craftsman in the town by the name of Gobkyu. By the way, could you help me by asking whether they have time to gather at the west gate?」

Knowing that I am not returning yet, Ranga seems quite anxious. I see that his tail is hanging low, but you need not worry that much. Despite how I look, I’m still a Demon Lord after all. At the moment I am not getting careless and have 「Absolute Defense」 running. If I actually run into an attack strong enough to break it, wouldn’t it be unsafe for me wherever I go? What Ranga is doing is called being paranoid.

「There’s not gonna be any problem. I’ll just be going to have a little chat with him. If anyone should warrant any worries, it would be Myourmiles. He seems to have become a target of some strange nobleman. There’s no way of knowing what that type of person would do.」

「Oh, are you referring to that vulgar man from before? Should I go and bite him to death?」

STOPUUU. Don’t do that kind of thing in towns of other kingdoms. It’s gonna cause huge problems.

「Geez, you must have gotten so aggressive because of spending all that time with Shion. I think you’d better relearn some normal values.」

「H-How so!」

Ranga is shocked at my comment. It seems he isn’t self-aware at all.

「During your last battle, did you really adhere to my order? Have you really not overdone things?」

「T-There’s no such thing, master——」

Range seems kind of shaken, could it be……

The only things reported back by Gobta and Gabil was as follows——「N-No problem at all!」, 「R-Right. We were lucky to have Ranga-san there, he was really reliable!」

I felt something was suspicious but did not ask for details. I had a feeling that it would just give me a headache if I had asked. Therefore I left those matters for Diablo to take care of and, since that guy hasn’t complained about anything, I’ll just pretend everything was fine. (Grigori: It was not okay)

This is what people call running away from problems. But, if there really was any problem, someone should have already reported to me, so I’ll just choose to believe them. I hope Ranga can be more cautious in the future to stay away from getting poisoned by Shion (‘s mind).

「Ranga-kun? Do it as a favour for me, please don’t act too reckless!」

 

I caress Ranga’s neck and gives him the caution.

「I understand——」

Ranga nods obediently in response, concluding this ordeal.

   

「Alright. Next, I hope you can deliver the message. One more thing, by the way, if there are any people available from the security department, send them to protect Myourmiles. Please confirm the matter for me as well!」

「Understood!」

   

With that being said, Ranga once again sneaks into my shadow and sets on his way to return home.

    ***

I’ve decided at last to send a guard to Myourmiles’s side. They will be protecting him in the dark without being noticed. Although I’m not sure who they will send, but there are very few individuals in the security department who can operate on their own. It’s safe to say it won’t be any rookie, the person coming will at least be a seasoned veteran at the rank of squad leader.

The squad leader is the team leader of a five-man squad. In terms of ranking for adventurers he will be at Rank B, tasking them as a bodyguard should not pose any challenge. During my stay in this town (of Brumund), I need to get hold of Myourmiles’s trace so that I will be informed if he encounters any dicey situations. Before the guard arrives, I will go see Fuze first.

I open the gate to the building of the Freedom Association branch in Brumund and enter. I accidentally went overboard last time, which makes me concerned about whether I will cause a commotion… But only a sight of「Who are you?」greeted me. Since the person didn’t say anything, I successfully made my way to the counter.

Oh right, I came in last time with that mask, so there is no way they will know who I am.

Never mind, this is fine. If they aren’t willing to help me contact Fuze, I’ll just drop the invitation and leave. With that relaxed outlook on my mind, I walk towards the counter.

「Heyo. My name is Rimuru. Could you help slide a message for the branch leader Fuze-san? Ah, take this, it’s my identity card.」

As I finish, I take out my identification card from my 「Stomach」 and show the reception lady.

 

How is such a young girl an adventurer? Usually I don’t mind hearing this. All I feel is 「Ah shit, here we go again」.

I’ve long gotten used to it by now, but luckily the reception lady still remembers me. She blushes and gazes at me mesmerized.

「Ah, you must be Rimuru-san! Long time no see! How have you been?」

 

「Hmm? I’m doing fine, very lively! I see you are doing fine as well, how wonderful——」

「Yes! I’ve been doing fine too. By the way, Rimuru-san, I heard that you’ve passed the test at HQ and even ranked up to B+. Impressive, I truly admire you!」

「Ah, right. I wanted to go through the Rank A test, but I’ve been busy lately.」

   

Actually I just feel it is too troublesome. Since I’ve already ranked up above Rank B, my access increased with it, and with it comes more responsibility. I’ve already felt there to be too much trouble at B+, but I’ll go for a higher rank when there is the need.

I’m not doing it for the salary anyway, yet I still have to move out when crisis emerges. But in return, I get to access all the nations conveniently and I also don’t need to pay resting and dining at different branches. To be honest, it is indeed delightful to have so much convenience covered in so many areas, but it would be really troublesome to have restraints put on me by others. But I don’t need to say such a thing to shatter everyone’s dream.

「If it is Rimuru-san, surely you will make it! I’ll be cheering for you!」

 

「Ah, is it now? Thanks a lot, hahahahahaha…」

It’s also very troublesome when she’s gazing at me with those shining anime eyes——Yet upon thinking so, the reception lady immediately drops the shocker.

「By the way, Rimuru-san, won’t you be very troubled that you have the same name as the Demon Lord? There’s something called 『Rename System』 that if you are truly troubled by it, you can re-register your name at the association. If you visit a location where no one knows you, you would be able to operate with the disguise of a lower-level rookie, what do you think?」

I-I totally forgot! I’ve become a Demon Lord, and using my name directly in public…

Nowadays, the name of the member of the Eight Star Demon Lords Rimuru Tempest the 「New Star (Newbie)」 is known by the world, wouldn’t it pose a problem to be an adventurer with the self-proclaimed name of Rimuru?

I should just stay away from the adventurer career. I’ll wait until whenever I am forced to move out as an adventurer to use my 「Rename System」. It seems that for me I can move out when lowered to Rank B, that should be enough. By the way, I never knew there was such a convenient system.

「Thanks. I’ve picked up a good bit of advice today. I’ll have to trouble you if I need that. Anyway, are you able to reach Fuze-san?」

「Ah, yes. Please come by and register by that time! Then, I shall lead the way for you.」

With all the other topics cleared, she immediately lets me go. Seeing that someone is personally guiding me, commotion begins to spread behind my back.

「Is this serious?」

「Who is that young girl!」

 

There are some conversations mixed in the voices, the one talking seems to have witnessed my prowess in battle last time.

「Eh, you gotta be kidding! That fellow turns out to be such an adorable little girl?」

 

「Unbelievable…… So that’s what the Rimuru-dono who defeated the lesser demon with ease looks like…」

 

「I heard he shares the same name as the Demon Lord.」

「Could this be the real deal——」

「Ya idiot, how could that be possible!」

「I guess you have a point, ahahahaha!」

Something along those lines. It seems more and more people are spreading rumors about me, though there is nothing to worry about, it’s all within what I expected. We only share the same name, it is fortunate that no one seems to realize that I am the actual Demon Lord.

It may be that the name 「Rimuru」 isn’t that rare after all. (Veldora: Am I a joke to you? Everyone: Yes!) As I think so, I walk towards the room Fuze is waiting in.

I enter the room casually. Upon seeing me, Fuze was holding his head. I didn’t give much thought to it and greeted Fuze.

「Heya~! I’ve come to play. What’s wrong with you, did something happen? What’s that distressed look on your face?」

「Uh… Everything was so peaceful up until just now, but a Demon Lord suddenly showed up…」

「Eh? Really? That would be terrible. Aren’t you being too casual?」

   

「No no no, that Demon Lord is right in front of me. Now then, what should I do…?」

「Eh, is that so? Hmm, I suppose you should serve him a cup of tea? And if there is any cake or food like that around, I think the Demon Lord would be pretty pleased to eat them too!」

「What cake! Do you think it is that easy to get luxurious food like that! Seriously, why does Rimuru-san, even after becoming a Demon Lord, enjoy coming and going wherever you please?」

   

While complaining, Fuze didn’t forget to prepare tea for me. You can’t judge a book by its cover, he is a serious man.

I say my thanks as I take that cup of tea. With a sip down my throat, We begin to discuss business.

「Rimuru-san, I’m really sorry this time. We weren’t able to successfully stop the Western Saints Church which led to the march of the Holy Knight Order……」

「Ah, that really couldn’t be helped. The masterminds seemed to have been the 『Seven Celestial Sages』.」

「Really?」

「So no matter how hard we have emphasized that the people of my nation are harmless, they would probably not listen.」

「It’s the 『Seven Celestial』...? Those people were the guardians of mankind, they were great heroes in the past——」

「So I heard. They had Hinata in their sights too, so after a series of incidents, she is luckily still safe and sound and our misunderstanding was resolved along with it. But unfortunately, there was one casualty. One of the captains called Gerald was missing.」

 

「Gerald of 『Fire』——Although he was not as good as Shizue-san, he was still talented in launching elegant spear moves combined with the magic of fire spirits. That man was one of the 『Ten Great Saints』 who are the protectors of mankind…」

Fuze mutters regretfully upon hearing my words.

The Gerald I saw was an illusion created as a disguise by the 「Seven Celestials」, so I wasn’t able to meet him in person and have no idea what type of person he really was. But since he appeared to be quite famous, Fuze would naturally know given how well-informed he always is.

   

While I said that he has gone missing, I suspect he has probably been murdered. I feel really sorry for Gerald-san, but all I can say now is rest in peace……

I then recount the events up until today. Just now Fuze has been worried about me, so I also tell him about the Walpurgis Banquet. I mentioned that the Demon Lords have been reduced to eight people and their names changed to 「Eight Star Demon Lord (Octagram)」. I also tell him about my conflict with Hinata and how the 「Seven Celestials」 died. Mindful of my promise, I brushed over the part about Ruminas’s true identity vaguely. Although people may say that my lips are never sealed tightly enough, I’m not thick-headed enough to have revealed such an important secret.

「I see how it was… No matter how we had approached or tried to make contact with them, it would have all been obstructed at the gate. I even sent people to the Church headquarters after communication with the Western Saints Church branch failed. But, I couldn’t get in contact with anyone higher than the rank of priest…… I never imagined that the 『Seven Celestials』 would have been plotting behind the scene.」

「Hinata said so too. But, their faith towards Ru——correction, the God Ruminas was true, that seemed to have also been confirmed by Hinata.」

「Humans are too fragile, that’s why we want to rely on the power of god——」

「Does Fuze do that too?」

「Haha, I’m not like them. When I run out of my last breath, it would be the end of me. I’ve lived all my life with that resolved in mind. Although I do pray for miracles, I do not pray to any 『God』 that I’ve never met.」

I see, so Fuze is an atheist. In this world, monsters with supernatural strength will be worshipped as earth deities to be respected by man. But they would only do so after meeting said beings. It was no exception for Ruminas: in the beginning she seemed only interested in protecting individuals that she had known well. Fuze has never met such a god before, that’s why he relies on his own strength. It may sound very pragmatic, but it is easy to understand.

「I can indeed understand how people feel the need to pray to god. But in reality, what god is capable of doing is probably only within their own abilities. To put aside God Ruminas, it is sufficient to say that the incident has brought us and the Western Saints Church together in peace.」

It is precisely because I know the true identity of the God Ruminas that I know praying is a meaningless action. But at the end of the day, it is but empty talk. Sometimes prayer alone would bring people strength, it is not something I can just simply rebuke.

 

「That’s right. I personally feel as if a huge burden has been taken off my shoulders.」

Fuze smiles as he finished.

He seems to be quite troubled by achieving pitifully little while struggling to persuade the Western Saints Church in accordance with our deal. Seeing how much he cares really makes me happy.

 

I’ve talked from start to finish about all of the events as we chat. I rise up as I bring the conversation to a close, but suddenly recall something.

「Then it is about time for me to leave, here’s something for you.」

I take out an envelope from my pocket and hand it to Fuze. The envelope contains the invitation for the Kingdom-Founding Festival that is planned to be hosted in my nation. I almost forgot about it during the intense exchange. This is my purpose of visiting today after all.

「And this is?」

「We are hosting a celebration for the presentation announcing my inauguration as Demon Lord. Being titled an opening festival, we plan to have some fun. I’ve also sent out invitations to the royalties and noble in the neighbouring nations, Fuze, you’ve got to attend it as well.」

 

「Huh? Hold on, Rimuru-san. Even if I attend——」

「It’s alright. We have an invitation for the King of Brumund as well, so help me deliver it along the way.」

「Why don’t you just directly——Ah, is it not convenient…」

 

「Indeed. I have people directly sending the invitations to the Dwarven King and Duke Elalude’s side, but I’m not familiar with the people in other nations. A monster running directly towards them may cause a commotion, so I’ve had people send them to the Freedom Association branches in their respective kingdoms. I did meet the King of Brumund once, but is it really okay for a Demon Lord to go there in person?」

 

I said with a smile, Fuze grasps the invitation with a wry smile: 「Things are already bad enough when a Demon Lord comes here.」

「I’ve now indeed got the invitation. I’ll make sure to hand it over to the king.」

Fuze changes his expression and makes his promises. Now that my business is done, I do plan to leave for real now, but this time I’m interrupted by Fuze suddenly speaking up upon recalling something:

「By the way, the head of Freedom Association has been worried about Rimuru-san as well. He was drained during the negotiation with the Western Saints Church, I’ll inform him later that the problem has been successfully resolved.」

 

So Yuuki has been worried about me. A lot has happened since I last met that guy. I get a nostalgic feeling.

 

「I see, it seems I’ve given Yuuki some unnecessary trouble.」

「It’s not unnecessary. Honestly, the Association doesn’t wish to antagonize the Western Saints Church, so he judged that it would be most ideal to find a way to peacefully negotiate.」

Fuze told me not to worry. But, I kinda want to give something to Yuuki in return——

「Speaking of! Let me invite Yuuki along. Or would it cause some problems?」

「About that, I’m not exactly sure. Although I’m not qualified to say so, he is still quite the busy man. I’m not sure if he can find the spare hours……」

「I’ll cover his transportation for coming and leaving, is it possible for him to have one day off? If he can’t then I won’t push it, I’ll just go play with him later. That’s all, please help me deliver this to him as well.」

As I finish, I start to write a letter in front of Fuze and put it into the envelope along with the invitation. I hand it over to the shocked Fuze.

「Rimuru-san, where did that paper come from…… Uh, never mind. Besides, if it’s only a letter I can do the favour utilising the magic of 『Teleportation』.......」

Fuze seems exhausted. I may be a little bit too casual with asking people for favours.

   

「Ahaha, sorry. Then, I’ll be counting on you.」

「I understand, Rimuru-san.」

「Ah, just one more thing, Milim is coming to the opening festival too.」

As I confirm Fuze has taken the envelope, I deliver such an astonishing statement.

「Milim? Ehh, do you mean…」

「I’ll be leaving first then, that’s just how it is~!」

I smile widely as I bid him farewell to quickly flee the scene.

「Hold on! Is that supposed to be THE Demon Lord Milim??? EH, OIII——!」 Some tormented voice seems to be projecting in my direction, but I’ll just pretend I’ve heard nothing.

    ***

After leaving the location of the association branch, a man jumps out of my shadow to greet me kneeling.

「My name is Gobuemon (ゴブエモン)[63], I’ve come to answer to my liege (陛下) Rimuru’s summon.」

The man calls himself Gobuemon and is one of the hobgoblins that I named. He is quite ambitious, I recall hearing news about him fighting with Gobta over the seat of vice-captain back when Rigur was still captain. Naturally, his strength is guaranteed…

「Eh, didn’t you become a centurion? And didn’t you move to another corps because Gobta became the captain of the goblin riders?」

If he is able to become a centurion, it means he is more than capable of being a commander. No squadmate has been given the title[64], and he doesn’t actually have a hundred-men as subordinates[65]. But of course, it is a higher position than squad leader, compared to a squad leader who can lead five to ten men, the strength of a centurion is far beyond that.

「Yes. Honestly, I don’t want to work under anyone. Right now I’m trying to work on my own. I want to recruit direct subordinates that only answer to me and build my own troops.」

Oh oh~

 

This guy’s got some bone in him. Good, because he doesn’t want to work under Gobta, that’s why he is not interested in the position of vice-captain of the popular goblin riders troops, so having such ambition is as expected.

「I see, then I hope you can learn well. Myourmiles-kun is someone I really rely on, so please protect him vigorously and avoid being noticed. In addition, his way of manipulating people’s hearts is worthy of studying. Even though most people work for him due to the temptation of profits, that is definitely not the only factor. You can learn from him while protecting him.」

「Yes! I’ll keep my liege Rimuru’s words in mind and carry out my duty with dedication!」

Gobuemon is fully motivated.

According to Benimaru’s observation, Gobuemon is too confident in his abilities and often looks down on the (flawed) traits of his subordinates and companions. That was also the reason why, despite his constitution and other results being superior to Gobta, he didn’t make the part of the captain. If this mission can teach him to care about his subordinates, it would be fine to hand the whole corps to him. Therefore I hope he will undergo some growth through it.

「If you complete this mission well and learn something along the way, report back to me then. As your reward, I’ll gift you this dachi (sword) that I’m using right here.」

Kurobee has informed me that my special sword has been crafted. Which means, I’ll be bidding farewell to this dachi. At first I only had someone make it as a replacement, nowadays its quality has become incredible after being intensely submerged in my youki (demonic aura). I had it repaired once after the battle against Hinata, even Kurobee was shocked by it then. It would be pretty appropriate to make it a reward.

「R-Really?」

 

Gobuemon is flattered, his eyes opened wide, bursting with excitement.

「That’s right. Considering your abilities, you should be able to wield this sword. But, you must work harder to get my approval!」

「Yes sir! I, Gobuemon, will meet my liege Rimuru’s expectations!」

Departing with these words, Gobuemon runs off to guard Myourmiles. I intentionally dangle the reward before his eyes to lure him into doing my deeds, I wonder if Gobuemon got the message (lesson) or not.

 

Winning a subordinate’s trust isn’t a trivial matter. Just like the concept known since ancient times——the Feudal system, if there isn’t any mutual benefit, the relationship between the ruler and his subjects will inevitably crack. Speaking of this, I’m concerned about getting better myself, so I really shouldn’t be seen as a role model. I hope Gobuemon will prove himself in his own way and meet my expectations.

Alright, now all the invitations have been sent. Next, all we need to do is to ensure our preparations warp up before the festival. I hope we can host a grand festival.

With my mood flying high, I outline the necessary matters in my head.

Chapter 3

Preparation for the opening

Editor: Omnipotententity, Voxel

Proofread: Orangerazor

The location is a small, slightly disorganized conference room. Within stood two suspicious shadows.

No, that’s not all. There is also the shadow of a smaller person. It is around thirty centimeters tall, it possesses wings similar to those of a dragonfly. With this tiny person’s shadow as center, the other two sit opposite to each other.

It’s Ramiris and her two servants——Beretta and Treyni.

Dong~! ——With an imposing aura, Ramiris strikes the mini-table in front of her.

Then, she shares her feelings to her two trusted subordinates.

「This isn’t gonna work! We have to move away!」

Maybe she hit it a bit too hard, she rubs her hand in pain.

While looking at Ramiris gently, Treyni says.

「As expected of Ramiris-sama. What a great idea!」

「Right? Right?」

Ramiris nods in satisfaction and responds to Treyni with a smile.

The person who speaks up to persuade them is the other person——Beretta.

「One moment please. Putting aside whether or not this is a good idea, where are you planning to move to? And could you share the reason?」

Why do I have to be that guy——Beretta thinks anxiously.

Speaking of his colleague Treyni, she is kind and attentive, a very capable woman. The spirits also really like her, all of Ramiris’s labyrinth is under her management. These are abilities Beretta does not possess. She is undoubtedly, to Ramiris and himself, a useful talent.

However, there is still a problem with her. That being Treyni has been absolutely spoiling her master, Ramiris. She agrees to Ramiris no matter what she says without even a single shred of doubt. That’s why, before things get problematic, someone has to intervene.

I can’t stand it. I didn’t follow Ramiris-sama to be that type of character (the guy to intervene)......

Ex-Demon-Clan member Beretta mocks himself.

Beretta really likes Ramiris and he doesn’t feel any pain even after being toyed around by her. But, his colleague that stands together with him not only does not advise (persuade) Ramiris, but even blindly spoils her in her palm, which is hard for him to accept.

Unfortunately……

That is the true nature of this world, the serious people tend to suffer losses.

This will be bad if it continues——Whoever stands up to hit the brake will also be responsible for cleaning up the mess.

As such, Beretta will be playing the unfavorable role today……

 

「That is a great question! Isn’t it super boring living here, Beretta-chan? There is nothing fun to do, unless you count making golems perhaps. There aren’t many visitors normally anyway! But there is a lot of fun stuff over there. That’s why we should go there and have fun. That’s how it is!」

Ramiris stresses energetically.

Hearing this, Beretta sighs inwardly, thinking 「That’s just what I expected」.

Beretta has no direct reason to object to Ramiris’s suggestion. The only thing is, based on Demon Lord Rimuru’s personality, he doesn’t think the man would easily agree to it. Even if she wants to move directly to there, it is possible that she will eventually get kicked out. Reasonably speaking, Treyni should also understand this, but as his colleague, she keeps on caving to Ramiris. This has forced Beretta to take a stand.

「But Ramiris-sama, hasn’t Rimuru-sama already rejected this plan?」

Indeed, she has been rejected once already. That’s why without a proper reason, it may displease him.

Ramiris may not be so self-aware, it is however a huge problem to Beretta.

「Beretta, you are overcomplicating things. Rimuru-sama is a good and kind-hearted person. If someone as cute as Ramiris-sama makes a request, how could he possibly refuse her so ruthlessly?」

Beretta’s useless colleague just likes to make such optimistic claims all day. She is extremely calculating and capable of encountering anything unrelated to Ramiris, yet right now she really cannot be relied upon. That’s why Beretta has to think on behalf of the two airheads to come up with the right plan. After all, Beretta also wishes to move closer to Rimuru.

Because of that, even in such a ridiculous situation, I can still find joy in it……

Beretta thinks to himself. The face hidden behind his mask is smiling cheerfully.

    ***

After Gobuemon departed, I returned to the town of Tempest Federation.

I have been using 「Dimensional Domination」 to travel, as it can teleport me instantly to anywhere I’ve been before. Its magicule consumption is quite large, but it’s a negligible portion of my total magicule storage. So it shouldn’t pose a problem, and I can use it however many times I want given how convenient it is for travelling. With that being said, it would suck if I entered stasis from overusing it. That’s why I have put some restraints on its usage.

By the way, as soon as I return to town, Ranga contacts me with 「Telepathy Net」.

Master, Gobkyu and the workers have gathered at West gate, but——

Ranga pauses upon saying this.

What happened?

Feeling somewhat uneasy, I walk towards the West gate.

Despite just talking about exercising restraint, I use 「Dimensional Domination」 to instantly teleport.

Then, I apply 「Universal Perception」 to sense the wide area beyond my visual senses to catch on to the location of Ranga. Next, I can easily activate 「Dimensional Domination」 as long as it is within my visible range. It is a lot like exchanging coordinates.

It is really convenient, but it should be pretty difficult to use it for combat. The activation requires some time, during which I fear that I would be wide open. It really depends on how you use it, in normal days——Uh, I gotta restrain myself.

This time it counts as an emergency event. I appear near Ranga’s location.

It is outside the west gate, Gobkyu seems to be arguing with someone.

——No, I’ve already used 「Universal Perception」 to find out who that is……

「I’ve already told you~ We are taking over this place!」

Oi oi oi……

I hid aside to eavesdrop, and as a result they said something so astonishing.

 

「Even if you say that, we can’t accept it——I’ll be reporting to Rimuru-sama right now. Please do not move around by yourself and stay here for a bit.」

「No way! We abandoned our previous labyrinth just to visit here! We are poor and homeless now, are you chasing us away!?」

「Even if you say so……. Anyhow, this land has been officially included under Rimuru-sama’s rule after he became Demon Lord. So you have to get Rimuru-sama’s permission first——」

 

「Tsk, it seems that playing the pity card didn’t work either. If that’s the case, we won’t mind resorting to violence. I’ll tell you now, my Beretta won’t allow you to keep fussing over such trivial stuff……」

 

It is no use to keep watching, so I conceal my presence and sneak behind the problematic figure. With a swift motion I simply pluck her out of the air. I look at her face. It is indeed Ramiris.

 

「What are you doing here?」

「K-KYAA——! How’s life, Rimuru?」

She greets me while avoiding eye contact. It seems she is aware that she’s in trouble. As for what this girl is up to, the secret lies within the small shack behind her. Ramiris declared that she had taken over the place, so there’s probably something hiding in it.

By the way, how did she build this shack here——

「Ramiris-sama! I’ve brought new wood!」

My question is answered as I see Treyni-san running here with wood in her hands.

「What are you doing here, Treyni-san……」

「Ah! I-It’s Rimuru-sama, long time no see——」

Treyni-san sees me and starts to act dubiously.

   

Don’t you guys think that your scheme would get exposed immediately after you built a shack right outside the town gate?

 

「What is going on here, Treyni-san?」

「A-About that, you must be misunderstanding. I-It’s not Ramiris-sama’s fault, it’s……」

Treyni-san always looked very professional in the past, but ever since she began to serve Ramiris she has started becoming inept. Sure enough, a servant will be influenced by their master…… Speaking of which, the only person who can explain this clearly is probably him——Beretta who immediately kneeled upon seeing me.

「Come and explain things a bit, Beretta.」

「Ah, so I have to do it after all……」

At my urging, Beretta gives up his struggle and begins to explain. According to him, all of this started because of a speech given by Ramiris.

「B-Beretta! You traitor——!」

Ramiris escapes from my hand and shouts, but I ignore her to listen to his story.

He said Ramiris wanted to move to our town no matter what, to which Treyni-san also agreed. I glance towards Treyni-san’s direction and see that her eyes are downcast in embarrassment.

Based on Beretta’s explanation, Treyni-san seems to be spoiling Ramiris. This rings true given it was the same when they met before. And since that Beretta can’t object to the both of them, he was forced into this whole charade of forced house moving.

「But in fact it is just as Ramiris-sama has said, we’ve sealed the entry to the previous labyrinth and moved here.」

   

「That’s right! So Rimuru~ If you chase me from here I’ll be homeless!」

Ramiris says pitifully, but no matter how you put it she clearly has it coming. Also, Treyni-san is saying 「How poor Ramiris-sama is」. Please stop spoiling the fairy.

But then again, now I understand the situation. Gobkyu didn’t start the quarrel. The fault was in Ramiris’s party.

「Gobkyu, thanks for being so patient.」

「There’s no need, we are fine. It did give the men guarding the gate some trouble though……」

Gobkyu turns to the ogre gatekeeper who is napping.

「——Oi.」

「T-There’s no such thing. I was just a bit too excited……」

「It is not Ramiris-sama’s fault! It was all because that gatekeeper said something mean to Ramiris-sama, so I used magic to put him to sleep for a bit.」

Treyni-san jumps in and interjects to defend Ramiris. What kind of farce is she playing……

It seems that she indeed used magic, apparently for Ramiris. Even Beretta seems dumbfounded. I’ll listen to Ramiris and Treyni-san later. For now I need Beretta to continue his explanation. However, he seems to have already finished explaining the entire situation. He mentioned that Treyni-san was preparing wood while Beretta was doing the assembling.

The end product is the small wood shack in front of me. They seem to be planning to build a balcony on its outside. Why build a shack? Apparently, it’s for creating the new entrance to the labyrinth……

Speaking of this, Ramiris had mentioned before about wanting to move to this town. If all they are doing it’s setting up an entrance to Ramiris’s labyrinth, putting such a small shack here doesn’t seem to pose a problem.

「So, you were trying to build the shack when the gatekeeper stopped you. And after you he interfered, you ordered Treyni-san to put him to sleep. And in the end you were discovered by Gobkyu and the other workers who came here, is that the case?」

「That…… no, there’s no…… such thing…… I guess you can put it that way, but it’s not really the case…… probably the case?」

   

「In other words, my guess was correct? Gee……」

   

「Aha, Ahahaha……」

 

Ramiris tried to laugh it off, but this is simply too reckless. This is my domain after all, even the other Demon Lords have recognized it. What Ramiris is doing is undoubtedly infringing on my territory. Normally, it won’t be strange if an incident like this developed into open war.

But right now I have an idea. Seeing the small shack in front of me, I had a sudden burst of inspiration.

After doing a bit of outside the box thinking, it won’t be so bad to let her create the labyrinth here. My conversation with Myourmiles from a few minutes ago echoes in my head. We need to find a main event that will have people want to come back and see our nation again. That’s why we have the opera house, the colosseum, and the health resort. But I’ve also been thinking about whether there may be other attractions. After all, doing the same thing all the time will eventually get stale.

Besides, martial tournaments can’t be held everyday. At most we can hold four events in a year, considering it would be most appropriate to hold once per season. The same logic applies to horse racing. Content for ordinary folk to watch can be played every day, but these shows alone won’t be able to attract the nobles who have grown a hard-to-satisfy appetite.

Considering this, our main customers would be average civilians and foreign adventurers. This town is designed with logistical flow in mind, so merchants will definitely be visiting. The adventurers acting as their guards will come too, so I hope they would consider this as a base.

An adventurer has many jobs to do, one of them being eliminating monsters. If I am to create a labyrinth here and fill it with monsters…… In this way, won’t we be drawing a massive crowd everyday?

Speaking of labyrinths, there is none that can top an underground labyrinth. If we invite people to try and conquer the labyrinth, there may even be adventurers visiting for the sole purpose of exploration.

Yes, this may actually work.

I turn to Ramiris who is looking up at me with an awkward smile. She is kinda…… No, very unreliable, but this may just work.

I’ve made up my mind and decide to discuss my idea with Ramiris.

    ***

I ask Gobkyu to direct the workers to dismantle the shack. But since the work is already in progress, we should change this place to a resting shack for the gatekeeper.

   

Next we hold a strategic meeting. With Gobkyu in tow, we went to the meeting room that is often used.

「Q-Question please? How do you[66] plan to deal with the adorable folk girl and her companions?」

Probably due to being too nervous, Ramiris’s phrasing has become weird. It is probably because of her crisis senses. She keeps on peeking at me.

「You don’t have to force yourself to act so courteously. Besides, not all of your words were as humble as you think, even the way you addressed yourself sounded weird.」

That’s why I hope she can just use her normal tone to talk. I don’t intend to do anything to Ramiris anyway. If she accepts my proposal, I’m willing to overlook the whole charade put on by her.

But before that, I need to confirm a few things.

「Gobkyu, I want to create an evacuation space under the colosseum, is it possible?」

 

「Even calculating based on the strength of an individual executive, the area under the stage is still not very safe. Once any hole is made, it may cause the entire stage to collapse. But, it would be possible by shifting the position a little bit——」

「I see. I also wish to build a gate in that basement area.」

「——!」

 

「Building a gate?」

「Yes. Please make it thick and pave some stones to the walls to make it feel solid enough.」

   

「Will we be preparing evacuation space behind the gate too?」

   

「No, there’s no such need. The important thing is just the gate, right, Ramiris?」

「R-Rimuru? Could it be, that you want to……」

Gobkyu looks confused while Ramiris on the other hand is filled with joy as she claps her wings loudly.

I finally crack a smile and nod to Ramiris.

Speaking of my proposal, it’s really nothing. I just want Ramiris to use her power to create and run an underground labyrinth. Rather than building the entrance in some shack, we should prepare something more fitting and majestic. Since we’ve defined it as basement level, it shouldn’t be a problem to build a colosseum on top of it.

The colosseum can provide amateur adventurers with lessons and instructions, and stores to sell healing potions are also expected to be set up. If we run an underground labyrinth like that, adventurers who are done with their business may grab a drink on their way home, so those stores (restaurant) would also prosper along the way. Then I’ll be able to grab money from the adventurers, and Ramiris will also have a place to live, not to mention a job. I will even give her pocket money. This idea requires mutual cooperation, but it may just turn into something interesting.

Ramiris begins to shout excitedly after hearing my words.

 

「Eh-EHEH! Could you be saying, that you are giving me some amazing job on top of allowing us to create the labyrinth and living here?」

「If you accept my proposal, that would indeed be the case.」

 

「Eh? Then, then, do you mean that I have a chance to overcome this unbearable state of being a NEET——?」

She seems very shocked after hearing my plan. Ramiris’s eyes widen as if she’s been hit by lightning, even the way she speaks begin to sound incoherent.

Treyni-san sees this with tears in her eyes and says：「This is wonderful, Ramiris-sama.」 For some reason, I feel that Beretta seems to be smiling. The exhausted look he gave before appears to be an act, now he looks positively delighted.

Could it be that Beretta had hoped things would develop this way too?

It could be, or not. In any case, it’s fine as long as he is happy.

「Q-Question…… Did you mean it when you said that you will give me pocket money?」

She seems to have calmed. Ramiris gulps and asks me prudently. She appears to be afraid that I will respond with 「Nevermind that」.

How would I say something like that, I’m not that mean really. But depending on the amount of income, I can’t really promise you how much you are getting though…… But that would at least reassure her a little bit.

「That’s real. The only thing is we won’t know how much profit we are getting unless we try. Regardless, subtracting the necessary expenses such as promotional fees and venue rent, you get to keep two percent of remaining gains, what do you think?」

「B-Based on that, how much money would that be?」

 

「About that, if we assume a thousand or so adventurers visiting a day, your portion would be around two gold coins?」

「GUU! I-I get to earn so much money!?」

「Those are just estimates, whether it can be carried out successfully is still unknown. After all, there’s not much of a show to put on if there is no audience. That being said, since you are already settling in here, isn’t there no loss to you regardless?」

Ramiris nods heavily in replying to my question.

   

She came to live here without permission and I know, without her saying, that I'll have to maintain the labyrinth. If that is the case, she’d be better off just accepting my deal. After hearing my permission for her to live and make money, Ramiris had only one reaction, that is to hug onto my head and shout excitedly.

Since Ramiris has already accepted it, Beretta and Treyni-san naturally would not object.

「Uhehe…… Now I will become rich as well. Never again will I be looked down on and get called the jobless broke Demon Lord!」

As such, Ramiris has been mesmerized in her own world. I couldn’t help but laugh at her state.

Alright, that should do it.

Even upon seeing the silly[67] looks on Ramiris, the loyalty of her two servants still remains the same.

She may have always been looked down on, but Ramiris’s motivation and enthusiasm are really something else. The level of enthusiasm she has displayed for the project seems to be even more than mine. It seems that I don't have to worry about her.

By the way, what’s with Ramiris’s obsession with money?

Putting myself aside, I’ve not heard of any Demon Lord that loves money this much……

Compared to having money or not, shouldn't the bigger problem be whether or not she has a job?

   

That’s right, no one has been visiting Ramiris’s labyrinth. Perhaps she was too idle and lonely. For Ramiris’s and my sake, I hope there will be adventurers visiting. In order to achieve that, let’s quickly come up with a plan to make that happen.

After calling back Ramiris, whose mind has taken a trip, we begin to draft the design graph for the colosseum construction.

My plans are as follows: Outside of the west gate, there is a plaza at the end of the road. We'll expand the plaza first then start the construction. Since there’s plenty of space, we can also open up a stable for the travellers to rest their horses in In the future we will be adding tracks on the streets for trains to run on. I recall planning for trains in hopes that royalty would ride on them. If we can ensure the safety of travel routes, it would be easy to attract wealthy tourists.

That, of course, would not be the only purpose of trains. With them we will be able to transport large amounts of cargo. This infrastructure will likely also contribute significantly to the city’s development.

Since part of this plan is a scheme with the hope of developing the city, I hope it works out well without complications. We may even set up a station near the colosseum…… It would become a burden for the tourists if the distance were too far, so the standard would be within an hour’s walk from the gate. Having a location near the town would be better. Because the tourists will be walking, we will get customers at the inns along the route. Unlike my original world, people mostly rely on their legs to travel in this world. Most people can easily walk back and forth for tens of kilometers. So it shouldn’t be an issue to have some distance between buildings.

 

Keeping these factors in mind, I consider the location for construction——

「Why? Isn’t there any empty lot in the town as well?」

Ramiris points out and corrects me.

「Those are used as shelters for the Beastmen. The temporary residences set there would pose trouble for building a colosseum.」

 

「Can’t we just chase the Beastmen out of town for now and construct at this place until Geld-sama finishes building their new cities——」

As I begin to explain to Gobkyu, Ramiris suddenly proposes something unexpected.

「If that’s the case, why not have them move into my labyrinth? You can move the area entirely into it without change and it won’t cause much trouble.」

Did you catch the drift? Gobkyu and I look at each other over and over.

「D-Do you mean that, you can move the people inside there along with the buildings?」

「Well——It’s probably useless for living people. It requires personal permission before moving them to the labyrinth. If the objects do not possess the personal will of the owner, it won’t be moved, otherwise anything can be moved!」

 

「Are you serious? Are you implying that except the beastmen, you can move everything including the residences and personal belongings all into the labyrinth?」

「Yep, that’s the case!」

 

Ramiris said so proudly, but it is indeed impressive.

There’s no wonder she seems so proud, this is an incredible skill.

After more careful inquiry, Ramiris says that this is her Intrinsic Skill, named 「Labyrinth Creation (Mini World)」[68]

As the name implies, it allows Ramiris to create the interior of the labyrinth. She is almost omnipotent in that regard.

The area affected by its power is also extensive, it is said that even the people and objects near the labyrinth can become its target.

For instance, if someone is directly outside the labyrinth, she seems to be able to deprive the individual of weapons and gear.

This skill may seem to be overpowered, but it does appear to have its limits. For example, if the person’s equipment possesses personal will——Or is affected by the user’s mana etc., it will not be affected by Ramiris’s power. However, people who possess such items are rare, so most would end up challenging Ramiris with only their bare hands.

She is a Demon Lord after all, that title is not just for show——

「How impressive…… And I thought that you didn’t possess any combat ability……」

「T-That’s so mean! How dare you say such things to me, the menace to man and the strongest Demon Lord……」

「Ah, okie, don’t get mad now, Ramiris-chan. Let’s put that aside for now and tell me what else can you do!」

I start to ask some specific questions regarding 「Labyrinth Creation」.

These questions roughly fall under five categories:

  1. How many floors can Labyrinth Creation make underground?
  2. How many days will it take to create them?
  3. What will happen to the monsters inside?
  4. Can you change the interior structure randomly?
  5. What happens when you die inside?

As such.

Ramiris also switches to a serious expression and answers all my doubts.

First,

There doesn’t seem to be any restriction to the number of floors it can construct, but in reality it can only reach around a hundred floors or so.

Second,

It takes around one hour to create a single floor. The same goes for added floors, so it takes around one hundred hours to spawn one hundred floors. However, the energy consumption creating deeper floors seem to increase significantly, which appears to be the reason behind the answer to the first question.

Third,

Not only monsters, even creatures such as insects can inhabit the labyrinth. I heard that there used to be spirits inhabiting the labyrinth before. That location has not yet disappeared, but was stored in another level to isolate it from the outside world. It is also said that they are free to come in and out. If that’s the case, we will be able to fill the labyrinth with monsters for adventurers to challenge.

Moreover, if you fill it with an abundance of magicule, monsters will be born naturally. By adjusting the magicule concentration, you can also conveniently predetermine the strength of the monsters. Monsters on different floors can be banned from interacting, so setting up difficulty levels seems to not be a problem either.

And the most important point is——We’ve come up with a way of filling the labyrinth with magicule. We will be doing that after we’ve prepared the contents for the labyrinth.

Fourth,

Ramiris’s Intrinsic Skill 「Labyrinth Creation」 has extraordinary efficiency, its interior structure can be changed in around an hour. After one change, it will be fixed for twenty-four hours. That is of course with additional conditions.

You can’t make something out of nothing. It seems that there’s no way to generate organism such as vegetation, so we can only rely on creating inorganic walls to make the labyrinth…… But it is not actually changing the whole structure, only the interior design of it that we’ve prepared, this way it won’t cost too much time. By the way, it is also very simple to swap floors. The previously stated rules apply, meaning every twenty-four hours only one change is permitted, but it’s still very convenient.

 

Fifth,

This is honestly surprising, but what happens when you die inside can be altered by Ramiris’s will. Provided she is aware of the situation, Ramiris can even resurrect the dead. I was still contemplating what to do about the disposal of monsters’ corpses and such and how to deal with the unfortunate deaths some adventurers may suffer. Well, as it turns out I heard something very unexpected.

We don’t have any examples of monsters born in the labyrinth to judge yet. However, Ramiris mentions that she has resurrected adventurers several times before.

The secret behind this is related to the 「Permission of the target」, as mentioned by Ramiris before. It isn’t an exaggeration but apparently the will of 「I would like to go in」 is crucial. It is a pre-condition, without which one cannot enter the labyrinth. It is the same reason why I was able to enter the labyrinth before. If you try to bring someone sleeping inside, you will be blocked at the entrance.

Infants are exceptions. Children of young age have yet to form free will, so they appear to be considered as goods and would gain protection. It is not impossible to force someone into entering the labyrinth, but this will also create a lot of pressure on Ramiris, such an action may fail due to the repulsive effect. So she isn’t willing to spend time doing such boring thing.

That’s about it, the prelude stops here.

Ramiris has the ability to rule over the people who’ve entered the labyrinth. With that being said however, it still requires the person’s consent. If they are willing to accept Ramiris’s management, she will be able to keep track of their status at any instant.

「That’s right, didn’t we really enjoy pranks? We just wanted to have fun watching how shocked people look, but my conscience won’t sit well if they had actually died. That’s why we always know when to stop and allow people to return alive.」

 

Ramiris says so with her chest high.

There were people who were unlucky and died, but that probably happened outside of the labyrinth. After all, Ramiris had no intention of killing me either back then.

And there was also the golem that tried to kill me, did they put that thing there knowing that people can be resurrected? I had wanted to say that 「What type of trial is this」, but now it makes more sense.

「In other words, even if adventurers enter the labyrinth to eliminate monsters they won’t get killed and can be revived?」

「Yes. As soon as they are thrown out of the labyrinth they will appear as if nothing has happened when they are resurrected from death. But it would be problematic when the number becomes too large, so it should be best to have them wear the items I’ve prepared for resurrection.」

With the identification items crafted by Ramiris using 「Labyrinth Creation」, people can revive outside the labyrinth even if they die. And so, the most worrying problem of safety has been resolved.

「Excellent! This is wonderful, Ramiris-chan!」

 

「Really, really, really? Am I not impressive indeed?」

「Hmm! Now our ambition is as good as accomplished.」

 

「Is that the case? I think so too!」

We look at each other and nod.

「Thanks for the help, Ramiris.」

「No problem, just count on me. Now you can rest assured like you’ve boarded a huge ship.」

A huge ship you said. I hope it’s not made of mud.

Due to the difference in our size, we can’t really shake hands, but we communicate with our hearts.

    ***

I’ve accepted Ramiris’s proposal, and I am now heading to the empty lot located at the southeast side of the town to build the colosseum. We will be building the underground labyrinth under the spot.

As for the opera house, we will be building it at the northwest side where many classy health resorts stand. There are also a stadium, museum and other buildings constructed in the hotel area that we built beforehand in case they come to be useful in the future, so we decided to build one more to catch up with the festival.

With the plans for the underground labyrinth and the opera house finalized, the problem is with the colosseum.

Geld is absent, but Gobkyu and his men are quite capable too. Before the unveiling of the opening festival, it can definitely be——

「——The situation is very dire, Rimuru-sama.」

Ah, so is the schedule really that tight after all?

But that is probably only natural. Normally speaking such construction projects will take years to complete, it is really asking too much from them to complete it in a month and so. No matter how powerful monsters are, it is indeed still a dire spot.

 

「Saw that coming…… I understand, I’ll help as well. I’ll handle transportation of soil, processing steels.」

Despite how I may look now, I’ve worked at general contractor company before I was reincarnated. Even though I was not so skillful in field work, having some knowledge of the discipline is better than having none. Moreover, I have Wisdom King Raphael-sensei with me as well, so I should be able to figure out something.

「I want to too! I’m gonna help too!」

「Then, I should also assist as well.」

「Indeed. We follow the will of Ramiris-sama.」

Since Ramiris and her servants have also agreed to help, let’s get to work soon. We come to the construction site full of camps and lay out the blueprint. I quickly modify it and hand it over to Gobkyu.

「I see. Then there shouldn’t be a problem anymore.」

「Great, I still have to let the beastmen know what we intend.」

First, we are hosting a meeting to explain things. Right now many beastmen are out at work, so I’ve decided to explain the situation to Suphia and Alvis.

「If that’s the case, we will follow the will of Rimuru-sama——」

「Right. We don’t have a reason to object anyway.」

After hearing my explanation, the two agreed without hesitation. It’s shocking how fast they agreed to it. They also told me to not to do any further explanation for the beastmen.

「Eh, is that really okay?」

 

「No problem, Rimuru-sama. We are in your care with residence and diet. We should be the ones to repay your debts, so allow us to help with the construction of the colosseum.」

「Besides, Karion-sama is also particianting the festival that Rimuru-sama is holding. So we have to help regardless.」

After saying so, Suphia and Alvis agree to assist us.

「I don’t really feel well, so I’ll hand the matter to Suphia.」

「Right, just count on me!」

 

After discussing with them, we decided to have Suphia lead the beastmen. Afterword, things progressed rapidly and everything was on point. The process was so swift it was almost shocking. With Suphia’s order, the beastmen all exit the tents. Glancing through the lined up beastmen, we have Ramiris move the tents into her labyrinth. In the next instant, the location has been cleared. While feeling somewhat hesitant, I activate 「Gluttonous King Beezlbub」 and bite up a square-sized notch in the ground to set up the steel structure.

With Gobkyu and the rest lining up and paving the processed rock materials to fill in the walls, we were unexpectedly able to construct a flawless beautiful product in only a day. And as such, this massive underground space is created with a huge gate set at its entrance. Given my advanced knowledge, the speed of completion has been quick beyond belief.

「A-Amazing. We are getting this as my castle…… Ah, right! I set it up so touching the door here will teleport you to the floor with all those tents just now.」

Since Ramiris has said so, we immediately go in to have a look.

The scene stretches out before us, the living space of the Beastmen has indeed been moved here in one piece. There’s even air-conditioning which makes living inside more comfortable than living in the wild. Even Alvis and Suphia look surprised.

「Do we still need to set up tents inside here?」

「Indeed. There doesn’t even seem to be any rain, so it shouldn’t be an issue if we just directly sleep on the ground……」

   

These are the two’s conversations.

There doesn't seem to be any complaint, so there shouldn’t be any issue. The Beastmen appear shocked as they go in and out several times. As long as the thought 「I want to go in」 is present you can enter it, so there doesn’t seem to be any inconvenience.

   

「Will it get dark at night in there?」

「Hmm! Since it is connected to the outside, I can even make it rain!」

There’s really nothing that will pose an obstacle to her.

Since they are not conducting any agricultural work, I ask Ramiris to only simulate the day-night cycle. It feels more convenient than I imagined as it can be applied in other fields. It has prompted me to consider all sorts of possible plans.

The Beastmen at the scene seem to be reassured and go on to assist the work outdoors. They are apparently under Gobkyu’s command to help constructing the colosseum. Although the majority of them are women and children, they are still Beastmen who are much stronger than humans. They are an impeccable workforce and Gobkyu is also willing to only hand simple tasks to them. The Beastmen who were previously receiving technical training have also returned to join in the construction.

Treyni-san has carried some lumber here of unknown origin with Beretta correctly processing them into boards for construction use. He is able to greatly shorten the time normally required for this by using magic to dry the wood.

I was under the impression that I’ve already thrown away things such as common sense, but upon laying my eyes on this sight, I couldn’t help but realize again 「Ah, this is an isekai alright.」

If we proceed at this rate, we may actually finish by the opening festival. The soil I just ate and spit out has also piled up as a small mountain, surely they will make good use of it as well to make a majestic colosseum.

「Rimuru-sama, leave the rest to me!」

I nod after hearing Gobkyu’s words and decide to let him do his thing until the project is completed.

 

When everyone officially started to work, Ramiris was left alone. In order to prevent the impetuous Ramiris from hindering everyone, I should give her a job. And if there’s any job Ramiris can work on, it would be expanding the labyrinth. Given this opportunity, we should be a bit more thorough.

Speaking of which——

「Ramiris, your 『Labyrinth Creation』 is really strong……」

It was a large area of land being moved into the labyrinth in the blink of an eye. Although I don’t really want to praise Ramiris, this one thing has left me deeply impressed. Honestly, I think this thing called labyrinth is really awesome……

「It’s alright, just alright! Right now there are only some secret rooms for my fairy friends, the level with aisles. There will be new floors added tomorrow!」

I recall she said that it was an hour per floor. If we are building a hundred-level labyrinth underground, it will pose a challenge even with modern technologies.

But, it will become true by Ramiris’s power. And given that is the case, a man should pursue romance (the things he desires)[69].

「Alright then, I’m counting on you to build the maximum one-hundred floors.」

「Eh! Do we really need that many?」

「Yes. I want to add in all sorts of contraption and change the strength of the monsters based on floors.」

「It’s a piece of cake for me, but can I ask about something?」

「What is it?」

「I’ve been curious just now, what exactly do you plan to do in spawning the monsters? Where are you capturing them from?」

Ramiris asks me.

It does seem quite exhausting to increase the floors to one hundred, it’s no wonder she would question me. But I have my own plan in mind. In order to convince Ramiris, I’ll let her in a little about my scheme.

「It’s actually like this, but you’ll have to keep it a secret……」

With this magic word, I begin my explanation to Ramiris covertly.

As I explain my plans for her underground labyrinth. Ramiris’s eyes become brighter and brighter.

「Oh, so you mean, you mean——」

「Hmmhmm——Next we will be doing this, Ramiris-chan——」

We whisper to each other and raise ideas. Both of us are enjoying this.

We had a pleasant chat——And we are rushing towards a direction that ideally we should avoid, the unexpected idea of an Advanced Dungeon is gradually formed.

Is it really okay? Although this though crosses my mind, there is no going back on the matter.

All we can do is make it.

Ramiris is also full of motivation and promise me she will devote herself to making the labyrinth.

「You can slack a bit while doing it.」

「Hmph! Now that I’ve heard such amazing ideas, how will I be able to sit back and relax! I’m doing it. I’m doing it!」

I intend to spark up Ramiris’s motivation a little bit so I spoke about it to encourage her, yet I didn’t expect to light up her spirit completely. I’m happy that Ramiris can understand that sense of romance; that such a bold idea may have a chance to be realized is what I’m looking forward to at the moment.

「Then please work hard. I’ll do my best to collect the necessary resources.」

「I understand. Good luck, Rimuru!」

「Right, the same goes for you, Ramiris.」

We exchange these encouraging words with each other, as a satisfying smile hangs on both of our faces.

    ***

I left after the conversation. The sun has already begun to set. We seemed to have chatted for a long time. The work today is concluded, and people start to pack up and cook food.

It would be embarrassing to be a hindrance to them, so I told Gobkyu, Suphia, and the rest to return tomorrow and then left the construction site after that.

I decided to drop by Kurobee’s workplace.

He’s been working on experimental weapons and gears out of interest. My visit this time is to ask him whether he can give me the products that cannot be sold as merchandise.

Right now, the southwest area of the town has become the industrial area. Kurobee’s workshop is also over there, with the workshops of his disciples surrounding it as well as dorms for the apprentices who don’t have their own shop. All these in addition to a large amount of warehouses. Moreover, there are also inns and canteens set up specially for the craftsmen and apprentices, everything looks very prosperous. Kurobee’s workshop is built at the central area.

   

Seeing that I’m visiting, Kurobee comes out to welcome me delightfully. After greeting and sharing a dinner with me, I ask him to bring me to the warehouses.

「Rimuru-sama, this way. The items stored at this warehouse are all very distinct, they can’t be wielded by any random person. Is that really okay?」

 

Kurobee asks worryingly, to which I nod in response implying that it is fine. Just as Kurobee has said, some of these items are simply too strong for average men to use. Some of the items that he is keeping in the warehouse are too overpowered, others are items too difficult or dangerous to use.

Some of the armor pieces are good examples to illustrate this point: For instance, there is armor that will absorb the wearer’s mana in order to activate a magic (defense) barrier. It sounds pretty impressive, but in reality it will draw mana without a limit, so after some time the armor would kill its user. Even though it is amazing that it provides a defensive barrier, such gear has no use in practice.

There are others, such as a sword that will absorb the surrounding magicule until no magic can be cast nearby and will then convert them into a huge blast. The strength of the sword is guaranteed, but the safety of the user is not ensured at all. These types of weapons are terrifying and cannot be used under any circumstances.

There’s also armor that will gift the wearer with extraordinary physical capabilities for a fixed period of time. But as soon as the time is exceeded, all of user’s muscle tissue will be torn rendering him immobile and he will die without healing magic. A savage armor indeed……

In short, there are equipments that will cause the wearer to die an untimely death. I believe there isn’t anyone stupid enough to use them without first appraising their properties. That part I don’t find necessary for myself to handle, regardless of that, it should be fine in Ramiris’s labyrinth.

「No, it’s alright. Having those very obvious properties may actually prove to be valuable.」

In fact, all of these equipments are of very fine quality. Half of them are of value above rare-grade, and among them are also precious items that appear to be strong enough to rival Unique-grade[70] equipments. They are the same types of equipment as the scaled shield and Tempest Dagger.

I pick up one of them——Tempest longsword and say to Kurobee while examining it:

「Equipments of such amazing quality, just because they are experimental shouldn’t make us just store it here without using them. Surely these gears would also want masters who can wield them, right?」

I made sure to be extra edgy, making things sound extra deep, which Kurobee is deeply moved by upon hearing.

   

「Is that so? Then please take how many you like.」

This is (definitely) not lying to him, though I feel my heart (conscience) hurts a bit.

 

Kurobee takes out many pieces of equipment from the warehouses. As for why I am taking them, it is to put them into the treasure chests in the labyrinth. The adventurers will get the equipment at the level corresponding to the strength of the gear. That’s why I’m definitely not lying. I shouldn’t mind that much and take them happily.

By the way, they sure are capable of making so many of these. There are a lot more now than last time with more than a hundred items. Not only is there bizarre equipment, there are also items challenging to use. If this assortment of items has anything in common, it’s that they are all of higher class compared to the merchandise I saw at the capital of Ingracia. I feel that all of these weapons and gear could only be seen in an auction.

After my evolution to Demon Lord, Kurobee was also blessed with the Unique Skill 「Godly Craftsman」. Apart from his original Unique Skill 「Researcher」, he has gained newfound ability to further his craftsmanship. Now he has even surpassed Kaijin. If Kurobee is serious with his production, the quality of his work would often be special-grade. They are at least guaranteed to be rare-grade. That is why they are only showing the work of his disciples at the exhibition.

   

「By the way, you are really good. I learned about blacksmithing before, yet I can’t make such impressive items.」

「Hehe, it’s quite embarrassing to be praised by Rimuru-sama. Oh, I should give this to you before I forget.」

Kurobee is very humble, yet his expression suddenly freezes as he runs into the further part of the room and returns while carrying something.

「What is this?」

「Sir[71], I’ve kept you waiting for too long, it is finally complete.」

Kurobee says so while handing me the thing, it is a straight sword (chokuto) with a dark blade.

Not too long and not too short. The sword is made just for me with an ideal length beautifully crafted.

   

「This is——」

「Yes, this is my finest masterpiece.」

The blade appears to be fully dark and doesn’t have anything special. It is not emitting any incredible power nor is it triggered using magic.

But, this will suffice. The focus of the sword has been its strength. It will not break easily or be bent and fits very well with my mana. Moreover, unlike Hinata’s Moonlight Rapier, it will not harm things in its surroundings.

Based on these considerations for a weapon that won’t cause me any concern, it is the best.

「Amazing, this is amazing, Kurobee-san.」

「I’m also highly satisfied with the product. The sword is not completed the way it is right now. As I’ve explained to your before, the ideas proposed by Rimuru-sama, slots can be drilled in the root of the blade.」

Upon hearing so, I look at the root of the sword.

「But there isn’t any slot here?」

「No. Other weapons will have slots drilled upon being crafted. But, this straight sword is different. After being immersed in Rimuru-sama’s mana, it will grow——evolve. And it will look the same as now, like an average weapon.」

Kurobee says proudly.

I heard that afterward the quality of the sword will surpass Legendary-grade…… I’m not sensing it in person just yet. As of this moment, we are still researching with other equipment and the crucial magic crystals for enchanting the slots have yet to be completed. Drilling slots alone would be meaningless, so it’s no use for me to be anxious about it. I decide to wait and look forward to the arrival of that day.

Having received my own special sword, I depart from Kurobee’s workshop happily. Additionally, I have the equipment I came for in tow. I’ll put these items in the treasure chests and deploy them in the labyrinth. The equipment with higher quality will be guarded by the floor guardians (boss of each level), it will be pretty interesting. This almost feels like crafting a real labyrinth (dungeon), how exciting.

Indeed, these experimental or even failed works can still earn quite a lot of money from being auctioned off directly. If I ask Myourmiles and Fuze for help, they will probably secure a tidy profit in their own way. It would be more pragmatic, but we shouldn’t do it. The important thing here is the exchange between monsters and humans.

 

I want to attract people to visit my kingdom and let them experience the beauty of Tempest Federation. In addition, I want them to feel the charm of this nation in person so that they will return again. We should consider the equipment as a small cost to reach that goal.

Besides, things are not over after I deliver the items. Ialready have outlines for the future. The adventurers infiltrate the underground labyrinth to bring back all sorts of items. Given it is extremely dangerous to use unappraised weapons or gears, it is time for the 「Appraisal Shop」 to shine. Since all these items are crafted in our nation, we will also have complete knowledge of their effects. As long as the method of using them are not mistaken, many of these items can be useful in their adventures. There are some dangerous items included as I’ve mentioned, but I think it would be fine if our nation buys back these items.

Money needs to flow in order to have value, it’s meaningless to only fill our own wallet. First, we need to buy back necessary ingredients, and then pay the expenses to some extent, the rest we can even give back to the adventurers. After some time, adventurers will naturally begin to spread the news and so the reputation of our nation will increase. All of this hinges upon our ability to retain a steady stream of customers to make good use of the buildings we construct, not to mention the amazing promotional impact it will have. We should strive to make out investments count.

The southeast area will have the colosseum built with Ramiris’s underground labyrinth beneath it. There are also inns and civilian houses charging a fair price on the southwest side. Unlike the northeastern block with many classy inns (hotels), the facilities there (southwest) will be more down to earth. This place will primarily appeal to adventurers, with the added benefit of keeping different classes separate. It is also most convenient to visit the labyrinth from there, so business will definitely be booming.

 

When Ramiris said that she wanted to move here, I was still worried about what to do. In terms of results, I suppose I have made the right call.

As far as the Colosseum is concerned, we will be hosting one or two major events every year. Beyond that, we will organize all kinds of events on normal days as well. Military training or events for adventurers to test their skills, to name a few. There’s actually plenty of activities if I think about it carefully. Underneath in the underground labyrinth, we can also run field experiments and examine the results. Since we can’t die while inside, we may even do some dangerously excessive and over-the-top training.

Perhaps it can be for more than just commercial usage, there are plenty of areas it could be applied——Concerning these ideas, I decide to discuss things with Benimaru.

    ***

So we’ve got our “bait”.

But right now it is too early to decide exactly how the underground labyrinth will be used. I want to ponder on it after it is complete. In order to complete the final step, I decide to negotiate with a key figure.

The key figure of this plan——Veldora-san.

He is currently resting in the garden hut at my estate. The lone estate is like a tea room with the Japanese style of quiet beauty. In fact, this place has a secret——Uh, I’ll put that aside for now. Let’s just say that Veldora has become used to staying there and considers it his home.

Whatever really……

「Hey, Veldora. I’ve got a request for you, is it okay?」

「Uh? What is it, I’m pretty busy.」

Hmm, I see that you are reading manga, so yeah, there’s no way you’re not free.

 

「Is that so…… what a pity then. That’s a waste of such an interesting thing…… But since you are busy then it can’t be helped. It’s such a rare chance for you to release your——Oh, you are busy. Sorry that I bothered you.」

 

Saying this, I pretend to leave. Although this is basically me leaving my own room, which makes me feel kind of bad, there’s plenty of places to spend the night. And even with that being said——

「Umm, hold up. I’m a busy man indeed, but since it is you who came asking, it can’t be helped. Tell me about it!」

So did he really bite?

Gullible as always.

Veldora-san has the nickname of 『Gullidora』[72] (Gullible Veldora). I’ve known for a while that he’s tricked easily. To me, outsmarting this guy is like twisting the hands of an infant. And given this is the case, what comes next is much easier. I pretend to be deep while phrasing things very intriguing.

「The thing is, I plan to design a home just for you……」

「W-What are you talking about? Building a place just for me, is this true?」

He’s taken the bait. His eyes have left the manga, and he begins to pay attention to my words intently.

「That’s right, built just for you. But, if you are so busy——」

「Wait, don’t be so hasty. You and I go way back after all, so of course I’ll prioritize your request, GA-HAHAHA!」
