Veldora-san said that so arrogantly.

But this is good.

   

Seeing that he is waiting for me to continue, I may just tell him now.

Veldora often doesn’t listen and I am forced into tricking him. Although it is troublesome, it is the necessary ritual to draw his attention.

「So... some people need to make friends.」

「Hmmhmm, just speak your mind with the request!」

「The thing is this, Ramiris is moving to town. We are building that girl’s labyrinth right under the colosseum and then——」

While he is still interested to hear me out, I tell him about Ramiris moving in. Veldora understands faster than I expected.

「Oh, is it Ramiris? I’m not entirely sure about that girl’s ability, but I think she has the power to create tunnels that will lead to the same location no matter which entrance on the surface is taken. Is she able to create a labyrinth with complex layouts?」

「Right. She is also planning to add floors and I am thinking about preparing different types of traps.」

「There are even floors? I see, that chibi Ramiris seems to be stronger than I imagined.」

Upon hearing me say so, Veldora mirrors my serious expression. You really are so, so gullible.

Next, I share the entirety of the underground labyrinth creation plan with Veldora

「Isn’t it boring to just have an ordinary labyrinth? That’s why I’m trying to make it something awesome, a national brand. And today, I just discussed it with Ramiris. She is now working hard on expanding the floors.」

「Oh oh. So what does it have to do with your favor from me?」

「Honestly, I need a king to rule over the underground labyrinth——」

「——You say King?」

「The management of the labyrinth will be run by Ramiris and me. Then there is a gate on the hundredth floor that leads to Ramiris’s home within the fairy maze. A guardian is required for that gate——No, we need the 『Strongest』 guardian. Don’t you think that makes sense, Veldora-kun?」

「It makes sense! I see, as expected of Rimuru. So you want to hand that job to me, am I right?」

As predicted, Veldora has been fooled by my sweet-talk. Since he doesn’t have much resistance against the word 「Strongest」, I figure I can definitely lure him into agreeing with that.

「That’s right, Veldora. Moreover, if you agree to this proposal, there’s another bonus waiting for you.」

「Oh? Although I’ve already decided to agree, let me hear about this bonus first.」

Hehehe. This is not just a bonus, it is actually the most important reason.

「Didn’t you want to release your Youki (demonic aura) all the time? And that you are almost at your limit?」

「What! Could it be……」

「Bingo! You don’t have to hold back your Youki any more in the labyrinth. You can even return to your original dragon form.」

「Oh, ohoh……!」

「Think about it, a handsome dragon waiting at the depths of the labyrinth, giving off a solemn aura——」

「That’s me, right? If that’s the case, I also get to unapologetically say to people 『GAHAHAHAHAHA, you’ve finally arrived! Welcome, pathetic bugs!』 and show off a little?」

Veldora interrupts me while saying so. He is already dying to give it a try. At the beginning he didn’t even seem to have a single scrap of motivation, but upon hearing that he gets to release his Youki, he appears to be very excited.

How about I give it a final blow to seal the deal?

Thinking about it, I begin to mention the final plan that I’ve discussed with Ramiris.

「I’ll also be deploying some of my men there to defend against the adventurers. Yes, this is a game you’ve wanted to play for a while——I want to make it a reality. So, does it sound like fun?」

I expect to make the underground labyrinth into something resembling a realistic simulation game. After hearing Ramiris’s view, I suddenly got an idea.

Deploying my men——aka monsters to fight and defeat adventurers. In order to guard the treasure chests, there will also be monster bosses. Veldora’s magicule will flood the underground labyrinth. Starting at the one hundredth floor, where the magicule concentration will be strongest, it will gradually thin out as it spreads across the floors above, which will have the desired effect of spawning relatively weak monsters in the upper floors, but progressively tougher ones lower down. The magicules leaked by Veldora during his sealed state was enough to spawn strong monsters such as Tempest Snakes at Rank A-. If it is Veldora now, I can’t fathom how strong the monsters will be.

Honestly, there really is no need to deploy guardians. I don’t see anyone even arriving at the hundredth floor, so there shouldn’t be such worries. The most important thing is, we will have Veldora release his Youki. I figure that after telling him to endure, he is at his limit. If I leave him unattended, he may find a place to relieve himself without permission when no one is watching, that’s why I have to keep my eyes on him at all times.

If he accidentally releases it in this region, apart from my executives and myself, any average people would be unable to tolerate it. With the magicule concentration spiking, people below Rank B might easily be killed. It would be asking too much to hope that Veldora will understand restraint, so Ramiris’s labyrinth will be a facilitating factor.

After all, the interior of the labyrinth is an isolated space. I’ve confirmed that while exploring it in the past, there’s no need to worry about magicule leakage. Moreover, even if Veldora releases his Youki, it wouldn’t shake the place. Even the sealed cave was unable to contain the Youki released by Veldora after his full revival. Now that we’ve got a research facility there, I can’t allow him to release it in the cave again.. That’s why the underground labyrinth is the ideal venue.

Then there’s also the ultimate goal, the hope that Veldora will release his Youki completely——Simultaneously preparing high concentrations of magicules to spawn monsters. That is after all the core of this plan.

Not only will we have Veldora release his Youki, but we will be capitalizing on it effectively. How do I come up with these amazing ideas? It’s killing two birds with one stone, actually, I should call it killing three birds. Not only will I be able to chase out Veldora who has been laying his nest in my house, I can have him be the magicule generator in the labyrinth to spawn monsters. Moreover, I get to give some work to this Veldora who has almost turned into a NEET.

Sadly for him, I don’t think he will ever get the chance to play the part of the King of the Labyrinth (Last Boss)......

Alright, shall we see how he’ll react?

Veldora stands up and sneakily puts his manga into his pocket. He then extends his hand towards me intending to shake my hands.

「Interesting. This thing sounds very interesting, Rimuru. Adventurers will fend off the minions and stand before me. Then I will get to teach these strong individuals a lesson. Of course, some adventurers will attempt to run away, but, I will not let them off so easily! When times like that come, how about I say something like——『GAHAHAHAHAHA, you can’t escape from my palms. Don’t you know? No one escapes from the claws of the one and only「Storm Dragon」——』 I always wanted to try this line. Now am I finally getting the chance to deliver the line that I’ve been hoping to declare for so long? How exciting, I’m really looking forward to it!」

Spouting things like that, Veldora has now even begun daydreaming.

「Y-Yeah, you’re right……」

I give the affirmative to him without thinking, but I may have gotten Veldora too excited……

Will this guy be alright like this?

Since, you know, by normal logic, there’s not gonna be anyone who will have the ability to make it to the hundredth floor.

Although I’m a little bit concerned, I’m keeping an open mind for the plan.

「——I figure this honor can only be handled by you, so what do you think?」

「Of course I will do it. Rimuru, you are so lucky to have come to me, I am after all the only one who could possibly fill this role!」

As he says so, Veldora nods his head earnestly. I’m lucky that he’s an idiot. I played him like a fiddle..

And like that, I got Veldora’s assistance with ease.

    ***

The next day——I pair up with Veldora to find Ramiris.

The construction work on the colosseum started early in the morning. The site is full of energy. Even the beastmen, who went out for training, have returned to help and are moving about under Gobkyu’s instruction. Everyone is working their hardest, so in order to avoid disturbing them, we enter the labyrinth.

Upon entry, we find ourselves in the same room Ramiris is in.. As promised yesterday, she seems to be diligently expanding the labyrinth all this time.

「Oh, Ramiris. How are you doing?」

 

「Ah, mentor (shishou)! Long time no see, I’ve been good!」

Ramiris looks worn out but very satisfied as she makes the response. It seems she has been working too hard, even though I specifically told her not to overdo her part. Without me noticing, she has already sat on Veldora’s shoulder. The two look so close, how wonderful.

   

Despite the wonderful things, there are still some remaining problems. Ramiris apparently wants to show off her skills some more now that Veldora has come, and she is completely ignoring my reminder.

「Just count on me! I’ll work hard. I’ll definitely complete all of them!」

I just want Ramiris to calm down. The first thing we need to do is to eat breakfast.

After finishing breakfast, Ramiris explains her progress to me. She has increased to fifteen floors. At this rate, we will reach the one hundredth floor in just a few days. The internal structure will be changed as it goes, so Ramiris doesn’t have to slow down for those plans.

「Anyway, the rest of the floors will be expanding by themselves. I’m pretty idle anyway, so why don’t I do the interior design for the finished floors too?」

Ramiris says.

It seems that even without Ramiris’s conscious effort, the floors will increase automatically while consuming her power.

 

「Then, let’s prepare Veldora’s room first.」

I plan to set Veldora’s residence at the deepest level. In order to chase him out of my room, we will decorate the interior of his room first.

The bottom floor right now is a room devoid of anything. There is no wall, and naturally no tunnels. There aren’t even any stairs, we can only see an empty lot with a gate.

「This is truly empty I see.」

「Oi oi oi, Rimuru, is this supposed to be my room? This really reminds me of the spot where I was sealed before……」

Veldora seems kind of repulsed. That’s somewhat pitiful really.

「It’s alright, mentor! If I want, I can easily create walls and stairs.」

Seeing how displeased Veldora looks, Ramiris replies grinning.

「Right then, regarding what type of room we are decorating, we will discuss through our 『Telepathy Net』 and decide.」

With that being said, I connect the three of us with 「Telepathy Net」. Then we begin to construct an outline for the style of decoration based on my thoughts.

「Oh, ohoh! That’s it, that’s it, Rimuru! You are truly impressive. I see that there’s really nothing for me to worry about when you are handling things.」

   

Did your satisfaction rate just suddenly cap out just like that? Veldora nods while humming 「Hmmhmm」.

「It seems that Veldora is completely satisfied, can we decorate it to this type of style?」

 

「Just count on me! This is a piece of cake!」

Ramiris takes on the mission without hesitation.

And just like she put it, the empty lot was changed in the blink of an eye. The walls have been turned to thick and heavy stone walls, several small rooms and a hall appear.

The hall is square shaped with one hundred meters for each side. The solemn atmosphere of the interior design resembles the so called 「The Demon Lord level」 [73](Final Boss Level). I transmitted the image in my head to her, and it turns out that she was able to recreate it wholly intact.

   

「You are so strong! This is just perfect……」

   

「Hmm, Ramiris, now I am satisfied!」

   

「Right, right! I am super strong after all!」

 

Ramiris probably seldom gets praised by people, which is why she is overjoyed now. But even with that being said, she has been truly impressive this time. Building something like this in real life will likely not just take several years, but perhaps even decades to finish. Yet she completed it in the blink of an eye…… It seems that Ramiris holds ultimate power over the underground labyrinth and has complete freedom in shaping it.

Ah, that’s impressive, impressive indeed. I’ve completely changed my mind on Ramiris and now see her in a different light. But next, being impressed here alone won’t make any progress.

On the surface it appears that this hall is a room to confront adventurers. But its true purpose is to allow Veldora to restore his original form. So if Veldora is unable to properly relax here, the effort would be meaningless.

However, based on Veldora’s recent activities, he does seem very relaxed even without being in his dragon form…… Since transforming into his human (adult) form he can read manga and play games. This must be the case. After all, he decided to stay in my room without leaving. Based on this, I decided to prepare a room for his human form.

There are two gates in this hall. One of the large gates connects to the stairs to the upper floor, and the other gate will lead to his private room for everyday use. Ramiris’s ability to recreate things is indeed powerful, she can construct an exact replica of what I envision.

「Oh? Is this my room?」

While ignoring Veldora who is intrigued, I take out a whole set of furniture from my 「Stomach」.

I laid out the rug stitched by the Goblinas and put out the tables and chairs built by the craftsmen. I’ve even prepared benches, so he can lie down for a while if he wishes. I’ve even put out a bed though I’m not sure about whether it is necessary or not. (D: Inb4 doujin, O: No, I assure you that it is probably far too late for that.)

 

I think this will create a very comfortable space. There are also shelves set on the walls with copies of the manga that Veldora likes. Unlike the solemn atmosphere the hall projects, this is built to be a comfortable space for private life that a commoner will enjoy.

「Nicu, nicu, very nicu, Rimuru-chan. I want that type of furniture too!」

After hearing how envious Ramiris sounded, I promised her that I will prepare a set for her as well. While I was originally worried about the size problem, they seem to be unnecessary. Ramiris jumped onto the bench without hesitation and begins to flip through manga. Speaking of this, it was the same during our last meeting. So I shouldn’t overthink it and just prepare another set.

Without me noticing, even Veldora has begun to play around and started rolling on the bed. He looks contented. The hall will have an emphasis on atmosphere, the majesty of that in contrast to this room and how Veldora is behaving sit in stark contrast.

Right, there are things we just can’t force. On this day we managed to sort out Veldora’s room and with that dismissed our meeting.

   

After then, it took another whole week. Although we have slowed down a bit, the labyrinth has finally been built to a hundred floors. The interior designs have been developed with modularity in mind.

Thanks to this function, we are able to do an internal structural change every few days. Adventurers trying to memorize the layout would soon realize how futile those attempts would be. This design is truly evil.

Selling maps would be an option, however it would ruin the fun adventurers would have when they’re forced to create a new map every time they enter. But to put it in another light, they won’t get bored this way…… The labyrinth will always have a certain level of difficulty when being conquered, so that will never get old.

We at the very least have some measures to save progress. We place a save point for every ten floors. I didn’t expect that in Ramiris’s labyrinth, you can conduct 「Dimensional Transportation」 upon fulfilling certain conditions. More surprisingly, the act is said to be unaffected by magicule. It can even transport rations, which makes it an extremely convenient function.

Of course, the same applies to humans and can transport them freely to any specific location. That is a save point. Once you reach it, you get to start from there in your next run. The same transportation method can be used by your companions too, so you can basically also cheat by having other people send you to a certain location.

We have differing views on this issue, but in the end we took my suggestion to see how things would shape up before deciding on anything. Honestly speaking, cheating using savepoints will only give the people doing this a hard time. Since we are planning to put a boss on each floor. As the regional ruler of Jura Great Forest, I think floor guardians are necessary components. Especially before reaching the save point set every ten floors, I want to deploy some especially strong monsters.

In other words, you can’t use the save point unless you defeat these powerful individuals. If they are capable enough to break through, the companions brought by these strong individuals surely won’t be reckless. But if there is truly any problem, we will think about what to do by that time. In addition, I also want to prepare some treasure chests as rewards to incentivize defeating the bosses.

But is it okay if the bosses are defeated? Indeed, that is an important question. One of the abilities of Ramiris’s 「Labyrinth Creation」 is——The power of resurrection. Thanks to this skill, the adventurers inside it get to be revived.

As explained before, it requires the will of the person, but the step will not be required if the individual has a ruler-subject relation with Ramiris. To my surprise, through the labyrinth created by 「Labyrinth Creation」, Ramiris’s subordiantes seem to be immortal. Ramiris will disappear upon being killed, but her subordinates are able to be revived at the save points. As for the subordinates we are referring to here are only those, who have forged a pact with her or people that Ramiris acknowledges. This skill is undoubtedly a ferocious power beyond my imagination.

That is the biggest reason why she wanted Beretta. Rarimis herself is not that strong, but Ramiris’s army inside the labyrinth is invincible. That was why to Ramiris, who didn’t have a single subordinate, this invincible skill was as good as none at all. It’s no use if it is a golem without will. The reason why the Golem of Holy Spirit (Elemental Golem) was destroyed is due to the fact that it was merely a doll.

Considering that, Beretta is no mere doll. After becoming Ramiris’s subordinate, Beretta practically became immortal[74] within this labyrinth. With the addition of Treyni-san now, Ramiris packs quite a bit more military power than I had initially expected. After all, the two were already very powerful before, now given the attribute of immortality, it is hard to say who will win even if I send out Benimaru and Shion to confront them. Powerhouses such as Beretta and Treyni-san now are also very busy, but they have no complaints as they assist the construction of the colosseum outside...

Thanks to Ramiris, the labyrinth has smoothly entered a stage of near completion. Once this thing is settled, I’d better find them both to discuss the defense mechanisms inside the labyrinth. However, that will come later.

「Ramiris, how is the item I asked you to prepare coming along?」

「Oh, you mean this? I’ve been trying to craft one.」

The thing I asked her to prepare was the resurrection item. In order to obtain the attribute of 「Immortality」 from Ramiris’s 「Labyrinth Creation」, she must first receive confirmation of the individual’s will. But, it is to be expected that everyone who wants to enter the labyrinth will use one. Since this is a facility accessible to anyone——It is simply too hard to confirm the personal will and form a pact with everyone. If there aren’t a lot of people, Ramiris should be able to maintain control, but if too many people come in at the same time, Ramiris may not be able to keep up. That’s why she has designed a single-use disposable item——That’s how she described it.

She takes out a bracelet that, upon first glance, seems like nothing special. It looks like a braided bracelet that you can tie on your wrist.

「About this thing, have you confirmed the effect?」

「It works great! I tried it on Beretta last night!」

   

「Hold up, hold up, why are you so mean to Beretta……」

I never expected that Beretta would say 「I’m a demon, so I won’t get eliminated regardless」 at the time and offered his help happily. Although this is a request from me, they were still too reckless.

   

But that was worth the try, it was very useful in confirming the effect of the bracelet. Ten seconds after Treyni-san had pierced Beretta’s core, his corpse was transported outside the underground labyrinth and was completely revived.

   

「It seems perfect. I appreciate Beretta’s courage.」

「Hmm hmm. This is my first time making a single-use disposable item. Although I’ve guessed it would come out smoothly, it is truly wonderful that I was actually able to make it.」

Ramiris nods smiling, it does sound like it is her first attempt.

It’s worthy of celebration that it has been successful, but it is truly frightening to think of what would have happened had it failed. At least do an animal experiment first. I should be mindful of her doing something this reckless in future requests.

Regardless, the resurrection item has been prepared. The emergency escape item for returning to the surface also seems to have been finished.

「Revival Bracelet」, 「Return Whistle」——These we will be selling at the entrance of the labyrinth to prepare for the unknown. Whether the customers buy them or not is their choice.

However, please take responsibility for dying or getting lost in the labyrinth without the purchase.

It is a buy from me, absolute buy.

I’ll think about the price tag for it later. Regardless, the preparation work is done for now. By the way, this resurrection item called 「Revival Bracelet」 actually only temporarily materializes Ramiris’s power. That’s why you can only be revived at the entrance after dying inside the labyrinth to be reset.

In order to prevent anyone from misunderstanding its function and therefore expecting it to be able to revive them at any location, including outside of the labyrinth, we need to give a thorough explanation. There are a lot of people in this world that ignore other people’s advice, so I’m a bit worried. If they really mistake things and end up dying outside the labyrinth, it will be their own doing. With that being said, I still can’t bear to see that happening. I should just specifically remind the people to be careful with it.

With that, the underground labyrinth is almost complete. How impressive that it only took a week. Perhaps Wisdom King Raphael-sensei can even recreate that incredible skill, upon thinking so, I try to ask it——

《Answer. Intrinsic Skill of Individual 「Ramiris」 cannot be recreated.》

   

And like that it immediately turns me down. Such majestic work can only be achieved by Ramiris. At this point, I feel that I should tell her 「Thank you for moving here」.

 

「You have worked real hard, Ramiris. Now we can finally commence the next phase of our plan.」

「Hehe, that’s without saying! I always give my all when I need to!」

After praising Ramiris who is clapping her wings and flying around, I turn to Veldora.

   

「Kept you waiting huh, Veldora-kun. It seems the time for you to release your Youki has arrived.」

 

「Oh oh, finally after all the waiting! GAHAHAHA, leave it to me!」

The moment I’ve been expecting has finally arrived. There are air vents in this hundred-level underground labyrinth and stairs that connect the floors. If people ask me how there is any air flow one hundred floors underground, I will answer by saying it was all because of magic. So honestly, there isn’t really any need for air ventilation, but I still asked her to open them, reason being to have the magicule permeate to each floor more easily.

There in the center of the hundredth floor’s hall, Veldora reveals his true self. And with it, his long suppressed Youki is released.

「Then, here I go. HYAA——!」

He doesn’t really need to scream like that, but it’s probably because of his mood. The vicious Youki blows towards me and Ramiris. Fearing an emergency, I’ve covered Ramiris with 「Absolute Defense」 as well. The next instant, a shockwave arrives as if something has exploded.

「T-T-That was close…… If Rimuru didn’t protect me, I might have been blown away…..」

Ramiris mutters while quivering.

Indeed, the shockwave was far more powerful than I imagined. Moreover, any average person would have been instantly killed by the concentrated magicule that filled the chamber.

「GA————HAHAHA! I AM HERE!」

The final boss level——correction, the deepest hall in the labyrinth takes up a wide space, but after Veldora restored himself to his original shape, it feels awfully narrow.

After not seeing Veldora in his dragon form for so long, that appearance is indeed filled with majesty. Ah, seriously, he’s so authoritative when he shuts his mouth.

However……

「I, feel so good! Ah, aren’t I just so magnificent? If I did this outside, it might not be a good idea.」

He says so casually. It will be a catastrophe if you do this outside. While you are saying that it feels so good, you are still leaking out Youki.

「M-Mentor sure is strong……. I didn’t expect that my own labyrinth will get knocked crooked by others……」

Just as Ramiris said, the walls have been bowed outwards by the ferocious wind. It’s probably due to the strong internal pressure, but that’s not the reason why the attack was so shocking.

「Should I call you impressive, you must have been holding back for so long. Before things end up like this in the future, you’ve got to remember to release your Youki occasionally……」

Not only the Youki he leaked, the magicule concentration alone is already sky high. It can only be imagined just how incredibly large Veldora’s magicule pool is. That’s why it is truly no good to wait for him to release it. In the worst case scenario, he would have to start relieving himself more often one bit at a time.

By the way, the magicule concentration is truly immense. Just then an amazing idea crossed my mind.

Should we perhaps set another room on the hundredth floor and turn it into a warehouse? We can then store the iron ores and other products from the mine in this room. Then by having them immersed in large amounts of magicule, they will be turned to magisteel ore very fast.

Magisteel ores are the rough stones of 「Magisteel」, its value can rival that of gold. The demand for them can’t even be reached by iron ore, and to us they are also very useful resources.

「Ramiris, can you create an additional hall next to this one?」

「Hmm, piece of cake!」

And so, I hurry her to do the preparations. Next time when I visit, I’ll bring the iron ore from the town here as well.

As I think of these cunning schemes, the magicules have spread to the other floors as planned. Right now there aren’t any walls set up nor any other sort of areal partitioning. That’s why there aren’t any obstacles that hinder the magicules from permeating to every corner of the space. Even around underground level fifty, the magicule concentration is also beyond that in the 「Sealed Cave」.

Its effect has exceeded my expectations, so basically it’s an absolute win. Next, we just have to wait for monsters to be born. The concentration is so high that it’s terrifying, so a lot of strong individuals should be spawning.

With that hope in mind, we dismiss the meeting for this day.

    ***

The next day, both Beretta and Treyni-san are present. Veldora seems to have maintained his dragon form to release magicules and is resting on the ground.

「Hey, Rimuru, I haven’t been as comfortable as I was yesterday for a long time.」

「That’s great then. You don’t have to endure it anymore in the future, let go as much as you like. Just remember not to release any to the outside!」

「GAHAHA, I know.」

Do you though? I’m a little skeptical, but I’ll choose to trust him.

It isn’t convenient to continue our conversation like this, so I ask Veldora to return to his human form. Then I start to explain the situation to Beretta and Treyni-san. Now we can get to work——I do want to say that indeed, there’s still something before that.

I want a final confirmation from Beretta.

「Beretta, did you swear in front of Guy to pledge your loyalty to Ramiris? Has your sentiment changed since then?」

Beretta looks at me in shock. He must be showing a rare change of expression under that mask.

「——Rimuru-sama, please forgive my rudeness. As I have said before, I hope to serve you and Ramiris-sama.」

 

「Yes, I remember that. But, wouldn’t that be breaking your vow with Guy?」

「......Yes. When that day comes, I’ll take the responsibility myself——」

   

「No, you don’t have to split hairs like that. As you have wished, Ramiris has moved to the town too. Now she is also responsible for running the labyrinth, do you wish to help her?」

「Of course!」

   

「If that’s the case, there wouldn’t be any problem. In terms of results, you are basically pledging your loyalty to me too.」

 

I’d heard about this before, so I’ve had the idea for quite a while already. If Beretta wishes, I’ll let him change to serving Ramiris. Since he has made a deal with the so-called strongest Demon Lord Guy, if he breaks the vow Beretta won’t be safe.

「Won’t you mind that? Then, I will serve Ramiris-sama.」

Beretta replies without hesitation.

I feel as though all of this has been part of Beretta’s plan. Well, never mind, that’s fine either way. This cunningness, who in the world did he learn it from——

《Answer. It’s of course——》

Ah, I don’t want to hear that answer. How careless. What does Wisdom King Raphael-sensei think of me? Seriously, if it is anyone with such cunningness, it would be Raphael-sensei.

《......》

It seems to be slightly displeased, but I don’t care.

 

「That’s fine. Then, Beretta, pledge your loyalty to Ramiris in the future!」

「Even though I will become Ramiris-sama’s servant, I will not forget the gracious deeds done by Rimuru-sama. If I am ever of any use for you, just say the word.」

   

「Alright, I’ll count on you then.」

As I finish my words, I deactivate the Creator Order (Master Lock) on Beretta and transfer 「Master Access」 to Ramiris. After the transference, I will only have access as the creator. If anything ever happens to Ramiris, the commanding right will return to me. But, as long as things don’t end up that way, Ramiris will always be Beretta’s master.

Now I can be reassured. I won’t get bad mouthed by Guy and Beretta as Ramiris’s guard is also trust-worthy.

I feel that there are surprisingly plenty of ways of using the labyrinth. On the surface, it appears to be a promotional media to attract adventurers. Further behind the scenes, it is a channel for Veldora to relieve himself. Lastly as its by-product——it turns iron ores into magisteel ores using high concentrations of magicule. This will do. It seems that by researching the mysterious substance known as 「Magicule」 in this world, we get to run this labyrinth effectively. That’s beyond my expectation, which raises the importance of this labyrinth.

I’m not entirely sure about handing the mission of protecting the place to Treyni-san alone, but now with Beretta, I am a lot more assured.

As for Ramiris who gained commanding power over Beretta…… The quick turn of events has made her a bit hysterical.

「Beretta has really become my subordinate…… Now I’m finally not alone——」

「Ah, Ramiris-sama, you still have me.」

「Oh yeah! There’s also Treyni, now I have a big family![75]」

Ramiris seems overjoyed as she flies around Beretta. Treyni-san couldn’t help but smile admiring the sight of her.

Ramiris has been alone all this time, she must be very lonely. Even though she only has two subordinates, she still says they are a lot…… This worries me. It worries me greatly.

Treyni-san is a very reliable person, yet she spoils Ramiris too much. So Beretta will have to take on even more responsibilities, but I hope someone with common sense like him will work hard too. He has the cunning and calculative side as well and will probably respond to my expectation.

「Beretta, don’t mind me for now. I’ll have you take care of Ramiris. Please protect her well in the future.」

   

「Yes sir! I shall guard her with my life!」

I have confidence in him. I can rest assured as long as Beretta is there.

The management of monsters inside the labyrinth will probably keep Treyni-san’s and Ramiris’s hands tied if they handle them alone. So it won’t be a problem if they do encounter such things since Beretta is here. Things worked out smoothly.

Veldora and I feel somewhat agitated by Ramiris who is making excited noises, but then again the sight put a smile on our face.

Given that an official master-servant relationship was made, Beretta has become 「Immortal」 inside the labyrinth. Even without 「Revival Bracelet」, the mechanism can still be carried out perfectly. Treyni-san is without exception. The items such as 「Revival Bracelet」 and 「Return Whistle」 that possess Ramiris’s power are all watered down versions of her skills. But, since Beretta and Treyni-san are now her followers, they can avoid the hassle of using them. The same logic applies for the location of resurrection, as long as the save point has been set beforehand, it is said that they can revive wherever they want and don’t have to be expelled out of the labyrinth every time. In addition, they can also do simplified 「Transportation」 through the save point on each floor.

Speaking of Ramiris’s Intrinsic Skill 「Labyrinth Creation」, it really has little use for herself, but instead is highly beneficial for her subordinates. By the way…… Infinite revival, the thought alone sounds terrifying already. Right now she only has two subordinates, and once this number increases……

In the future, there will gradually be monsters born in the labyrinth. If she can tame them, she may be able to form a Ramiris Legion. Then it will become a major power so people won’t look down on her and call her chibi. Such an army with the attribute of 「Immortality」 will pose a force to be reckoned with.

From a standpoint of defense, Ramiris’s skill cannot be any better. The only problem with it is the user of the skill is Ramiris herself, who to this day has not been anyone’s concern.

——But, I guess it’s just Ramiris after all. So there shouldn’t be a problem and there is nothing to worry about.

Such a cute fairy, she’s just a chibi that is afraid to be lonely. That’s why I don’t think she will go lead a huge army and plot something like that——

    ***

Now we are entering the next stage, it’s time to plan out the internal structures of the labyrinth. Since there are as many as a hundred levels, designing the labyrinth really is a laborious task. But, it’s not really a labyrinth if it doesn’t have traps, so let’s be interior designers for a while.

By the way, the first level of the labyrinth is square shaped, and the four sides are of 250 meters in length. It is large enough to rival Tokyo Big Egg (Tokyo Dome), but the deeper you go, the narrower it gets. Structurally, it has an inverted pyramid shape. Since Veldora is releasing his Youki on the bottom level, we built it like this so that it will be convenient for Youki to spread out evenly.

Almost every condition we considered has been fulfilled, it can be said that the structure we designed goes beyond common sense. But there’s no point breaking our heads overthinking such things.

Now, time to confirm what sort of traps to deploy:

  • Poison Arrow——Arrows smeared with poison will fly your way out of nowhere.
  • Poison swamp——Welcome to Farron Keep 2.0, super poisonous swamp that you will recognize instantly from the mere look of it. Stepping in will give you aliament status and HP reduction due to poisoning.
  • Spinning surface——You spin me right round to disorientate me. Please remember the importance of drafting maps!
  • Shifting surface——Floors that will run away on their own, how terrifying.
  • Dismembering Razor-string——If you run into it without noticing, you will get your head chopped off (among other limbs). It’s gonna be quite vicious when paired up with shifting surface.
  • Booby trap pit——Compared to the injuries you get from dropping into it, you should be more concerned about what you will encounter down there.
  • Mimic chest——Amazing, it’s a treasure chest? Sorry but, KONO MIMIC DA!
  • Megumin’s chest——Flat Amazing, it’s a treasure chest! EXPLOSION!
  • Monster cabin——Howdy! Are you our delivery? It’s pizza time!
  • Sealed room——If you start a fire here……
  • Dark level——Shouldn’t bringing torches be common sense? If you didn’t, I can sell you for, say 3000 souls *overpriced tag* each? What? Filing complaint? Sorry, but this is just one of our many surprise mechanics.
  • Low ceiling floor——Wow, didn’t expect to encounter any monster while crawling on the ground now did you……
  • Terrain effect level——WTF?! Why is there a volcano in this labyrinth?
  • Rimuru Tempest——Arguably the most deadly trap.

That’s about it, something along these lines. I’ve listed all the traps I can come up with to her and it turns out that almost all of them can be created.

「You are truly capable, Ramiris. Are you really able to make these types of traps?」

「Hmm! Inside the labyrinth, I can make whatever I want!」

Indeed, it is just like how Ramiris put it. Now even though we are one hundred floors down, the air composition is no different from that on the surface. This is all thanks to Ramiris’s skill. It makes me sense once more how super strong her skill is.

 

「By the way, what is this 『Sealed Room』? Can it really be a booby trap?」

To her question, I crack up a smile and reply.

「Air——Or I should say that there is a substance in the atmosphere called oxygen. Humans, or perhaps most creatures, will take in oxygen by breathing. Veldora and I (Dragon and Slime) are exceptions. If the concentration of oxygen drops too low, people will suffer hypoxia and may even die on the spot. That’s why adventurers should be cautious when faced with a room like that. After all, that’s a fixed rule of exploration.」

Normally speaking, it is fine that a room is sealed, but if lighting a fire inside, it will lead to a state of oxygen deprivation or may even cause the room to be filled with poisonous gases. Even if you discover this type of room in ruins or labyrinths, you can’t immediately rush in. You must analyze the components of the atmosphere first and hold a skeptical view regarding whether there is poisonous gas remaining and assessing the concentration of the oxygen.

That is the basic rule of exploration, if an adventurer can’t even do that, he won’t last long. And since magic exists in this world, at least do the breathing with wind-element magic.

I explained these in a way that Ramiris can easily understand——Although she doesn’t seem to understand at all.

「Okay, I get now that it is some vicious trap. But it doesn’t really affect us, so we don’t have to pay too much attention to it, right? By the way, you…… I had the feeling before that you were a pretty scary guy. But, you also seem very capable. If it was me, I won’t be able to come up with a trap like that……」

Knowing that themselves won’t have to worry about being harmed by the trap, Ramiris seems to be reassured. She exclaimed so and praised me. She seems to really believe what she said, and that kind of embarrassed me. If it were people who enjoy gaming from my original world, they should be very familiar with these traps and even feel somewhat intimate with them.

But making them real is a horse of a different color. It is nothing like some amusement rides, you may pay with your life because of them. Moreover, attempting to overcome a labyrinth with these traps will likely take a couple days. They may even take a few days just to take on a few levels, in addition that the terrain will alter, one must try to go all the way to the save point at the tenth floor.

If someone is like us who has poison nullification and does not require breathing, eating or even sleeping, they should be able to conquer it using brute force by just tanking the damage. But, this is not something average people are capable of. Even those who are worthy of the title of hero will need to rest. I personally also think that it will be quite the vicious labyrinth.

「Are we perhaps setting the difficulty too high?」

「Is it? I find it okay.」

「Yeah, Rimuru. This is really nothing!」

My worries were laughed off by Veldora and Ramiris. If that’s the case, then there shouldn’t be a problem. I was persuaded and continued brainstorming the labyrinth routes.

A few days passed after that, during which Ramiris has been joyfully preparing all sorts of traps. Beretta and Treyni-san have been deploying them alongside her. I have planned out the labyrinth route with Veldora. We’ve come up with several different models and have registered them first so we can make the change anytime we need. Everything has been going smoothly, but when we attempted to add 「Terrain Effect」, Ramiris raised an objection.

「No, no no no. I can’t sustain that much energy!」

To put it simply, she has a problem with it.

——Actually, it makes sense. In terms of the layout——We want every level to have a specific natural disaster theme that would cover the entire level. For example a fire level, frozen level or a storm level.

Yeah, I guess creating a volcano is a no-go. I’ve come to believe that anything can be done with magic, but what I was asking for is simply too much.

「I see you have a point. Sorry, Ramiris, I was being too difficult——」

I give up and decide to apologize to Ramiris. But then——

 

「Can’t that be solved if you capture a fire or ice dragon from somewhere? Do you need my help to catch some?」

What a familiar voice, but, that person shouldn’t be here. I turn around to see a pair of pink-blonde (platinum pink) ponytails.

It’s Milim.

「Eh……? What are you doing here, Milim——」

This is level one hundred underground. In other words, this is the very bottom level of the recently built underground labyrinth. We’ve not even made this location public, so by any rational logic she shouldn’t be able to enter……

Yet she just did——Demon Lord Milim stands there with a smug smile.

By the way, Wisdom King Raphael-sensei seems to have noticed that, but since Milim didn’t have hostile intent against me, it intentionally didn’t report to me…… But actually, it was me who told it to do that. Though I should still reassess the command. It’s all because Raphael-san doesn’t know how to be flexible, what a headache.

《.......》

 

That will be a topic to discuss in the future, right now let’s deal with Milim. Upon thinking this, I turn to Milim. And soon after, she says complacently:

「Fufu, I know that you guys have been up to something interesting, so I came by to see. And you’ve ousted me without notice, how dare you, Rimuru.」

Milim finishes with an arrogant posture while straightening up her plotless flat chest.

She is wearing her usual highly revealing clothes, but the area covered by clothing seems to be more than last time. After being dressed by Shuna and Goblinas, she may have become a bit more self-aware about dressing up in public. On her fists are the pair of drago knuckles that clash with the rest of her attire. The light reflecting off its rough surface is emphasizing their existence. It’s very much Milim’s style, she really is just a punk kid after all.

I couldn’t bring myself to reject her, so if she really wants to join the development——

「Heh, so it’s Milim. You are just a brat, how can you understand the sublime work of us adults? We are not playing around here, don’t get in our way!」

Veldora slants towards Milim and says so while feeling justified. I didn’t have time to respond before he interjected. It is work in name indeed, but this doesn’t seem like serious work at all…… Not only him, even Ramiris decides to chase after Veldora’s footsteps.

「Mentor is right! We are working here, so an idler like you should just go home!」

 

Yelling that, she starts to confront Milim. The poor chibi is immediately trapped in Milim’s iron grasp. Her courage was commendable, but Ramiris, you don’t really have the strength to back it up.

I lack that sort of courage, so I decide to ask in a normal way.

「You mentioned that we are doing something interesting, what were you referring to? It was all because of your letter that we are holding this grand festival.」

「What? Didn’t you ignore my letter?」

 

「How is that possible? Seriously, we are doing this to receive Demon Lords, so we can’t just offer the bare minimum, can we?」

Up until now Milim was looking displeased, but after learning that she hasn’t been ignored, she immediately regained her jovial mood. But, someone is discontented by that.

「Hold on, Rimuru! I’m a Demon Lord too! I’m just like you and Milim, a member of the Eight Star Demon Lord!」

Seeing that Milim has received different treatment than herself, Ramiris begins to throw a tantrum.

「Ramiris, there’s no such thing as receiving you at all, didn’t you move here without permission!?」

「What? What do you mean by moving here? Ramiris, could it be that you are living with Rimuru now?」

After being pursued by questions from Milim and I, Ramiris is now the one who has lost her cool——

「That’s right! I was not invited, but that’s not important at all! Also I’m not gonna be alone in the future anymore, now that I’m living with Rimuru too!」

   

——Or so I thought that she has just lost her cool, instead she dropped this easily misunderstood statement.

   

「How cunning and cheeky of you! I want to live here too!」

「Hehe——! I came here for work. I’m helping Rimuru, not a guest like you who can only give trouble to people.」

   

「What! How dare you say that, you are just a——」

   

Milim is furious and begins to argue with Ramiris, who is not backing down either, even though she has no chance of winning, she has accepted the challenge.

As for me, I just stand back and watch to avoid being affected. With that being said, if Milim begins to resort to violence in her confrontation, there will be no need to use verbal arguments. That’s why their conflict is but a verbal quarrel. The two are arguing against each other, but it looks pretty pathetic since both are lacking in the vocabulary department. Their exchanges of insults were all awful, and would probably only make any bystander laugh.

 

Sometimes Ramiris will deliver a flying kick at Milim, to which Milim would chase after her in an attempt to grab onto Ramiris. It is like a game of tag, to any bystander, they will feel that they are just playing around with each other and they’re actually on good terms. These two fellows have long been acquainted, so perhaps this is also a reflection of their affection for each other.

Soon after, they suddenly hold back midway through their quarrel, putting an abrupt end to the argument. Because Shuna came by with desserts prepared in hands and scolded the two upon seeing this.

「No dessert for anyone who’s fighting!」

 

And because of these words, the two suddenly quiet down. The two who have made peace are now eating desserts together with much love. The scene suddenly became so harmonious, but I still have to ask Milim what she came for.

 

「By the way, Milim, why did you come here anyway?」

   

「Fufu, didn’t I just say? I feel as though you guys are doing something interesting.」

「No no no, eh, is that really the only reason?」

「Yep. But, I’m so lucky to have come. This thing called cake is the best, and this labyrinth thing also looks quite interesting. I didn’t expect that Ramiris would have been so useful.」

   

「Fufu————! I’m just like everyone else who has kept my power a secret. It’s just that you didn’t manage to discover it!」

Even though you say that, you yourself didn’t discover it either, Ramiris——That’s just my thought, I should keep it to myself. By the way, this girl Milim is really keen to spot an idea of this size. There is really nothing that can be hidden from Milim. She’s already someone who has ex-Demon Lord Karion and Frey as followers, and the speed at which she got here is truly shocking.

Basically, Milim is a wild card. Normally speaking, how is it possible for someone to run around outside all by herself, but it is not that surprising if that someone is Milim. It is really nothing to be astounded by if she shows up here. I’ll need to keep this in mind.

「Alright, now that we are done eating desserts, it’s about time to get back to work. Also Milim, if you won’t interfere, you can stay and play.」

How rare, Veldora-san has given a mature response. Now that I think about it carefully, it will be a problem if these two (Veldora and Milim) start arguing. Because her opponent was Ramiris, Milim held herself back. But it might not have been the case if it was Veldora.

The labyrinth facilities we put in so much effort to set up would be affected by their brawl and probably be destroyed instantly. It seems that Milim doesn’t hold a grudge against Veldora, so we’re safe for now.

 

「Since mentor has said so, I don’t object either.」

   

It seems that Ramiris has also agreed. Speaking of this, Milim is surprisingly on good terms with Ramiris, she was just intentionally playing tricks on her from the start.

「Just count on me! I won’t be a hindrance, so give me some work as well!」

Milim’s mood has become great as well and shows a look that she is willing to join us. I personally don't have an objection, I was going to agree without hesitation, but there’s something on my mind. There’s a point I need to confirm first.

「If that’s the case, can we have Milim join as well——」

「Hmm! Such an interesting thing, you should have come for me during the planning phase!」

「I get it, but, putting that aside. Milim, won’t your subordinates object? Did you actually get the permission from Karion-san and Frey-san?」

Although she appears to be so wild and care-free, this girl is still a Demon Lord after all. Moreover, she has now taken the two ex-Demon Lords Frey and Karion as subordinates and even took Clayman’s territory to become an overlord ruling over a huge area of land. Though the management of the land has been handed to Karion and Frey, she should have gotten much busier, at least in comparison to how it was before.

Is Milim right now really allowed to stroll around like this so freely? Eh, that goes for me too? I’m honestly fine. My subordinates are all very capable, so I should just avoid interfering with them. Moreover, I really am doing and carrying out plans. I’m even doing planning now to attract tourists, so I’m definitely not slacking.

Putting my own matters aside, the focus is on Milim. After being asked by me, Milim averts her eyes.

「I guess……? You see, I’m very bright……. Right? I definitely didn’t flee here because I hate studying!」

Milim says these words incoherently.

——I see. Frey has been in charge of investigating and summarizing reports on different nations. She must have handed the data she collected to Milim in hope of teaching her about ruling. But Milim escaped because of her dislike of it, that seems to be the truth.

「I don’t care! I just want to join no matter what!」

I wasn’t able to say anything before Milim opens up first rejecting me. Very impressive, Milim’s instinct is exceptionally keen. Honestly, I should contact Frey or Karion now——But, never mind, I guess.

I won’t be the one getting scolded anyway. “I know nothing of this,” that’s how it will go.

Compared to that——Something Milim has said made me very curious.

「Alright! You are the one getting scolded anyway, so I’ll drop the matter. Let’s talk dragons, dragon! Just now you said something about capturing a dragon, right? Is that really possible?」

「Uh! So I will get scolded indeed? No, but…… It can’t be helped. As the saying goes, adventure always comes with risk……」

Milim is a like a kid who isn’t scared about getting scolded for skipping classes and homework to play outside. Honestly, I can’t save her, this is the road she chose for herself. Standing by observing is part of the duty as an adult.

After some internal struggle, Milim chooses fun over work.

「You mean the dragons. They can be captured. Should I go find some?」

She answers without hesitation and seems to have switched up her mood. While saying it as if she’s going to catch some beetles, she proposes we go catch some dragons.

   

That’s just what I need right now.

「Uh, can I ask for that favor from you? If that’s the case, what types of dragons are out there? Are they related to the 『True Dragons』?」

 

Since she wants to help by catching some, of course I’ll ask for this small favour. I bear such thoughts in mind while asking, to which Milim and Veldora both react.

「Rimuru, dragons are different from 『True Dragons』.」

「Right. It’s not as if you are Ruminas, it’s simply wrong for you to mix me up with those lizards!」

The two object strongly. So as a follow up to the conversation, I inquire about the details of the dragons.

    ***

「——Basically, all of the dragon races in this world originated from my big bro, the strongest 『True Dragon』, 『Star King Dragon』 Veldanava. They are just monsters born carrying a diluted version of his likeness[76].」

 

Veldora begins to explain in detail as our conversation proceeds. There is a basic but critical difference between the two kinds, that is the difference between material life form and spiritual life form. As a monster, the dragon possesses a physical body. It is only called a dragon due to its similar appearance to a 「True Dragon」, but its nature is more akin to that of a dinosaur or in simpler terms, a giant, fierce lizard.

While it is said that there are in total four 「True Dragons」 in this world, right now only three remain. Veldora’s edler brother, Milim’s father 「Star King Dragon」 Veldanava was destroyed due to nutting in the wrong species certain reason and has shown no sign of being resurrected anytime soon.

「True Dragons」 are immortal beings, however, people believe that there is more to that attribute…… but anyhow, let’s put that aside for now.

The origin of dragons can be traced to this Star King Dragon, more precisely, it can be traced to the pet gifted to Milim by the Star King Dragon, Spirit Dragon (Elemental Dragon)[77].

Comparing this to the story Elen told me, that Spirit Dragon is no doubt the deceased Chaos Dragon. Nowadays in regions with concentrated magicules, there seem to be Lesser Dragons spawning and dragons with more elements of Spirit Dragon inherited became Greater Dragons (Arch Dragons).

In addition, there are also more powerful dragons among the Arch Dragons, they are the Dragon Lords that represent the four elements. After living hundreds of years after evolving to an Arch Dragon, and then having their wisdom increased even farther——These are the Dragon Lords. After evolving, they seem able to utilize part of Spirit Dragon’s power and no longer age as they grow older. They are nearly a semi-spiritual-life-form. But unlike 「True Dragon」, once they are eliminated, they are dead for good.

I recall that the sky dragon I beat was an Arch Dragon, its threat level was at Rank Calamity. Dragon Lord is stronger than that, they can probably rival a Demon Lord. In other words, perhaps they can compete with Clayman and Greater Spirit, or are perhaps even stronger than them.

If they have that large of a magciule pool, they should be able to easily gain control over the terrain effects of each floor.

「Hold on, no matter how strong I am, I won’t be able to capture the mighty Dragon Lords!」

Milim says so quickly, afraid that I may have misunderstood. If she says so then it must be the case. It would be impossible to tame Dragon Lords who possess intelligence. We may persuade them by asking for a favor, but the problem we are facing this time does not require us to go quite that far.

「You have a point, then which ones are you catching?」

「Hmm! Although they cannot rival Dragon Lords, there are Arch Dragons who do possess elemental attributes. We will be catching and taming those guys and let them consume magicule and help change the terrain.」

I see. The dragons seem to make their own nests, so they may modify their domain based on their needs.

All the necessary components have been prepared, and the magicule is filled to the brim. So I’ll take Milim’s suggestion.

「Can I count on you?」

 

「Leave it to me! Some of the dragons with elemental attributes may soon evolve to Dragon Lords, so I’ll capture one for each element.」

According to Milim’s explanation, there are four elements that developed from the Spirit Dragon. For each element——The Dragon Lords of Earth, Water, Fire and Wind are at the top of the food chain, followed by Elemental Dragons, forming a tree diagram. There are four types of Elemental Dragons as well. They are the Fire Dragon, Ice Dragon, Wind Dragon and Earth Dragon.[78] The sky dragon I beat seemed to have been a subspecies that failed to evolve in to a Wind Dragon. Unlike spirits, they don’t have the element of 「Air」.

It is also said that there are mutated dragons and ones that receive special evolution, in human’s words, they are called having (too much) personality.

Anyhow, now we can expect levels with terrain effects. If Milim does catch the dragons, we should put them at lower levels. By the way, the Elemental Dragons are stronger than their non-elemental cousins. A rough estimation of their strength is around Special Rank A, a powerful species. Even though they can’t really compete with Charybdis, they are still very strong.

I didn’t put too much thought in it. But in fact, a normal dragon can already rival six Holy Knights, or it is said to be able at least. But Elemental Dragon, even sending out a whole squad of Holy Knights may not necessarily be able to eliminate it…… Still that’s none of my business.

I’m not gonna care about that, but I’ve decided where to put my focus. The counters among the five main elements of spirits are as follows——Earth counters Air, Air counters Wind, Wind counters Water, Water counters Fire, Fire counters Earth. But the strength of Elemental Dragons don’t seem to be affected by this countering effect.

Although the elements counter each other, combat experience seems to be far more important. In simpler terms, an older dragon surpasses a younger dragon. So I can put them wherever I want.

Level 99 is the level of inferno flame.

——The final level surrounded by scorching flames. You must wear heat-resisting equipment, but what could be awaiting ahead——?

Level 98 is the level of ice prison.

——Pause your footsteps and you will die. Will you make it with cold-resistant gear?

Level 97 is the level of sky thunder.

——Thunder from the heavens is posing an omnipresent threat, whether you can overcome it will depend on your luck!

Level 96 is the level of earthly destruction.

——As if it is mocking the people arriving at the level, vicious earthquakes greet you. Behold the fury of dragons!

That’s about it.

Before they are able to fight the final boss Veldora, we will prepare these terrain effect levels with ultra difficulty. Then there will be no problem at all. By any stretch of normal logic, there’s no way anyone can defeat all these.

「Nice job, Rimuru!」

「Kukuku, so you are deploying low-lives before me. After seeing those imposters, the adventurers will lower their guards, and it will be my time to shine!」

「Uh, it is so awesome to have someone like Veldora to play that type of character. I want to try and be the final boss sometimes!」

The three each have a point that makes them satisfied. I’m also very happy about it. The only thing is, these pivotal dragons have yet to arrive, so I hope that we are not celebrating for nothing. Upon thinking so, I decide to patronize Milim a bit.

「What are you talking about, Milim. It is all thanks to you that we are able to complete this final trap!」

 

「!」

「That’s right, Milim! I’m relying on you this time as well, remember to catch some strong and handsome dragons and bring them here!」

「Hmm, count on me!」

Seemingly having noticed my intention, Ramiris joins in to assist my ploy. It appears to have worked as Milim was suddenly bursting with motivation. Now I can rest assured for a while.

As long as we have dragons, the traps can be smoothly deployed. It’s fine to not put any effects on these floors, because as soon as Milim captures the dragons to build their nests here, they will become ferocious traps themselves.

As a result Milim went out to catch some dragons. And then——

The captured dragons will become Ramiris’s servants.

    ***

A few days have passed since the day when Milim suddenly showed up and left. The setting of traps has been completed, all we need to do now is for Milim to return with the captured dragons.

「Ah, Beretta-san, Treyni-san, thanks for your hard work.」

「There’s no such thing, all of these are for Rimuru-sama and Ramiris-sama.」

「Indeed. I also feel overjoyed to work for Ramiris-sama.」

Beretta is acting very humble as usual in his response. As for Treyni-san, she has Ramiris sitting on her shoulder while looking thrilled. It seems that she’s willing to take any command from her.

Alright, now most of the things are completed——

 

「Right, Rimuru-sama, these things have been left with me for a while.」

After saying so, Beretta displays some special-grade weapons and gears.

「This is…….」

 

「These were liberated from a certain magic doll subordinate from Clayman. I didn’t have the chance to hand these to you then, but I think they will be quite suitable to be put in the treasure chests——」

   

Oh oh, now that you mention it. It’s from that greatest masterpiece of Clayman or something like that, was it called Piorra?

Piorra was strapped with weapons all over its body, which Beretta has taken the entirety of as loot. He had offered them to me previously, which I refused, because the demand he gave was the permission to move here.

At the time Beretta complied to my decision and brought those things home……

「Didn’t you offer them as gifts to Ramiris?」

Someone reacted to my doubts, not Beretta, but Ramiris.

「Hehe! I figure that I can’t really use them, so I’m not really that interested. They are indeed very strong weapons, but they can’t be modified too much. But even so, we kept them in hopes that they may be useful one day, that’s the decision we made after I discussed it with Beretta!」

「Is this really okay? You should be able to make a lot of money by selling them.」

「It’s okay, it’s okay. Because I have a job to do now too! I’ll probably be collecting money in troves in the future, so why be so petty now! Besides, we get to have a place of residence by doing so too.」

In this way Ramiris offers the weapons and gears to me, to which I express my gratitude and decide to put them to good use.

So that’s how it went down. Let’s get started with setting up the treasure chests soon and confirming the progress on the labyrinth. We begin by examining the condition of the dungeon starting at underground level 1.

The initial level is just for testing out your skill. It is designed so that even rookies can proceed safely. The width of the hallways inside the labyrinth area is also very large, so structurally it won’t easily cause people to get lost.

With that being said, four sides, each being with 250 meters in length, is quite spacious. Investigating the hallways alone will be hard work and there isn’t even much loot after walking all this time. This type of floor will likely lead to these situations. Having empty hallways alone probably won’t attract any customers, but luckily there’s a large number of weak monsters patrolling the area, so it shouldn't be an issue. People can get 「Magic Ore」 from these monsters and practical items from their corpses. There are still a lot of rewards.

This loot will be purchased by us. There isn’t a Freedom Association Branch in this town, and the nearest is the Brumund Branch, which will be too tiring for adventurers to reach, so I figure that our nation can buy it at a cheap price with a cost difference that cancels out the transportation expense. It seems like a pretty good idea. I was going to discuss with Yuuki to ask him the favor of building a Freedom Association Branch in our nation, which is also a good idea anyway. Until that is done, we’ll adopt this method for the time being in their stead.

Until underground level 5, we are only making the labyrinth slightly more complex without any major changes.

However, the situation will become dire from level 6 onward. All sorts of traps will be lying in wait. With that being said, up until underground level 9 there may be vicious traps, but no one should be killed by the traps alone. If these are skillful adventurers, they shouldn’t suffer too much.

If the difficulty is set too high, we won’t get returning customers and we won’t be able to negotiate anything with them then. That’s why the first nine levels will be more beginner-friendly.

Next up is the indispensable floor 10. That floor has a slightly stronger monster placed in the room. This is the so-called boss level. By defeating the boss, the gate leading down to the lower floors will open.

「Rimuru, what type of monster will you be deploying there?」

「About that, I’ll decide depending on what type of monsters are born…… But I haven’t spotted one?」

That’s right, in fact up until level 10 underground, I haven’t seen a single trace of a monster. Although it has been ten days since Veldora released his Youki, there isn’t any sign of monsters spawning.

《Answer. Even while hiding his Youki, monsters can sense the aura of individual 「Veldora」. Deducing that no monster dares to approach him.》

Ah, I see.

「Veldora’s release of magicules seems to have helped spawn some monsters, but they seem to have sensed Veldora’s aura, making them too frightened to dare approach.」

「What! So that’s why…… It’s no wonder monsters showed up in the sealed cave.」

After hearing my explanation, Veldora suddenly realizes. But, weaker monsters can’t really endure the aura either, so that was probably the main reason.

「Alight, just try to find one when you are available next time. I estimate to put at least a Rank B monster that is slightly strong on level 10.」

「Oh——Got it. But if there isn’t any intelligent fellow, we shouldn’t add it to my servants. Just bring it to the room and put this collar on it!」

Since Ramiris has spoken, I decide to take the collar. It is said that by wearing it, one can revive an infinite amount of times, even without making a pact with Ramiris. Then there will be no need to find replacements once they are defeated, how useful.

「Oh oh, this is so convenient. It will save a lot of work.」

「Right? Anyhow, in this labyrinth, I can do anything!」

   

It is indeed the case as how Ramiris put it. She can also change the ability given on each item, Ramiris’s skill is truly versatile. I once more lament that I can’t recreate her skill.

Now the problem with the bosses is resolved as well. Level 10 will only have the boss room, and it will be safe after defeating the boss. After this level, there will be a save point and the stairs leading to the lower levels, just these two.

Right, right, I can’t forget about the treasure chests. There is no trap in the treasure chest. The only difference is that we will be moderating the drop rate of weapons and gears. I estimate there to be hidden rooms after that floor, so I'll set up treasure chests with traps. And following level 20, there will even be fake treasure chests.

This is somewhat distasteful (predatory), but I suppose you can call that giving a sense of clarity and a reminder during the exploration of the labyrinth. When they experience it in the field, they should come and thank me instead.

It is not entirely a bad thing entirely. The inside of the labyrinth is full of magicules, so the equipment may even become magic swords or magic spears after some time. Since they are getting such precious rewards, encountering danger should be expected. They won’t die as long as they have 「Revival Bracelet」, so it will be more exciting to be cruel, and reasonably speaking, more interesting. I am really looking forward to what type of reaction the adventurers will give.

And like that, the inspection work for level ten is complete.

「What should we do next? Should we create a facility to buy back the items obtained by people from the monsters or for them to deposit the items?」

 

「Hmm——Do we really need that? Because, if we have that type of facility, 『Return Whistle』 will not sell well.」

I suppose that’s right too. Ramiris’s comment was an on-point rebuttal. She does have a point. It seems that Ramiris is quite perceptive when it comes to money.

「Indeed, putting this type of facility on a level with a save point does make it meaningless. Should we perhaps pick the middle ones, to make levels ending in five be safe zones?」

   

「Hmm hmm, that should work!」

We should make them available for storing items looted by adventurers and selling healing potions among other items at high prices. Building a meal area will be nice too.

We don’t have to put all these facilities on different floors, we just need to make sure these floors all have access to the same location. This is so creating them will not take too much work. Maybe there are many who want to rest outside instead of inside?

Well, that depends. 「Return Whistle」 is an item for emergency usage, so it will be fine to sell it at a higher price.

That part I can think about after the festival concludes.

    ***

That’s about it, everyone is taking the opportunity to shoot their opinions at each other in the discussion while examining each floor. As such, we did a thorough check as we smoothly built up the labyrinth.

We later were able to finish confirming level 100, and the result was satisfying. Simply describing the completed labyrinth with the word vicious would not do it justice.

《——Based on the strength of average adventurers, labyrinth set with low-level monsters already poses sizable difficulty. In addition with cruel traps and high-level monsters spawned, it is significantly insufficient to describe it with the term viscous——》

 

Eh, what? I didn’t catch you clearly. Raphael-sensei seems to be quite baffled by it. But of course, it must have been me thinking too much.

——I will later have a profound experience that proves I wasn’t thinking too much at all.

I decide to pick the bosses from the spawned monsters, but it turns out that the monsters in the labyrinth are already overcrowding it.

「W-What the hell——!」

I shout, but it is all too late. I went through a very hard time trying to adjust the difficulties, but I suppose I had it coming…… Whatever, it doesn’t matter if I have a problem with it. I will consider this as a minor miscalculation and quickly toss it to the back of my mind.

Many things happened in between, the rest will be handled by Veldora and Ramiris who are fully motivated. The dragons caught by Milim have been placed in their respective levels, and the magicule concentration of each level has also been moderated. There are also the automatically spawned monsters, who likely due to the deployment of dragons are no longer so concentrated. After such influence, right now the bosses are only planned up to level 30, so I won’t think too much over this.

On the surface, the construction of the colosseum is still underway, the speed at which its skeletal framework is proceeding is incredible. It should be able to catch up to the opening festival after the snow melts. And as for this labyrinth that lies underground, it has become an amazing recreational facility that far exceeded my expectations. Even though people need to purchase 「Revival Bracelet」 first before entering, as long as you have that, anyone would want to check it out at least once. I intend to make it our main attraction in the future to capitalize on its expected effects.

There are still many ideas of mine awaiting to be carried out, but, we will be done for now.

We all give off an evil grin and look at each other nodding. With that, the preparation work for the labyrinth is concluded for now.

Though the preparation work for the festival is still going on, there are already some unfamiliar faces showing up at the town. The snow is beginning to melt, and the visitors from all over the Jura Great Forests are arriving one by one to our nation.

The prelude to our nation-founding festival is soon to be unveiled——

Chapter 4

Reception Ceremony

Editors: Censored, Voxel, Muggy, Sierra

The labyrinth is nearly complete, so I ran back to the town. Veldora and Ramiris are still in the labyrinth. As for Milim, she’ll help with the building process as well once she’s caught enough dragons.

Speaking of it, is it really alright for her to not return to her nation?

——While these doubts crossed my mind, at the end of the day it’s Milim who will get scolded, so she can do whatever she wants.

The other three deemed their respective floors unsatisfactory after seeing the traps that I had set up.

Until floor 30, we can’t make the traps too harsh. On one hand, if the traps are too forgiving, we won’t be able to properly mess with the visitors. On the other hand, setting all the traps on hard mode will cause the adventurers to lose their interest.

If they don’t have a good time at the start, the amount of customers will gradually decline. Based on these considerations, I’ll set the traps myself for the first 50 levels. As for Veldora and Ramiris, I’ve handed the lower levels for them to design. They must be trying to come up with even more devious traps after seeing the evil traps I set when I’m serious.

「Rimuru, it seems I’ve been mistaken. Apparently traps are not to be set individually.」

 

「That’s not fair, I want to do one too!」

 

「Hmm. I focused too much on power, and it seems I didn’t pay much attention to making it easier for the traps to lure people in. I gotta be more serious with the arrangements in the future.」

 

Their comments on every single little thing is driving me nuts——I’m too lazy to care after all.

Level 51 to 60 have been assigned to Ramiris, while Veldora got levels 61 to 70. As for Milim, she will be in charge of level 96 to 99. These rooms will all have dragons, which will be the most difficult levels with the addition of terrain effects. I’ll let them modify the floors to their heart’s content, fully aware that they might devolve into pure insanity, but right now the adventurers can only get to level 50, so there shouldn’t be any problem.

If you’re curious, level 95 has been made into a shelter for the beastmen. It will become a resting place in the future that provides expensive accommodation services. We’ll take a wait and see approach, so I’ll keep a mental note of this.

As for the remaining floors from levels 71 to 94, we’ll see what we can do with them later. For now, we’ll leave them as they are. However, since there’s still a dense magicule content in that area, some monsters may end up spawning there.

And as such, the rest of the work was handed to the trio who seemed to be more than happy to do the job.

A few days pass.

After avidly scanning the city, I notice Myourmiles’s party headed our direction. It seems they have prepared and hurried their way over as soon as possible, as they’ve arrived earlier than expected.

「Rimuru-sama, I’ve arrived late. I’ll be in your care from today onward!」

「Ayyy, Myourmiles-kun. You are finally here. Let me take you to your house first.」

I welcome Myourmiles and bring him to his newly built estate that I ordered Rigurdo to construct beforehand. The house is ready to be checked in anytime now due to his comprehensive preparations. He carries out all my orders without hesitation; how capable he is indeed.I should acquaint Riguardo and Myourmiles sometime along the way. But though I say so, Myourmiles has already been doing business with our nation for the healing potions for quite some time, so the two are already very familiar.

The chores will thus be delegated to the Goblina guides and Myourmiles’s lackeys. I then visit Rigurdo’s office with Myourmiles.

「Rigurdo, excuse us.」

「Oh oh, isn’t this Rimuru-sama!? Even Myourmiles-san is here too. To what do I owe the occasion?」

Rigurdo was probably very busy, yet he still welcomed us with utmost haste.

 

「I see it is Rigurdo-dono; long time no see. Young master——I mean, Rimuru-sama——has always given me good care, so basically things went——」

Without me having to do anything, Myourmiles avidly begins explaining.

 

We moved to the guest room and immediately dove into the discussion. We first talked about the construction progress of the colosseum as well as the conditions of the inns in the southwest area. Next, we touched on the future plans for the stores that we plan to open up near the aforementioned colosseum. Finally, we brought up the recently constructed labyrinth designed to attract adventurers to our town[79].

「——That’s about it. While the preparations for the underground labyrinth are all complete, we still need a little bit more time before we can call it finished. With that being said, however, as of right now there’s not many problems left with it. The colosseum is not yet finished, but the stage has been constructed. Moreover, only the VIP area needs to be extravagant. As for the commoner seating, we can just drape the staircases with sheets. If that doesn’t work, we can just turn it into a standing area.」

We don’t have enough time, so we’ll save the work for the original standing area for later. The exterior of the building has yet to be decorated, so we will have to wait until Myrd returns. But since we’ve been meticulous about the security, even with the construction itself being only half-way through, the colosseum has the necessary stylistic elements of a building.

Rigurdo and Myourmiles listened to my words, enraptured. The three of us then began to plan enthusiastically.

Rigurdo raised the issue about how to deal with foreigners visiting our nation. He also vowed to properly educate the residents of the town by then. As for the Martial Arts Tournament and the underground labyrinth, Myourmiles has planned out how the events will unfold. He has been brainstorming a lot of ideas after my visit, so he’s quite confident about it. After he finished speaking, he put on a proud smile.

Later on, we helped to check for any flaws in each others’ plans. We’ve also reflected on our own plans to see what else needs to be done in advance.

「With the addition of Myourmiles-san into the equation, our little undertaking just got wings.」

Rigurdo commented, smiling.

「Isn’t that true! Myourmiles-kun is a very capable man after all. If our opening festival concludes successfully, I intend to hand over our finance department to him」

I mentioned the most important point to Rigurdo.

I told him that I intend to appoint Myourmiles to be in charge of the Financial Department. In addition, he will also be managing the Commercial and Advertising Department. I hope he will do his part for this nation.

 

Rigurdo doesn’t seem to have any qualms about this, promising that he will be selecting candidates to become Myourmiles’s subordinates.
