Then there is no need to be courteous with these people. Now I can use them to whatever end I want. After all, they’ve been fighting a war for over a hundred years and are troublesome tribes. They must really enjoy combat, if that’s the case, surely they will not complain to have the inside of the labyrinth as their battlefield. I heard that they would even rob weaker species and commit other bad deeds, so everyone would be happy if I quarantine these people.

「I see that you guys seem to be full of energy, how about I help you all prepare a stage to fight on.」

「Ehh, are you forgiving them? I was going to punish these people in Rimuru-sama’s place……」

Rigurdo’s reply is tinged with regret after hearing my words.

The commotion they just caused has been resolved like this, but, Rigurdo seems to be pissed about it. With that being said, since I’ve already taken in these people, I might as well give them the chance to work for me. It is better that way.

「Geez, don’t get mad, Rigurdo. In my eyes these people were just being ignorant. So don’t fuss with them over this one incident. I’ll leave things in your care if these people underestimate me again.」

「Since you’ve spoken, I don’t have any objection. You guys are really lucky. If Rimuru-sama were any less gracious of a man, you would have already been taken care of! If you dare to defy again, it will be your demise. Consider this as a lesson to reflect and learn to restrain in life.」

Fortunately, Rigurdo seems to have accepted it.

「Count yourself lucky today, if not for the commotions just now, not only Rigurdo-san, I would have struck too. The balls you had to say those distasteful words, I planned to cut out your tongues so you couldn’t say such grotesque things anymore. You guys need to appreciate Rimuru-sama’s kindness and work hard from now on.」

I wasn’t able to reply before Shion suddenly piped up. The Gozu and Mezu tribesmen nod heavily while shivering.

「「「W-We will not fail your expectations! That’s why, we hope that you can forgive us for our offense!」」」

Seeing how unanimously they declared that, surely they won’t dare to defy us ever again.

「Since you’ve pledged allegiance to me, I can consider to promote you guys. But first you need to stop causing conflicts with others. You have to behave yourselves before my order.」

   

Although I’m not required to make this warning myself, this is my ultimatum for them. I’ll find one of the Gozu leaders later and negotiate to have them work at the labyrinth. Now things are going smoothly again. I uncaringly threatened them and admonished them hard. These people should obey nicely now.

It looks like I’ll be getting my Minotaur after all. This incident has left me overjoyed to the point that it relieved the built up stress and exhaustion from the past couple of days.

    ***

After that, the reception continues smoothly. The news of Shion taming the sons of Dagruel has spread out, and seeing how powerful races of Gozu and Mezu were in fear, there were no other races that dared to look down on me. I hope this continues until the end of the reception ceremony……

In front of me, it's the elder of the Elven tribe——who seems to be a youth in his prime no matter how I see it——He also brought several servants. Not one of them is female, which is a pity since the Elven females are usually beauty to be behold.

Basically, the Elves are a species with a long lifespan.

Spirits after becoming materialized——or perhaps fallen——will turn into fairies and possesses a body. They are the ancestors of elves and dwarves. A Race such as the goblins are also distant relatives of ancient fairies.

The ones possessing 「Earth」 element became Dwarves. 「Water」 element became Mermaids. 「Fire」 element became Goblins. And 「Wind」 Element became Elves. These are all results of cross-breeding between ancient fairies and other races that made up their ancestors.

The Goblins are the species with the thinnest bloodline which makes their lifespan shortest. It is about the same for their evolved race of ogre. Their lifespan is around a hundred years. Upon evolving to Kijin, the power possessed by their spirit ancestors will be awakened. They then get to utilize powerful skills such as Psychic Power (神通力)[89].

Back to the topic of Elves. It is said that they can live up to five hundred to eight hundred years. Even human half-breeds can still live for nearly three hundred years. Basically, the lifespan of each elf varies greatly in accordance to how much fairy blood flows through their veins.. They will not age anymore after living twenty odd years into adulthood. Around twenty years before their natural lifespan expires, they rapidly begin aging until the day they die.

Theyenjoy hundreds of years of youth, which to humans makes them appear like a fairytale species. Notable however is their low fertility rate, likely due to their longevity, they lack the desire to pass on generations. As a result, they are few in number.

This is all the information I learned from the ladies at the Dwarven Kingdom night shop——「Night Butterfly」, although I’m not sure whether it’s true or not.

By the way, fairies still exist as their own species. They are not even rare, but in fact a very common type of monster. They are about the same size as Ramiris, and enjoy pranks. They evolved from lesser spirits due to the influence of magicules.

While they do possess intelligence, they are limited to one generation of descendants and have very short lifespan. While they are all fairies, these ones cannot rival those evolved (materialized) from greater spirits, so they are categorized as two different types of monsters.

Some people often mix Ramiris up with this type of fairy, but in reality they are not the same creature. She fell from the high-ranked species of Spirit Queen, which is likely far more advanced than the ancestors of elves and dwarves. Ramiris seems to reincarnate a lot, so I probably can’t get an answer even if I ask her……

Ah, I went on a tangent.

Let’s hear the elder’s greeting.

   

「We are honored to have you receive us. Today we’ve come for congratulations Moreover, allow us to show our gratitude——」

The elder saluted me first before saying so.

Normally speaking, they would first greet me, then announce their allegiance to me. As for the people who have joined the Federation from the start, some of them will express appreciation due to my effort in ensuring their safety and comfort in life. But this is the first time the Elven elder and I have met each other. I feel somewhat bestranged after hearing his thanks, so I ask Rigurdo to inquire about it.

「Oh, that’s because——」

The elder claims that it is related to the Gozu and Mezu tribes.

The two races have been fighting each other for over a hundred years, and it is said that the biggest victim of it were the Elves.

The elder states——

The Elves rely on the resources of the forest to survive, to them the expansion of the warzone is an issue that concerns their livelihood. In order to prevent themselves from being harmed by external threats, the elves will apply a disorienting 「Barrier」 around their hidden residence. However, the war has damaged the forest——As the trees were chopped down and the 「Barrier」 was destroyed.

Without the vegetation, it’s futile trying to disorientate invaders, which left their hidden residence completely exposed to the outside world. They managed to quickly relocate the tribe and were able to avoid the harm, but they didn’t expect the scale of war to gradually increase.

The war has caused the animals and monsters of the forest to flee. Edible vegetables and fruits cannot be grown, and there were Elves that ran off to seek jobs in the Dwarven Kingdom. Now that I think about it, the Elven ladies at 「Night Butterfly」 must have left their home for that reason to make a living working in foreign land.

Later, due to the increased severity of the outflowing population, their residence became hard to maintain. They were forced to plan to move again, but given how large Jura Great Forest is, it is not easy to find a new location of residence.

「That’s why, we were hoping to report the matter to you so you may come up with a way to deal with those thugs. But before we could have made the request, your highness managed to make the judgement. Now all we need to do is to find a new place to move to——」

By then the people who have gone abroad for work will probably gradually return as well. These are the Elder’s claims. Upon hearing his words, an idea popped up in my head——A new place to move to… that’s right, a place to move to indeed... We have that right here in our town!

The Elven population is said to be no more than three hundred people. There were more of their race in ancient times, and at that time they apparently also built a kingdom that prospered for a while. But their past glory is no more, the Elves have become nomads that scatter all over the world. If they only have three hundred people, we do have a pretty good spot for them to move to.

Indeed, it is the mini forest we just finished building on level 95 of our underground labyrinth. We just have to make them move there. As for their job assignment, we can make them assist Apito in raising bees and grow rare plants which can only be collected from forest with high magicule concentration. Or we can have them assist management in the planned inns on level 95. We can also invite them to manage the weapon shops. Moreover, though I don’t think such a thing would happen, but if there are ever monsters on level 95, it will be more reassuring with Elves to protect the village. I heard that they get along really well with the Treants, so Treyni-san and the others shouldn’t object.

There are tons of work over there to do, they can also use this opportunity to call back the scattered tribesmen from around the world. Perhaps those girls making money abroad will return too. By that time, will the Elf Club for special members only no longer just be a dream——?

Amazing, this is amazing.

There are bars in our town too, just that they serve as restaurants as well. Doing it this way was most suitable for the adventurers. When I want to enjoy a drink in peace however, that only leaves me with the executive’s restaurant to go to.

I can always ask Shuna to help me prepare drinks in my own room, but I’m not that desperate for a drink.

I just want…… just want to catch a breath sometimes. The reason isn’t that I can’t leave myself open when Shuna’s present. Or that I won’t be able to chat nonsense with Gobta, or that I can’t find a suitable place to have secret meetings with Myourmiles-kun, none of these are the actual reasons. It goes without saying.

——Seriously no, I’m telling the truth!

If we have a shop like 「Night Butterfly」, I will be able to find venues for all sorts of things. But that’s just an idea. Seeing that the Elven elder looks rather confused, I decide to raise the idea and give it a go.

「Chief, I’ve got a suitable place for you to move to——」

Due to me speaking up personally, Rigurdo steps back to be a listener. Perhaps he has found the time to train, no matter what situation he runs into, he’s always able to respond without a sweat. Even if I slide off onto another tangent, he will probably help to round things up perfectly. How reliable.

「Oh, OHOH! Is that true, your highness?」

「Hmm. Since there are just three hundred of you, we can take in all of your tribesmen.」

「Thank you! Then please wait for me to return and bring all the tribesmen together to meet you.」

「Got it. Before you return, I will also modify the living environment to accommodate your residence. But, I have some work that I want you to handle, is it alright?」

「There's certainly no problem. If us Elves can contribute for Rimuru your highness, it will be our greatest fortune.」

The Elven elder is happier than I expected. He must have gotten a huge burden off his chest now that they don’t need to worry about roaming in the dangerous forest in search for a place of residence. He immediately sends men back to have the tribesmen prepare for the move.

 

That’s how we decided to allow the Elves to move into the labyrinth. It would be fine if things just conclude like this, but the elder brought up something that concerns me. He mentioned that many people who had gone out to earn money recently have not returned.

He also added that the Elven race is very united and that he didn’t think these people would abandon their hometown like this……

Some people even didn’t return after going out to hunt monsters, which concerned him.

But it may just be due to elve’s keen inclination towards the idea of individualism, so perhaps they suddenly had the urge to leave, as the elder put it so——This suddenly reminds me of something, it’s what I overheard at Myourmiles’s shop. Viscount Kazak of Brumund Kingdom once went to discuss business with Myourmiles. I recall that he mentioned opening a store that will use Elven slaves……

 

Some of the Elven youths have not returned for long. Their disappearance seems to be linked to Viscount Kazak who got hold of Elven slaves——actually, linked to some criminal organization. If this ominous prediction of mine is true……

Hopefully I’m just worrying too much, or else the problem will be severe.

I went so far as to push forward my dream of opening an Elf Club, but it seems to be necessary to thoroughly investigate this situation first.

I see off the Elven elder who thanked me and is about to leave as I contemplate in heart. Then through 「Thought Communication」, I command Souei who is awaiting orders behind me.

   

「Souei, go investigate Viscount Kazak of Brumund Kingdom.」

「Understood!」

Souei immediately dispatches his 「Clones」 to handle the investigation.

That should do it. Hopefully before the end of the reception ceremony, I can more or less get hold of some information. I can then find Myourmiles and ask him about how much information he has on the criminal organization that trades slaves. If we find out in the end that they are related to this, we will not spare them without a payback. It is a challenge to my love for Elves after all.

My personal ambition is to open an 「Elf Club」[90] of my dream and be the owner of the place. I’ll just have to defeat whoever dares to get in the way of my business. I make up my mind and decide to open an investigation on the matter.

   

    ***

The last day of the lengthy reception ceremony finally arrives. If I make it through today, the nation-founding festival will then be hosted in three days.

After the meeting with the Elves, there hasn’t been much issue. Everything went smoothly and the monsters that have temporarily settled in the town have not caused any major dispute either. The incident caused by Dagruel’s sons have become public knowledge at this point, but these idiots who tried to show off their power have also become tamed. Although I don’t want to praise Shion, sometimes her lofty violent behaviours can be of use too.

 

Geld who has been on vacation since a few days ago has returned to the nation. Diablo and Hakurou have also returned yesterday.

「Oh oh, Rimuru-sama. I see that you are as majestic as always. It’s been so long since I get to meet you, the joy in my heart is overflowing.」

Diablo started to say this nonsense followed by a series of 「Kufufufufu」laughter. What prestige does a slime have?? this guy’s eyes must have some problem——I thought to myself internally.

I really want to hear his report, however we will have to discuss that later. Diablo looks disappointed too, but today we have an important meeting. The guests we are having a meeting with today are VIPs, drawing much attention from me.

I definitely can’t get careless. It is imaginable that this will be the toughest reception yet. That’s why today I have all the executives present to participate in the ceremony.

As for these VIPs, I have Benimaru working on welcoming them. The fact that my right hand man Benimaru took the task——From that alone you should realize how important this tribe is.

A heated aura like burning fire gradually approaches outside the entrance. It seems that the rumor is true. As the door opens, a group of armed militia enters. They are——The race that Benimaru visited in person as envoy.

The Tengu race.

They reside on the Coscia Mountain at the border of Jura Great Forest, an independent faction outside of my territory. Technically speaking, this is no reception, it is more like a conference. The armed militia arrives at the reception hall. Their leader is a beautiful young girl.

I thought that they were called Tengu because they have long nose[91]. Tengu race is the heavenly dog (Tengu), in simpler terms, they are the mixed race between angel and Mountain Wolf (Okami)——

《Notice. The correct term is not mixed race. The angel race incarnate into the body of Mountain Wolf race to have formed this race.》

Oh yeah, they seem to be a race originated from incarnation.

The Mountain Wolf is a type of Beastman, they are born to be lonesome and prideful. Their name Okami (Mountain Wolf) has the same pronunciation as 「Great God」(O’Kami 大神). And so the name 「Tengu」 has become a metaphor for 「Person with extraordinary sense of smell」. By the way, about this race that seems to be worshipped as mountain deities——

《Notice. Correctly speaking it is not the race that is worshipped. It is like individual 「Ranga」 who due to his 「Individual」 ability caused him to be categorized into the subgroup (of deity).》

——Right right.

I’m actually completely out of the loop on the whole thing, but basically these are Mountain Wolves who were born as deities that are crazy strong. Due to the incarnation of Angels using their flesh, they were able to give birth to the race (Tengu) that retains their personal will.

That powerful individual is the biological parent of this young girl in front of me, the elder of the Tengu race. This elder’s power has declined greatly due to the birth of said child. It was for this reason that this young girl has become the chief of the Tengu tribe.

Since we shouldn’t call this a reception, it is more appropriate to call it a conference. Moreover, there’s something more important——

    ………………

    …………

    ……

Benimaru paid this Tengu tribe a visit before.

They were kind enough to have allowed the High Orcs to move over to their region, but in reality this race is extremely prideful. If we are to demand of them to fall under my control, they will definitely dislike us. It may inevitably lead to war. Of course, I never plan on doing that in the first place.

This powerful race is strong enough to be worshipped as mountain deities, so it is not necessary to fight them. Benimaru is well aware of that too. It was to obtain their permission to build the road from our kingdom to Sorcerer's Dynasty Sarion that he went to visit them.

「I’ve successfully established contact with them. The Tengu tribe cannot ignore Rimuru-sama, they apparently wish to pay you a visit.」

 

Benimaru reports so to me after returning, yet in contrast to his report, he looks very exhausted.

「Was there any problem?」

「No, that’s not the case……」

I asked him worryingly, to which Benimaru bit his tongue and didn’t give a direct response. There’s also Alvis who went along with him as an envoy, after returning, her body——actually, her mood——was very bad. The atmosphere then didn’t seem to be appropriate to ask questions. I couldn’t do anything about them, but I decided to force Benimaru to answer my question. It is quite inconvenient to make him talk in front of the rest of the executives, so I went for a drink with Benimaru in private.

These were the things I managed to get out of him——

    ***

Benimaru and Alvis brought a dozen 「Kurenai」members and arrived at the hidden village of the Tengu tribe.

Their journey has been smooth, up until they were halted by some young warriors of the Tengu tribe in front of a cave on the top of Coscia Mountain. The young warriors were wearing all white with a tachi sheathed on their belts. They had a pair of white wings sprouting from their backs and adorning their heads were triangle-shaped ears, like you’d find on dogs. They even had a tail! Observing their well trained stances, it became readily apparent that they were proficient in martial arts. Benimaru wasn’t oblivious to this fact and informed them about their intentions, seeking permission to be let through the 「Barrier」 deployed in the cave.

The young warriors approved their requests and led Benimaru and Alvis inside. Through the cave, they were greeted with flowers blossoming in what can only be described as an arcadia[92]. It is not too cold nor too hot, the weather is always perfectly comforting——As expected from the residence of a powerful race, this is a beautiful village.

The warriors led him to a location where a beautiful girl came out to welcome Benimaru.

This girl, unlike the other Tengu tribesmen, looks fairly similar to humans. Her pure white hair reaches her shoulder, with the hair near the sides of her ears turning bright red. Her small, cherry-colored lips seem very soft. With pupils that resembles that of a wolf’s, her narrow pair of eyes gaze at Benimaru inquisitively, without turning, as if she were analyzing her prey.

This person is not to be underestimated——Benimaru thought to himself. Her presence could rival Demon Lord Karion, who he had met before, or maybe she was even beyond that.

   

「My name is Benimaru. I am visiting as a representative of Demon Lord Rimuru-sama.」

「Welcome, Envoy-dono. I am the daughter of the Tengu tribe elder. Momiji (紅葉 Autumn leaf) is my name. So, what is the purpose of your visit? Do you plan to take over this land?」

Despite the glamorous smile on her face, the response she gave to Benimaru’s greeting was anything but friendly.

We are not welcomed here, Benimaru could sense that. But he was not going to let such a minor thing hold him back.

「We have no such intent. We only wish that you will grant us the permission to pass by and cross the Coscia mountain between here and the border of Jura Great Forest. If possible, I also hope that you will permit us to dig a tunnel in this mountain.」

「Hmph. So you claim that you have no ambition to expand, I see…… You may have permission to pass…… but what do you mean by digging a tunnel?」

Momiji was not interested in hearing Benimaru’s explanation, but the word tunnel had caught her attention. Honestly speaking, Benimaru was not too sure about what this tunnel thing was either, the rough explanation Rimuru gave him was that it is about opening a hole in the mountain. In fact, this tunnel plan hasn’t even been tested yet, ever since Rimuru proposed it. If they are connecting with the capital of Sarion, digging a tunnel would create the shortest route. Technically there is no need to go that far; connecting the road to one of Sarion’s towns along the border would suffice. There is really no need to dig a tunnel. Benimaru was aware of that plan B, but he still decided to bring it up.

「This tunnel thing, it is something about opening a hole in the mountain so that the road can extend to the opposite side. We won’t press it if it is not convenient for you——」

 

「Hold on. Opening a hole in the mountain? Are you serious?」

「Indeed. That’s how the plan states it. But, we don’t need to dig any tunnel for the road being constructed this time. I only asked beforehand in case of it becoming a necessity in the future. If you are not willing, we will not force you to do so.」

Benimaru answered swiftly. However, the Tengu tribesmen began to sway. To them, the mountain is holy, things like digging tunnels is blasphemy.

「You are truly awful. We don’t care for whether a slime becomes a Demon Lord or not, he can do what he wants as long as he does not interfere with us. We even planned to close one eye for you and that stinking snake you brought[93]. But, we can’t just sit here and endure now that you dared to belittle our divine mountain.」

Upon saying so, Momiji rose from her seat. Benimaru didn’t mean that at all, but given the circumstances right now, continuing negotiations with them seems impossible.

What a misstep——Benimaru thought to himself.

Even if Benimaru tries to talk them out of it, the other party won’t back down. He decided his best course of action would be to remain still for a while longer, an opinion Alvis clearly didn’t share as she broke her silence with words of indignation:

 

「You mentioned a snake that stinks, were you perhaps referring to me?」

She was secretly boiling in fury as she stood up from her seat to stare at Momiji. A fight was about to break out as both persons began to emit a dangerous aura.

「Oi, stop that at once——」

Benimaru tried to halt her when Alvis’s sharp gaze was shot at Momiji.

Extra Skill 「Eyes of Heavenly Snake (Snake’s Eye ヘビノメ)」——Effects of paralysis, poison and madness etc. began to corrupt Momji who had been directly gazed at by Alvis.

Yet Momiji wasn’t concerned at all.

「Petty trickeries. I am the daughter of the Tengu Tribe elder, status ailment doesn’t work on me.」

 

With those words said, Momiji closed her hands to draw out a fan.

The Tengu are semi-spiritual life-forms. Just as Momiji said, they have high resistance against status ailment. Moreover, Momiji’s Extra Skill 「Sense of Heavenly Wolf (天狼覚 Tenrou’kaku)」 is always activated. It possesses analysis ability that surpasses the five senses and has effects similar to an advanced version of Extra Skill 「Magic Perception」. But that is not all, 「Sense of Heavenly Wolf」 can also nullify all illusion and conjuring magic. That is why a sneak attack on Momiji (like that) will not work.

   

It is almost as if she’s saying It’s my turn, Momiji raises her fan and launches an attack at Alvis as if she’s dancing. Alvis blocks the first hit with her golden Khakkhara, yet was hit on the side of her stomach by the immediate follow-up, sending her flying to the corner of the hall.

「Ummm!」

Although it was just a casual hit, Momiji’s movement was extremely skillful. She reopens the fan that was closed due to the previous hit and elegantly use it to conceal her mouth.

A moment passed before Momiji broke the silence.

「Is that all? I see the prestigious Beastketeer isn’t that strong after all.」

Now that hurt Alvis’s dignity.

「Don’t underestimate me now, you hick. I held back since we are negotiating with you, but it seems there’s no such need anymore.」

Alvis’s wounds have all been healed as she stood up uncaringly. She glared back at Momiji with cold eyes. As a high-ranked Majin of the Beast Kingdom Yuuazarania, she began to demonstrate the proper style to stand off against Momiji.

「Holding back? That’s my line. I’ve put an effort trying not to kill our envoy. Or is it that you intend to truly anger me?」

 

The two stared at each other as the temperature in the surrounding room began to drop noticeably. Even the young Tengu warriors standing guard in the hall fell victim as the whole room is filled with concentrated Youki that tenses their nerves. Under such circumstances, only Benimaru was drinking tea on his seat.

This could no longer be simply described as a misstep, things have gotten problematic. He thought to himself while drinking.

「You are indeed strong. But, this world is not so pretty as to allow some little girl with no combat experience to triumph.」

   

「Wann try? As you’ve said, I want to accumulate combat experience too. You happen to be a pretty good target to experiment with.」

The animosity was ever increasing between the two until it reached the breaking point.

At that instant——

With the flash of a sword, the fan in Momiji’s hand is deflected.

Silence fell upon the hall.

The speed was so fast that no one was able to respond when Benimaru intervened in the duel.

「That’s it. It was my fault to have spoken things that displeased you. With that being said, I will not allow you kill my companion.」

 

Benimaru declared calmly.

「B-Benimaru-sama? Are you implying that I would lose?」

 

「Yes. Had I not intervened in time, you would have been cut in half.」

「T-That’s a lie! I did control my attack power——」

「No, your control of Youki is not skillful enough. There was too much strength.」

「H-How could this——」

「I.. I lost……?」

Momiji and Alvis both unconsciously collapsed at the same time at the scene.

 

It was then that a door deep into the hall is opened as a beauty with large dog ears appeared.

The young Tengu warriors quickly kneeled.

「M-Mother!」

 

As she cracks a smile towards the panicked Momiji, the Tengu elder and Momiji’s mother slowly stepped forward.

She then stepped towards Momiji——

「Silly girl!」

The elder scolded her loudly while approaching.

Everyone changed the venue and the two parties sit face to face again. It was a Japanese-style room with tatami and futon (Japanese bedding). Deeper into this room is another U-shaped room without a door. It is specially arranged so that the Tengu elder who is often ill (in bed) can take a rest as soon as possible when she needs it.

After the incident, the elder gave Momiji a lesson with her fists, she’s still holding her head with tears in her eyes. Although she still looked quite indignant, she didn't appear to complain anymore.

   

「It’s alright, you don’t have to force yourself. We’ve only come here to greet you——」

Although their goal was not reached, the atmosphere at hand is no longer suitable for any negotiation. Moreover, Alvis was also dejected, so staying any longer will only make the situation more awkward. Benimaru decided to leave before the elder herself came forth to halt him.

 

「Hehehe, don’t mind that, young man. Speaking of which, your swordsmanship was extraordinary. Could it be 『Oboro-Ryu』 (朧流 School of Haziness)[94]?」

「Why do you——Actually, I see how it is now. Momiji-dono’s fan dance also had elements of my style. Could it be——」

   

「Indeed. I’ve also studied 『Oboro-Ryu』, from my mentor——『Byakuya Araki』 [95].」

「What!」

Benimaru was shocked. Seeing his expression, the Tengu elder smiled contently.

「My name is 『Kaede』 (Maple)——」

After saying this, Tengu elder——Kaede began to tell the story of her past. According to her, around three hundred years ago, she seemed to have stayed in the Ogre’s village. She hid her true strength, went on journeys and happened to encounter Byakuya and studied sword art under him. Kaede had a senior back then; the man could only be described as a genius who was born for the arts of the sword. He was also Byakuya’s grandson.

「How upsetting that I can’t grant him a name.」

Apparently this was Byakuya’s mantra. Naming monsters on a whim may end up costing you your life. Byakuya was human, so he would have definitely died. At the time, Kaede also didn’t have a 「Name」, so she couldn’t understand how he felt back then, yet she could nowadays. The hope he held was to leave something for his loved one. To monsters, it is normal to not have names, but it is different for humans.

 

Later, Byakuya’s life came to an end and passed away from this world leaving his grandson, who then became the Demon Swordsman (Kenki)[96]. His strength quickly approached that of Kaede and his technique was already far beyond hers. Moreover, Kaede was mesmerized by his dashing swordsmanship.

And so she confessed her love to him under a large maple tree. After sharing a night together, she departed from the Ogre village……  

The climate in the Jura Great Forest was very unstable, that maple tree however has always grown tall and beautiful. Its autumn leaves would be dyed with a pretty red color. It had become a symbol of the village which even Benimaru remembered. He recognized that she was speaking the truth.

「Eh, hold on, wouldn’t that make you Hakurou’s……」

Benimaru became anxious and his mutter slipped out of his mouth unconsciously. Kaede replied:

「Oh, so is he called Hakurou now? I see, my senior Kenki-dono got a name. To be honest however…… It’s quite surprising to learn that he’s even still alive.」

Benimaru was getting more and more nervous seeing Kaede finishing her words with a smile on her face.

H-Hold up hold up. Does Hakurou know about this?

All sorts of questions like that crossed his mind. But, what happened next made Benimaru even more bewildered.

「With that being said, I can finally be reassured now.」

「——?」

 

「Hakurou-dono has trained a reliable and courageous prodigy, and he will be the husband to my daughter.」

Pffft!

Benimaru was trying to drink some tea to calm down, but he has accidentally spit it out now. Benimaru seldom loses his cool, yet this whole trip had been full of surprises ever since they arrived at the village.

Benimaru is however not the only one to lose composure. Alvis next to him became speechless, dropping her teacup, which shattered into a million pieces.

Upon hearing this, Momiji looked at Benimaru first with her face blushed before turning to her mother Kaede.

 

「W-Wait a second, mother——?」

She helplessly tried to cover up Kaede’s mouth, but Momiji was no rival to Kaede. She suppressed Momiji single-handedly and turned to Benimaru with a serious tone:

「Then, Benimaru-dono. The proposal you just raised, we will accept all of its content. Moreover, we can pledge allegiance to Demon Lord Rimuru. However, the condition is that you will marry my daughter. That point is really without saying, but I suppose I should ask for your perspective.」

How do you expect me to respond after asking so directly about such an important matter——Benimaru thought to himself.

   

Hopefully they would give him some time to consider. The other person who managed to save Benimaru was the girl of the hour, Momiji.

「Hold on! I know that mother has already acknowledged this guy. But I haven’t! He does indeed seem stronger than me…… If that’s the case, I hope that he would not be forced by mother, but to truly like me. A good woman should move the heart of the man she likes, didn’t mother always say that?」

Momiji flustered for some reason after saying this. She used her fan to hide her face before running away on her own. Kaede laughed out loud at the scene. Alvis raised her head with some form of revelation while Benimaru felt a bit embarrassed seeing how Momiji had acted.

Speaking of this, Hakurou has always acted very gracefully……. Now that I’ve lost my cool over such an insignificant matter, it only means that my training is still lacking——

He did some self-reflection——But, this whole incident just happened too abrutly…… And so his marriage with Momiji was brought back to be discussed.

Basically the whole deal has been Kaede’s own personal wish, not actually something she wanted to impose on Benimaru. At most she was just delivering a message. It would be a huge gain for her if Benimaru had agreed, but that’s just a thought. The rest of the requests from the Tempest Federation were also passed after brief discussion, there wasn’t much of a problem. The tunnel digging on the mountain was discussed separately, they’ve permitted us to build the road to Sarion.

 

However, there are other issues to be discussed. Putting aside whether Benimaru and Momiji can get together, they hope that the Tengu tribe can build a good relationship with Demon Lord Rimuru——Kaede proposed as much.

Despite how she looked, Kaede was in fact extremely ill——Or so they proclaimed to the public.

It was however not the case (being ill). Kaede was pregnant with Momiji for too long and passed most of her power to Momiji. After giving birth to her fifteen years ago and giving her a 「Name」. This caused her, the worshipped earth deity to consume almost all of her magicule storage. Now she can only await her end.

That’s why Kaede hoped to find her cute yet inexperienced daughter a strong backing. That was her only wish.

And Benimaru happened to visit that land. To Kaede, it was a sign of hope. Kaede thought it was the last string of hope left by the man she loved (Hakurou).

It won’t matter even if my wish is rejected. So Demon Lord Rimuru had you by his side? I thought that you would have passed before me, what a delightful miscalculation. Surely it will draw back your memory when you see that child Momiji.

Kaede thought to herself, and so she agreed to discuss the issue in the future.

And so, it was Momiji’s turn to visit Demon Lord Rimuru.

    ***

About that…. Benimaru seemed to be getting a serious headache over the whole thing. It was probably the biggest crisis Benimaru had ever faced since he was born. He claimed it was even scarier than our initial encounter, which I’m really not sure how to interpret. Perhaps it was Benimaru’s way of joking.

Putting that aside however, even that Alvis was easily suppressed. That woman’s combat ability is not to be underestimated. It’s fortunate that we didn’t antagonize her.

——No, I’m running away from reality, that’s not the issue. I never expected Hakurou to have a daughter……

A huge problem has emerged, and what truly unnerves me is that the conclusion I reached in resolving it is that we won’t know how to deal with the matter unless we meet them. After all, this issue cannot be resolved by me and Benimaru alone. Hakurou will also play a key role in this, I’ll have to hear him out. But at the time it was not convenient to summon him back…… That’s why before Hakurou’s return, we decided to push these questions back for now.

And soon after, last night——We found Hakurou who had returned from Farmus Kingdom to discuss among the three of us. Right now we have no clue what type of demands the Tengu tribe would make. There’s no telling what may happen, so we planned to receive them on the last day. That’s why I was about to summon Hakurou back if he didn’t manage to get back in time. But it seems there’s no such need.

With that being said however, he did manage to return in time, but the problem remains unresolved. Whether Benimaru will be marrying Momiji or not, it would be their problem. Even if they are getting married it is fine. Basically it’s none of my business……

「Please hold on! I have my own considerations as well, or perhaps should I stand my ground——」

「What are you talking about? Could it be that young master thinks my daughter is not worthy of you?」

「I never said that! By the way, you’ve never even seen her, don’t even know she was born, so don’t act like a father now!」

「It is because I know that fact that I’m gonna take responsibility from now on!」

And just like that, Benimaru doesn’t know what to do while Hakurou is acting abnormally……. Things have gotten a lot more complex. There’s no way this meeting can continue..

We continued discussing without any rest, but there was still no conclusion. Afterwards we just decided on directly confronting the issue, which is how things have progressed up until today.

    ………………

    …………

    ……

A table has been temporarily set up in the reception hall. A beautiful young girl is sitting across from me. The colour of her hair transitions from beautiful white to vibrant red. This young girl is the Tengu tribe’s representative, the fabled Momiji.

She is looking at me arrogantly and greeted me in a bold tone.

「Demon Lord Rimuru, nice to meet you. I have come in place of the chief of Tengu Tribe. My name is Momiji, I look forward to our future interaction.」

「You are too kind. I am Rimuru who just became a Demon Lord. What you see now is my human form, but I’m actually a slime. I’m practically a pacifist, so you can discuss with me if you ever run into any trouble.」

「You may spare the concern. It is truly impressive that you’ve united Jura Great Forest in this short time. I acknowledge that you are the ruler of this forest, so I hope you will be a good neighbour. However, do not interfere with us.」

Momiji declares in front of the many executives of mine. Shion was about to react as her body shook a bit. But surprisingly she endured it. I didn’t tell her about the whole story, so it must have been Shion herself who decided to hold back. It seems that there has been some change in her mind that she’s no longer pursuing every minor matter. That’s a good sign, but it’s also a bit eerie. I hope she won’t endure too much and have an outbreak someday.

And about this Momiji, she’s looking quite nervous while waiting for my response. It would not have been noticed if I hadn’t pointed it out. While she looks quite casual and relaxed, internally she is probably on the verge of being crushed by extreme unease. That’s probably because she couldn’t tell whether I am friend or foe.

If that’s the case, all you guys need to do is show your willingness for allegiance. But how could such a thing be allowed by their prideful race? After all, an inexperienced leader is done for if she’s looked down on by others. I can understand her sentiment. But speaking of this, the young warriors of the Tengu tribe do all seem to have given their fullest loyalty to Momiji.

   

「I see. I understand what you are getting at. We don’t intend to interfere too much. I believe Benimaru here has also explained, we just want to conduct some road construction work at the foot of Coscia mountain. There’s also another thing that I want to confirm with you, will you give the high orcs the permission to stay now that they’ve moved their settlement to the lower mountain region?」

 

「Alright, all of these are fine. We’ve never claimed ownership to the resources of the mountain and forests, so they can do what they wish with the minerals. Those things are beyond our ownership. We simply dislike being interfered with, that is all.」

About that…… The lower mountain region is part of the Jura Great Forest, so I expected that she would complain about it. While bracing myself for their answer, it seems that they don’t have a problem with it either.

   

If that’s the case, what could the Tengu tribe really be on guard about? It seems that Alvis also dislikes them a lot, could it be some conflict with Beast King Karion? I’m rather mindful of it, so I decide to cut to the chase.

「About that, I’m not sure what you guys are wary of, but we really don’t hope to be hostile against you.」

「Why should I believe you?」

   

「Hmm, even if you were to claim that we have ambitions to expand our territory, do you really have any evidence to warrant your suspicion?」

Momiji turns to me immediately upon hearing this, trying to determine whether we are friendly or hostile. Then she replies boldly:

「Aren’t you guys on good terms with that sly bird lady Frey? Her desire to usurp our land is the best evidence!」

The so called unforeseeable surprise[97] perfectly represents this type of situation.

「Time out! (In Engrish)」[98]

「Tamu what now? What does that mean?」

「Time out means time out. Please hold up while I discuss with my men for a while, that’s what it means!」

 

I gather all the executives and begin to discuss. Momiji agreed without hesitation, but it seemed to have been mixed with some complaints... I must have heard wrong. While leaving aside Momiji who’s muttering something, we gathered in a circle.

「Right, what do you guys think?」

「Ex-Demon Lord Frey’s territory is connected with the Coscia mountain, so it wouldn’t be unheard of if she has caused conflict with the Tengu Tribe.」

   

To my question, Souei quickly replies.

Indeed, I check the map in my mind as I thought so. The Tengu’s residence is not within the Jura Great Forest and therefore not within any Demon Lord’s agreement of protection. They are very easily invaded by others.

「But, what could have been the reason?」

「Indeed, there’s no reason to invade.」

   

To my question, Benimaru followed up. He has gone to the actual location and knew that there weren’t any resources there.

「I’ve heard something before. It is rumored that Frey likes to go to move around locations with high altitude. Perhaps it is just as her nickname 『Sky Queen』 suggests, could she be trying to move her city to the highest location?」

Hakurou pondered while raising the case, but it still sounded a bit weird. Since according to Benimaru, only by going through the cave at the mountain top will you reach the arcadia that is the hidden residence of the Tengu tribe——In other words, it is actually in a tiny alternate dimension. I figure that would be quite different from the city that Frey would hope for.

「Hmmm——」

Everyone fell silent while contemplating. And then——

「You people——Stop treating me like air!」

「Uhh!」

I got spooked when someone suddenly shouted next to me. Momiji had come over to vent her rising frustration. Now I can’t pretend that I’ve not heard her. So I decide to give up struggling and return to my seat.

I open up directly facing Momiji:

「I have a question to ask. Has Frey ever schemed against the Tengu domain for the purpose of expanding?」

「Ah? What nonsense is that——」

Momiji looks at me dumbfounded. But after realizing that I was serious, she mutters:「You gotta be joking……」 I see that we seem to be developing a grave misunderstanding, so to alleviate that, I ask her to give a detailed explanation of her own situation. Here’s what Momiji has to say:

The place Frey has had her eyes on is the capital of Sorcerer’s Dynasty Sarion, 「City embraced by the divine tree, Elmin Sarion」. She’s not pursuing territory, but height. Can’t believe that’s actually her goal. It’s quite like Frey’s style, and it’s not joking around.

Judging by scale alone, Sarion is undoubtedly a powerful nation with military power exceeding that of Frey. However, though the Sarion army can utilize its geographic advantage to look down on land armies from above, they couldn’t avoid the harsh battle against the great army of Frey who can fly freely in the sky. In other words, Frey has not given up on the divine tree. It was then that Frey took interest in the Tengu tribe. She wanted to recruit the powerful Tengu race to bolster her arsenal against Sarion.

However, the Tengu are a prideful race. They wouldn’t listen to Frey’s command that easily. On the other hand, Sarion has also predicted how the Tengu would act. They simply observed the other two factions battling each other until they deplete their strength. Sarion didn’t intend to collaborate in fighting their enemy, but sat and enjoyed the profit (of their conflict). Of course, Frey also realized this and didn’t make a move without caution. And so, a twisted triangle relationship was thus formed……

It was then that the war between me and Clayman broke out, and soon enough Karion and Frey became Demon Lord Milim’s subjects. A powerful force was thus born. One that the Tengu tribe is unable to defend against. Everyday since then they’ve been discussing where to migrate to in the future.

   

Benimaru and the others happened to visit at the time. The unlucky part was that the Beastketeer Alvis was with them. It has caused Momiji to have misunderstood that we are quietly pressuring them.

「What’s the situation on Frey-san’s side?」

I ask Geld. He was in charge of the construction of their new capital, so Frey probably has made many requests from him. Among my allies, he is the man most familiar with Frey.

「Yes sir, about this Frey-sama, she’s very satisfied with Rimuru-sama’s design. She’s even able to communicate smoothly with Myrd-san who doesn’t like to talk, even holding detailed discussions in the past.」

Oh, so she can even communicate with Myrd. I’m rather impressed by Frey.

 

「I see. Then she probably won’t be interested in the divine tree.」

   

「Indeed…… Actually speaking of that, Frey-sama’s interest has turned to——I’ve spoken too much——」

「Hmm? What happened to Frey’s interest?」

   

「Yes sir, actually……. We’ve not seen Milim-sama for a while. Frey-sama who was responsible for educating her didn’t pay attention for a second and she ran off to god knows where——」

Ah, right. I know where she is. But, I’m gonna pretend I know nothing of it. The saying goes 「Don’t go look for trouble yourself」, I don’t want to get dragged in that mess.

「——So that’s how it is, Frey-sama’s new hobby…… Or rather, focus, I think has been her search for Demon Lord Milim-sama.」

 

Geld’s explanation ends there.

The skyscrapers of the new capital——That gigantic building that reaches for the sky has completely mesmerized Frey. Surely at this point, comparing it to any other city would just be stupid, so she must have lost interest in them as well. Compared to that, Milim is the bigger problem.

After which, Momiji absorbed the entirety of our conversation. The dichotomy between her imagination and the reality is so large to have caused her to become speechless, not knowing how to react. I guess that should be the case. That’s just how the reality really is. They were just keeping up their guard against a certain enemy that may cause crisis to their race, but it turns out she has switched her focus long ago. Learning this today will definitely prompt people to try and escape reality.

   

「——I understand the whole thing now. Anyway, that’s how it is. It is enough for me to have been able to resolve your misunderstanding.」

It is likely because the Tengu has kept away from the world and are less informed on current affairs. They were still worried about being surrounded by enemies. Such anxiety caused Momiji to misjudge. Indeed, she had her reasons to make such judgement under those circumstances.

「I can’t believe that it was me who thought too much…… Mother has always said that I was worrying too much about the matter……」

   

After finishing her words, Momiji felt relieved. She collapsed on the spot having been so exhausted. Seeing how she reacted, we’ve gained a very profound insight into how terrifying it is to cause too much misunderstanding.

    ***

Since the misunderstanding has been resolved, the meeting quickly concluded. In place of the frustrated Momiji, a young warrior of the Tengu tribe confirmed the content of our pact. I thought that he was just Momiji’s guard, but it seems that he’s also a capable civil official.

The tunnel part is reserved for now. Their argument is that if we cannot prove that the construction will be absolutely safe, they will not allow us to work. I found it reasonable and easily agreed, so there aren’t any problems with that. We still need to talk with the executives from Sarion regarding us building a tunnel, but we will plan for that after the train development has concluded. There’s no immediate need to make a decision at this point in time. The Tengu tribe hopes that we will not interfere with them, but they only said so fearing that we might rally and invade them.

Now that our misunderstanding has been resolved, there’s no reason why we shouldn’t communicate. And so we reached common ground, at last where we will help each other out no matter what problem we run into.

「——Then, is that everything?」

「Yes. We are extremely grateful for your understanding and participation in this helpful meeting with us. Thank you, Demon Lord Rimuru-sama.」

The young warrior of the Tengu tribe bows to me courteously. Momiji is no longer misunderstanding us and we’ve also signed a pact. The only thing left is——

The relationship between Hakurou and Momiji as well as the marriage between Benimaru and her.

We’ve discussed a ton last night to no avail. From what happened today, Momiji seemed to have suspected we are enemy throughout the session, but those misunderstandings have now been resolved. Now then, shouldn’t we let the people involved sort things out by themselves?

Just as I was worried about how to approach the subject, the young Tengu warrior takes out a sealed envelope.

「There’s one more thing. Please have a look at this. It contains a letter written by our leader Kaede-sama to your highness Rimuru.」

As he finished, he handed over the letter to me gently. Rigurdo takes the letter and hands it to Shuna for her to open. She begins to read the content of the letter out loud.

The letter opens with some abstruse words of greeting followed by some humble writing that seems to be trying to get on the recipient's good side. But then the word choices become more and more casual. As Shuna reads it, a sense of confusion arises on her face too.

「——Even though she’s a headache to deal with and misunderstood you, I’ll entrust my daughter to you. That child even bragged about letting Benimaru-dono fall in love with her before, she really doesn’t mean any harm——」

 

Eh, are you sure this is a letter for me? No no, no no no, it doesn’t seem to be no matter how you see it. Had I known that this is the content of the letter from the start, I would have the honor guard leave the scene…… But it’s all too late at this point.

「M-Mother, what is this——?」

 

Momiji who was on the ground suddenly jumps up to take the letter from Shuna’s hand. Eh, that’s so rude. But I can’t really blame her——

 

Since I can’t blame her, I’ll just pretend I saw nothing. If I switched places with Momiji right now, god knows what type of thing I would have done. This has long since passed a matter concerning reputation, and is challenging the limit of shame.

「S-So there are actually two letters! That’s so rash, mother dear……」

 

Momiji cried out loud and collapsed on the ground, burying her face in her hands.

Ah, I see…… It seems that the letter for Hakurou was mixed with the letter for me. Missy, please stay strong.

While the Tengu tribesmen are coming and trying to comfort Momiji, it seems to have been doing the opposite effect. It’s best to stay away from her for now. But it was at that instant——

「Hehe, that does seem like something she would do.」

Hakurou walks towards Momiji with a wry smile. He then takes over the letter held tight in her hand and scanned through it.

「I see how it is now. 『——Although that child possesses powerful strength, her techniques are below expectations. I hope that my senior and the father of that child——「Kenki」 Hakurou-dono will instruct her by hand and train her well——To my beloved husband, Kaede——』 I can’t believe that girl is still in love with me. Hehehe, living a bit longer does have its plus side.」

Upon saying so, Hakurou begins to laugh joyfully.

「A-Are you….. My father?」

   

「Indeed. I am your father, Hakurou.」

   

「D-Dad——!」

Tears begin to drop from her black eyes that share a striking resemblance with Hakurou’s. Momiji crushes him in a hug. Hakurou and Momiji have given us a moving scene of a father-daughter reunion. Momiji is no longer holding any suspicion against us or Hakurou.

「Momiji, I am quite strict when it comes to training people.」

「Got it——」

 

「That’s good. You will overcome the challenges with flying colours and have young master fall in love with you!」

「Yes!!」

 

Hmm, ehehhh——!

I nod quite frequently with a moved heart when hearing their conversation, but without my notice, the conversation started to stray into some strange direction.

What is this called again? ‘You have to fill the moat before taking the castle?’[99] Hakurou is usually very calm, but now with the sudden appearance of a dad, he has suddenly turned into the idiot dad that spoils his kid.

 

「Oi, Hakurou——」

Benimaru’s words can’t seem to reach him as the two are enjoying their own little universe. It happens at that moment——

 

Shuna adds up whispering: 「Ah, there’s also this——」Everyone’s eyes fall on Shuna. She doesn’t mind a bit as she gazes at Benimaru.

   

「Nii-san, Alvis-sama has left you a message.」

With these words said, Shuna look up to Benimaru directly.

「What is it?」

He asked rather unpleasantly. Hmm, I understand how you feel. I think he hopes whatever it is to be put on hold for a while. However, the cruel reality is that Shuna rolls her eyes and announce the message.

Its content is as follows——

   

「Benimaru-sama, I’ve made up my mind. I wish to triumph over Momiji-sama and become your wife, and even if I am not so lucky, I still have the option of concubine. I will not give up, please make your resolve.」

——Shuna announced it while imitating Alvis’s tone. The honor guards gasp. The executives are all worked up by it.

「.........」

Benimaru, on the other hand, has his arms crossed and remained silent throughout. You should be getting a bad headache right now! Benimaru sure is something.

——Actually, hold on.

He has actually been petrified and shocked speechless. His prowess in the battlefield is next to none, but his ability wasn’t enough to handle this situation——I seem to have discovered an unexpected weak point of Benimaru.

Sorry, Benimaru. My experience with love affairs is not enough——It’s zero, I swear!——to be of any help.

「Ah, speaking of this, it’s so hard being a popular guy……」

I couldn’t help but blurt out,

「Rimuru-sama, are you serious? You aren’t exactly outside his league……」

 

Seriously? I don’t even have a gender. Gobta sure is an idiot.

「Kufufufufu, I have no interest in getting into any relationship. My heart only belongs to Rimuru-sama.」

No, I’ve heard nothing——I’m not interested either, so you can do whatever you want. I’m definitely not thinking about something else. I start to catch up on the whispers of the executives.

「As expected from Benimaru-dono, he’s so popular. I heard that the subordinate of my sister also really likes Benimaru-san, but they are both having a hard time to win over Alvis-dono and Momiji-dono.」

「Are you talking about Touka? Actually, not just Touka, even Saika has a crush on him too.」

「That’s right, I heard that they don’t want to compete with Souka and so they gave up on Souei-san!」

「What nonsense are you on about——」

「No no no, it’s all true.」

Gabil and Souei are whispering to each other.

However, what Gobta then said is the key.

「Does that mean, Benimaru’s gonna have a harem? I’m so jealous!」

After that was pointed out, I suddenly began to see things in the same light.

What the hell? I’m so envious! I’m starting to get jealous of Benimaru as well. Alvis-san is the beautiful and reliable big-sis type girlfriend while Momiji is the cute and tsundere imouto (lil sis). Not only these two, there are many other girls who also like Benimaru. Gobta had a point, in a sense it is just like he is collecting a harem.

But, Benimaru himself seems to be quite troubled over it…….

「A harem, that does make me envious.」

「Heh, that may not be the case. Despite how Benimaru looks, he’s a pure-hearted virgin that doesn’t know how to deal with girls. He may look like a chad to everyone else, but internally he must be very troubled.」

Gabil looked at him with jealousy while Souei gave his response. I think he nailed the interpretation. Even if there are many female pursuers, they are just a cause for concern to Benimaru. Moreover, he will be really mindful of how Shuna sees him. Benimaru seems to be somewhat of a siscon, surely his mind is shouting “oh shit, oh shit” internally.

It is then that Geld interjects and adds on:

「I think this is a wonderful matter. Benimaru is very manly, so naturally females in this town would admire him. Alvis-dono is naturally strong as the head of the Beastketeers while Momiji-dono is Hakurou-san’s daughter, both are impeccable choices. I need to follow in his footsteps.」

Geld apparently supports Benimaru in having both wife and concubine. But whether he will have a harem or not, he hasn’t given a comment on the matter. Compared to women, Geld seems to focus more on work, so I’m really skeptical about whether his claim about following Benimaru’s footsteps is true or not.

By the way, Geld is actually quite popular too. He is a serious man of few words with an unyielding sense of responsibility. Not only among the female High Orcs, many women from the other races also admire him a lot. That’s why if Geld ever does take a chance, he will probably end up with a girlfriend pretty fast.

Seeing how Geld reacted, Gabil has something to say too.

「No no no, Geld-dono is good enough already. Touka and the rest are just as how I described, they won’t even look at me…… For some reason the subordinates who admire me are all men——」

   

「You must have not met the right person. I can relate to your feeling to some extent.」

 

Geld nods. Indeed, his workplace is mainly the construction field which has a higher percentage of males. Monsters like me who have no gender and are as hard to differentiate as some amphibian may be exceptions, but if in a working environment there are female coworkers to work alongside the males, they might just be a bit more motivated. That part we will have to discuss later.

「That’s not really the case, there are several female dwarven herbalists working with me. If it is true we would have the chance to see to each other——」

「Then there shouldn’t be much of an issue.」

Hold up hold up, isn’t there still a problem? They are of different race after all. It’s not as if the problem is solved if the number matches up, right?

「There’s quite the big issue actually. Those ladies said that 『I can’t seem to physically accept something like a lizard』, that’s why I’m not popular at all…….」

「I see——」

    ……

Uh, uhmm. I’m a bit speechless. It seems that his obstacle is bigger than just the race difference. There’s no wonder why Gabil can only choose to give up.

「——Well, it is supposed to only be like that, but Nansou and Hakusou often get invited to meals and picnics in the forest! That really frustrates me——」

Ah! Now we can’t use racial difference as an excuse…….

「T-That’s just……」

Even Geld ran out of explanations and is troubled by how he can comfort Gabil.

「Yep…… That’s why I want to try a human form too. My old man got more handsome through 『Transformation』, but I may have a chance as well!」

No way, there’s no such chance. It’s not just about appearance. I’ve lived for nearly forty years without a girlfriend, despite looking very handsome!

The point is——

「How boring. That’s all because you never took the initiative yourself.」

Right, Souei-kun, bingo! That’s exactly the case. Just being a nice guy being a bystander is not enough. How will any girl fall for Gabil if he only complains like that all the time. Don’t fantasize about girls coming after you, instead you should man up and take the initiative…… Eh, though I only realized this after becoming a slime……

「T-There’s no such thing, I mean, you’re not wrong, but——」

「Souei-san has a point! I’ve heard the dwarven big sis saying 『Gazart is so cool~』, 『Right right~』, 『The quiet type character is the most attractive!』, 『He’s like my pet lizard, so cute』 to praise Gabil-san’s subordinate. That’s why I don’t think the problem is appearance!」

Ah, Gobta is so straight-forward. Garzat is a subordinate of Gabil and a member of 「Hiryuu」. That man is of few words and is good with spear arts, but he’s also very clumsy. That’s why I didn’t let him participate in the research program but instead act as the bodyguard of the researchers and the herbalists. It is obvious that he was originally a lizardman, after his evolution to dragonewt nowadays he looks quite similar to Gabil whose appearance resembles that of a lizard. Now even appearance can no longer be an excuse, Gobta sure is quite mean.

Gabil seems very frustrated, and Souei dishes out the decisive blow.

「——Moreover, it is actually surprisingly easy to get the affection of women.」

「W-What do you mean!」

How is that possible——I ask based on this thought, and as a result Souei responded with something extremely unexpected with a cold face.

「There was a female knight who seemed to have had some sort of misunderstanding and developed strong feelings for me.」

Souei commented so almost like a complaint with disdain in his tone.

「Are you serious! What did you do?」

「Oh oh?」

「That sounds so interesting!」

「Please give us the details!」

Souei’s words have also caught my interest as I was eavesdropping on the side. About that female knight…… Right, what did Souei do to that lady called Ritase? I was curious but forgot to ask. For some reason, she blushes every time she sees Souei, surely it can't be that……

「Rimuru-sama is also interested?」

「Of course I am. Moreover, you haven’t reported about the situation yet……」

「Oh, about that, so basically, I used 『Sticky Steel String』 a bit——」

Using 「Sticky Steel String」 a bit for what——As I thought so, a sudden surge of killing aura appears behind me followed by a loud cough.

「Ahem!」

We were whispering just now when we suddenly froze to switch back to a serious expression. As I shout internally “Oh snap” I turn back to slime form in secret to flee, but was hugged by a pair of white and slim hands.

「Rimuru-sama, you sure like jesting around. Let’s stop talking about that and discuss about my brother’s affair.」

Oh yeah, there’s also that. I accidentally went on a tangent. I will die a horrible death if Shuna gets pissed. We decide to drop the small talk and contemplate seriously.

Then——Although I said I would contemplate seriously, there’s now way I can give an immediate answer.

「Benimaru, what do you think yourself?」

「About that, it is really too early to discuss it, that’s all I can say. I think one spouse should be enough.」

He does have a point. Of course he will feel bewildered to be suddenly engaged. If someone asked me to accept an arranged marriage I would definitely refuse. That might be how they did it in the old days, but we are living in the age of free love after all. Moreover——

「Basically, us greater Majins can’t bear children so easily. Some may find several partners to pass their seed and have them compete against each other, but I’m really not interested in that whole thing. That’s why I don’t want any concubines.」

In front of us, Benimaru says so with determination. Momiji looks at him with sparkling eyes.

「Which means, you won’t have a harem.」

Not just Harem, we don’t even support polygamy. Unless the situation forces that to happen, for instance if there are too many widows, otherwise our nation does not apply such a system. Just as I thought the whole thing was over, even more trouble emerges.

「I understand, then I will take on Alvis-san’s challenge. The one who is going to become Benimaru-sama’s wife will be me!」

Momiji declares with motivation.

That’s not how you get in a relationship——Although that’s how I see it, I suspect that Benimaru has already given up and is not saying anything.

「Rimuru-sama, what do you think?」

Why are you asking me, you can only let her do whatever she wants.

「That’s fine I guess? You shouldn’t just duel each other, but put in effort to let the person you like fall in love with yourself. But, if he still doesn't like you, you may just have to give up.」

As long as you don’t become a stalker or something like that, there isn’t much of a problem.

「I understand, then I’ll do just as you said——」

As Momiji finishes her words, Shuna cracks a smile. Eh? Why do I have an ominous feeling……

「I won’t lose to you, Shuna-sama!」

 

「Same here, Shion.」

Shion and Shuna said so while giving each other a smile. I’m very confused, but I also got to flee from Shuna’s hands.

By the way, Alvis has always been in a state of observing, it is from today onward that she begins to take action and tries to win Benimaru’s heart desperately. Momiji is not backing down either and goes forth to battle against Alvis. The rest of the females who admired Benimaur ceased to remain silent too and joined the competition one after another. It became obvious to see that the battle for Benimaru among the female army has become more and more dire.

——From this day onward, there began a bizarre custom in Tempest Federation that is to force the person you have crush on into submission through a display of strength.

The battle for free love thus unveils.

Epilogue

Concluding Meeting

Edited by: Squishy

Proofread by: Omnipotentbeing

It was near evening on the last day of the reception ceremony that we concluded our meeting with the Tengu tribe. All the executives had gathered in the meeting room after a somewhat early dinner——I was looking forward to that part——and I wanted everyone to give a report on their recent activities on this rare occasion. I’ve also invited certain guests to this meeting as well. There are Veldora and Ramiris, accompanied by her servants Beretta and Treyni-san. Milim will be officially visiting in three days. Fearing the reveal of her recent activities, she quickly returned. It was a smart move considering there’s no telling whether Frey will scold Milim or not, but keeping Milim in this town will definitely anger her. I don’t really want to get involved in that whole mess.

Right, there’s however one more guest——

「I want to introduce someone before the meeting starts. He is a candidate for Executive, Myourmiles-kun. If the opening festival in three days goes without a hitch, I plan to officially appoint him as the Minister of Finance (Head of Financial Management Department). I hope everyone can get acquainted with him beforehand.」

I declare so, since everyone is here, might as well take the chance to introduce him. Myourmiles can also summarize the whole ordeal (regarding the festival) and give his explanation...

「I-I am Garde Myourmiles. I am quite nervous right now given the important duty assigned to me by Rimuru-sama. Nonetheless, I hope to have a good relationship with all executives in the future.」

Myourmiles is quite obese, so he doesn’t look tense at all and it’s bold of him to have greeted them so daringly. That being said, he does look more nervous than usual. Despite being a boss in the underworld, he can’t use that status nearly as effectively when dealing with actual Greater Majins. After introducing him to everyone, Myourmiles is seated next to Rigurdo, and we cut straight to the chase.

「Then Myourmiles-kun, could I trouble you to explain the situation to everyone?」

「Roger that. I’ll do my best with my limited ability——」

Upon my instruction, he stands up to explain how the opening festival will be run. Two days from now, on the evening before the opening festival, the town will celebrate the eve of the festival. The guests will consist not only of those invited to the main festival, but also the visiting merchants and adventurers responsible for protecting them. We plan to offer free meals and wine to these visitors.

Of course, this event will be announced to the public, so we can expect some peasants from the neighbouring countries to be coming as well. Since they may very well be our future customers, we will have to welcome them with open arms.

As for the guest hotel, we will be hosting a night feast there for any royalty and nobles. Regarding the dishes that will be served to said elite, they will be made between Shuna and Yoshida-san. Since most of the food prepared by them will likely be new cuisine, I’m also looking forward to it. Further, we have changed the feast serving style to that of a buffet so everyone can try a wider variety of cuisines without needing to eat too much.

Now regarding the main event, i.e. the opening festival.

I will be giving a speech on stage in the morning. I’ve thought through this over and over, and I've come to the conclusion that we cannot skip this part considering that I am going to announce to the public that I’ve become a Demon Lord. And since all my executives and guests here are aware of the situation, my proposal is approved.

Next, we will be hosting a martial tournament at the colosseum. But we don’t plan to just let them stand there and enjoy the one competition. After all, it is our priority to let the other nations and towns get to know our country as more than just violent, so we can’t have them stick to the web novel and have the readers read a boring ass tournament arc from start to finish around to only watch the tournament from start to finish.

That’s why we have also planned to perform music pieces at the recently built classy opera house for them to enjoy. As for what type of program would be shown there; I have no clue. While I am somewhat worried about it, Myourmiles is very confident.

「——I will use the opportunity to show everyone that Rimuru-sama is also a man of culture.」

A cunning grin emerges on Myourmiles’ face while saying that. Almost as if she’s playing along with his scheme, Shion seems to be grinning as well. Could it be that…?

There’s no use worrying about it. Myourmiles has already given me the guarantee, so I’ll just take his word for it. After everyone finishes lunch, we will be holding a technological presentation at the museum. Gabil and Vesta will be explaining the history of the healing potion to everyone; Kurobee and Garm will be showcasing various gears.

By the way, the opera house and museum will only be open for civilian use on the second day of the festival. On the first day, we will only be allowing royalty or nobility in. After all, there will be security concerns, so it is most effective to separate the two groups of visitors.

And then for the second day:

We will be watching the main contestants (after the elimination round) of the tournament. Then, in the afternoon we will be hosting a delightful festival of cultural exchange——an activity in name only, which is basically just to serve as an excuse for free roaming.

I will be staying at the VIP section of the colosseum ready to discuss any matters brought forth by whomever wants to meet me. Myourmiles will be in charge of moderating this part, so all I need to do is to relax and enjoy the tournament. We will be assigning guides to guests based on the number of invitations, so we hope everyone will be able to shop and have fun during the festival, visit and savor our exceptional hot spring street or finish viewing the tournament. It would be wonderful if everyone has an excellent experience.

And on the third day, we will be displaying the highly anticipated labyrinth available to the public. In the morning they can watch the finale of the tournament, and in the afternoon they can watch an adventurers’ walkthrough of labyrinth.

「Even without me, you guys were still able to build an absolutely majestic colosseum.」

Geld remarks, relieved. He’s quite reassured to find that there are suitable successors for him.

「Indeed. You and Myrd’s apprentice Gobkyu worked hard to build it. It doesn’t look rushed at all, and its durability also appears to be quite decent. Although, while it might be a different case if the executives dueled each other, it is more than enough for individuals below Rank A to battle.」

In terms of safety, the colosseum is at the level where it should be able to stand up against greater spirits such as the flame giant (Ifirit). But, it probably wouldn’t be able to hold if hit in some particular (weak) spots. Not to worry though, I will be present on the day of the main event and plan to apply a thin barrier of 「Absolute Defense」just in case. That’s why, as long as nothing too major happens, the audience should all be safe and sound.

「GAHAHAHA! By the way, I’ve also come up with the ultimate flavour with my teppanyaki! Everyone should look forward to it!」

Ah, so he hasn’t forgotten about it. Given that his spirit to open a store is so high, we can only have him participate with his identity hidden. Speaking of which, for some reason Myourmiles has become quite acquainted with Veldora. He has been receiving many difficult tasks (favors) from Veldora, but now he seems to have gotten used to dealing with that dragon. Myourmiles is really something else. It truly impresses me as this guy is far stronger than I previously imagined.

Alright, that concludes the explanations.

Personnel who were previously on an expedition such as Diablo, Hakurou, and Geld appear intrigued by the proceedings. Their unfortunate absence seems to frustrate them a bit. I feel that I should give these three a bonus reward for their efforts. I’ll give something to Geld when he finishes his work, and as for Diablo and Hakurou, they’ve already drafted the perfect battle plan.

With this in mind, I glance around at my executives thoughtfully.

「Our plan is going smoothly; does anyone have any complaints?」

If not, we can move on to Souei’s report——

「Yes!」

——but I reached that conclusion too fast apparently. Ramiris raises her hand, rather vigorously. She appears to have a question, but it’s probably nothing significant.

「What is it, Ramiris-kun?」

「Ehh, I’ve got a question.」

「That’s what I just asked.」

「It’s about the bottom level of the labyrinth……」

Ramiris pauses to take a peek at Veldora. It is followed by Veldora’s loud laughter in an attempt to hide something.

「GAHAHAHA! No, there’s nothing there. Nothing important at all! Isn’t there a forest at level 95? For some reason, the forest has been growing and has now invaded all the way up to level 71.」

Veldora chortles 「Miscalculation, miscalculation!」

Levels 91 to 94 were already isolated from the outside so it was not affected by the forest’s take over, but the unprotected levels now look like primal forests as the ventilation system for filtering magicules had been affected.

「Hold up hold up, now we have to clean all that up! That’ll take ages!」

「Right. That’s why I’ve come to discuss this with you!」

Ramiris has decided to just be frank about it. Even though the issue is quite baffling, this is entirely due to Veldora.

Despite already being the person at fault, Veldora digs his grave deeper with: 「Not only that, there is another problem.」 While I don’t really want to ask, what has to be done has to be done.

With such a mindset, I query,「....... What is that?」. Yet Veldora’s answer is rather surprising.

「We didn’t find any suitable monsters to be level bosses. Which is a problem I need to discuss with you.」

Fortunately, he’s not asking about anything dumber.

It appears that the forest consumed the labrinth’s magicules too quickly for any stronger monsters to be created. Which is probably why there hasn’t been a monster born strong enough to be a boss of the bottom levels.

There was a Rank A monster—— a Tempest Serpent that is now the lord of level 40. Initially, it was Veldora and Ramiris who argued that we shouldn’t use trash like that for the position, but nowadays they want me to give it back to them, something I don’t plan to do.

「I want to rebuild the Elemental Golem. That’s why I’m hoping you can help prepare some materials for me.」

「Just find a suitable lord candidate for me. Also, remember to clean the primal forest first.」

「.......」

 

I understand what Ramiris meant. We only plan to make the first 50 levels public this time, so we can think of ideas for that another time. As for Veldora’s proposal, I don’t have to listen to him. Since there is still time, I’ll tell him to figure out a way himself. But just as I am about to refuse—— three voices are raised all at the same time:

「If that’s the case, there are some pretty suitable candidates.」

 

「Rimuru-sama, how about we hand the work to those people?」

「My master, there are indeed some pretty good candidates——」

They are Shuna, Treyni-san and Ranga.

Shuna says that wight Adalman is suitable for the role. Hearing her comment, Gabil nods in agreement.

「His subordinates are all afraid of light, so they like to stay in caves or places away from the sun. The inside of the labyrinth should be a pretty good place for them.」

Aside from Adalman, his subordinates can’t leave the sealed cave at all. It is said that they come out to stroll at night, and whenever a merchant runs into them, they usually all come to complain. That’s only natural; running into skeletons at night is guaranteed to make you piss yourself. Isolating them entirely in the labyrinth seems like a good idea actually.

「Besides, that guy practically treats Rimuru-sama as God, which is pretty intolerable……」

Shuna adds on, rather annoyed.
