They seem to worship me as their God, and considering Shuna is a miko-hime (shrine maiden), that probably is quite annoying. In that case, I decide to accept the proposal.

「Then let’s have Adalman as the boss of level 60. I’ll start preparing the materials so Ramiris can go create an Elemental Golem and I’ll tell Adalman to help as well.」

「Is that okay?」

「Should be fine. That guy’s specialty is knowledge. I think he can even help with researching.」

「I understand. Thanks a lot, Rimuru!」

And so, the search for a monster lord in levels 60 and 70 has been resolved. Next it’s Treyni-san’s turn to speak.

Since levels 71 to 80 have less vegetation, she asks for Zegion and Apito to guard the location.

「These two executives are able to summon their vassals (clansman), so exploration will be easier. Moreover——」

She peeks at Ramiris and then turns to me.

「If we can get him——Zegion, he should be able to fill the role as the boss of level 80. After all, he did a great job protecting the Treant before.」

Treyni-san says, smiling.

「I see……」

「Rimuru, that sounds perfect! Let me train that guy to become a warrior worthy of the title as the boss of level 80!」

Zegion indeed seems stronger than I imagined. When I last checked on him, he had already grown stronger than the Tempest Serpent of level 40. But, he is still just an insect, barely the size of a small animal!

It would probably be pretty hard to train him…… Never mind, all is well. I already know that Veldora is a weirdo anyway, so if he really wants to, sure.

   

「Right. Then, we can just do it your way.」

With my permission given, the problem is basically resolved instantly.

At last, we come to Ranga’s suggestion. The big boy sticks his head out of my shadow to talk:

「Master, the Youko (Monster Fox) that you left with me has awakened. It says that it really enjoys exploring the forest. I think it would be quite interested in managing it entirely.」

A small cute fox sits on his head waving four golden tails behind it. That really is an adorable creature!

 

「Do you want to give it a try?」

 

「I would like to!」

The small fox nods at me, eyes shining. Hmm, how cute indeed.

Since this small fox willingly accepted the job, I’ll just hand it over to it. If it doesn’t meet our expectations, we will just have to get rid of the forest. Otherwise it can just explore the forest for us and form animal passages within the labyrinth.

「Alright, then——」

I suddenly realize that there is a problem, when it was under Clayman’s rule, this small fox and Youko previously known as the “Nine-Headed Beast” didn’t actually have any name.

「Before that, let me give you a name. From today onward, you will be known as 『Kumara』.」

Just like naming a pet, I thoughtlessly just gave it a name. But I am no idiot; I’ve learnt the lesson about not losing massive amounts of magicule over naming. That’s why I’ve already set a limit——Eh, how strange?

My body suddenly feels exhausted. I couldn’t help but get unnerved.

《Notice. This is the effect of naming. Individual named 「Kumara」 has a massive pool of natural magicule storage. Thus the magicule consumption of said action has 「Exceeded Expectation」.》

I’ve been deceived by its miniature appearance. I now recall it to be some super rare incredible monster. It seems I got careless. Moreover, after being named, Kumara grows almost instantaneously, and the number of its tails increases from four all the way up to nine. In its battle against Ranga, it had three tails. And all these tails were able to summon monsters (magic beasts)[100] with special abilities. In other words, now it probably will be able to summon nine different beasts.

「Thank you, Rimuru-sama! I will do my best!」

Never mind, it’s fine. Since I’ve already named it, I can’t just undo it.

Either way, personally, I am safe and sound, so it seems everything is within the control of Wisdom King Raphael-sensei. The way it announced 「Exceeded Expectation」 didn’t sound shocked at all. It probably planned to transfer so many magicules from the beginning. Or else how could the newly named Kumara have grown another five tails?

《.......》

There’s no use playing dumb. I’ve seen through it all!

Kumara is absolutely delighted, so I’ll hand levels 81 to 90 to it. After all, there shouldn’t be many adventurers who will make it there, so it’d be fine to have Kumara as a monster lord. With that, the problems raised by Ramiris and Veldora have been resolved.

This labyrinth is our proud masterpiece, and the executives also seem to be looking forward to it, so we have to ensure the whole program remains on the right track.

With that thought, I pet Kumara on the head.

   

    ***

Finally, it seems that the report regarding the opening festival has now concluded.

Next would be the investigation mission I assigned to Souei recently; let’s hear the reports.

「Then Souei, I’ll trouble you to do the briefing.」

「Understood——」

Souei’s findings turn out to be unbelievable and far outside my predictions.

A certain criminal organization called 「Slave Trade Union」 has been eliminated by the 「Chosen Hero」. Additionally, the noblemen associated with them were reported to authorities as well. Viscount Kazak from Brumund Kingdom has also been arrested.

「Even the towns near Ingracia have been spreading this news. The『Slave Trade Union』 is an international criminal organization. They possessed armed militia consisting of many slave warriors. They even had magic beasts and Majins as slaves and their military power was said to be more than that of a small kingdom. But they were eliminated by the chosen hero and his companions——」

A slight smirk emerges on Souei’s face as he says so.

The Chosen Hero——”Shining” Masayuki, is said to be the most popular and allegedly, strongest man within the Western Nations. It seems that Hinata’s crown as the strongest has been replaced since her defeat by my hands.

Did becoming known as a defeated foe of the Demon Lord mean that she is no longer worthy to carry the hope of mankind? I feel somewhat sorry for Hinata; I hope she won’t hate me for that.

Oh yeah, that aside, I need to talk about this Masayuki. There is too little information so far to judge his personality and strength. But if his triumph over the 「Slave Trade Union」 and releasing elven slaves turns out to be true……

「It seems that several elves were captured by the trade union. Masayuki apparently is bring them to our kingdom.」

If that’s the case, I’d better give him my thanks. However, the problem is……

「How about it, Rimuru-sama? Before things get dicey, should I go and take care of him?」

「——No, don’t do that. I want to meet him. Maybe have a chat with him.」

   

「Understood. That guy seems to be marching under the banner of 『Eliminating the Demon Lord』, I was planning to show him who’s the boss and let him know his place.」

 

——Right, just as his words indicated, the Western Nations are all spreading the rumors that Masayuki is coming to eliminate me.

Souei smiles cruelly at my suggestion not to interfere. Speaking of which, as we are preparing the opening festival and dealing with such important national affairs, it would be very bad if we provoke the Chosen Hero. Not only Souei; but I’m afraid that the two warmongers Shion and Diablo would act preemptively.

「When the Chosen Hero Masayuki comes here, let me handle things. Any action against him is forbidden, understand?」

「「「Understood!」」」

You guys sure are enthusiastic. It’s only three days until the opening festival, and already, we have a problem.

The joyful atmosphere we worked so hard to build seems to have been completely wiped out by the others. I feel a little frustrated.

——Soon after——

Almost as if to blow away the tiny unease in my heart, the jolly festival unfolds——

Author’s afterword

Sorry to keep everyone waiting, here I bring you volume eight.

For those who have read (Web Novel) before, you will know this volume is the 「Opening of Monster City arc」. As for why the sudden title change of this volume, there is quite the story behind——

「Ahh, I will definitely finish up suuuuper fast this time and make the story short!」

「I’ve heard that line for too many times already. I won’t mind at this point no matter how long you want to write.」

With such words echoing by my ear, I grabbed my pen to write.

And as I wrote and wrote, the deadline arrived……

「Hey, there’s something I wish to discuss…….」

「Right right right, what do you want to discuss?」

「About that, I’ve written things a bit too long this time……」

「Oh shit, here we go again. I knew this is how things would have gone.」

Editor I-san replied rather unfazed by it.

But, there’s another twist coming!

   

「Can I make it into two parts?」

「Huh?」

 

「Even if I continue to write for another hundred pages or so, all I will end up doing is getting stuck at an awkward spot in the story. That’s why we should change our direction to instead make it into two parts this time, won’t that be great?」

「It’d better be! Seriously though, how did things end up like this——!」

We continued to have a very lovely conversation. In the end I was successfully in making editor I-san roll his eyes (and agree). Nicu job!

   

    ***

So yeah. I’ve been reflecting as well.

I’ve got no clue why things ended up like this myself, but I’m beginning to realize: isn’t it a bit too challenging for me to try shortening the story?

And so, I am currently focusing on finishing up the rest of the arc in volume nine 「Founding of Monster Kingdom」.

I will try my best not to turn it into a trilogy. I look forward to your feedback in the future as well.

See you in the next volume then!
